loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen, tiene 34 años de edad. Ella esta llevando un curso de Cajero promotor, que tiene una duración de seis meses. Maria del Carmen se esfuerza mucho para poder atender a su familia, atender un negocio y estudiar a la vez. 
Paralelo a sus estudios ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de belleza, con éste ingreso ella apoya a su esposo en los gastos familiares.
Una de sus metas es poder trabajar en una entidad financiera para lo cual se prepara mucho.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la cancelación del curso que lleva de Cajero promotor.
texts.en: Maria del Carmen is 34 years old. She is studying to be a cashier, which takes 6 months. Maria del Carmen works hard to be able to attend to her family, her business, and study. Along with her studies she sells clothing and beauty products, and with this income she supports her husband with the family expenses. One of her goals is to be able to work in a financial entity which is for what she is preparing herself. The loan will be used to invest in paying the monthly payments of her studies.

loans.use: to invest in paying the monthly payments of her studies.

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moureen is 22 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 4 years, Moureen has been working hard to manage her market stall with fresh food, which vends raw bananas (matooke).

To help expand her business, Moureen has requested a loan of 1000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock butches of raw bananas to attract her customers, and will help Moureen to generate greater profits and she will use some of the money to take care of her kid. Moureen hopes that in the future she will be able to are to open up a Bank account to start saving for the future use.

Moureen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock butches of raw bananas to attract her customers,

loans.name: Lovely Rose

texts.en:
Lovely Rose is 36 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Lovely Rose is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lovely Rose has been raising livestock for 2 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 34 years old and married with six children, five of whom are still in school. Jean works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles and other snack foods.

Jean has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles and other snack foods.

loans.name: Perveeza

texts.en:
Perveeza is 31 years old, married lady woman; shown in the photo with her husband. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Some years ago she started her business of tailoring for running her household activities.

At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested for a Murabaha loan of 30000 PKR to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for sewing more dresses on time to get a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on providing quality life for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for sewing more dresses on time to get a boost in her earnings.

loans.name: Dan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dan is the Thai ethnic woman. She has been joined in the program of M7-MFI since 2013. Her family consists of four members including her husband, her son, and her daughter, living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding. Each year the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and a small, saved amount. She wants to buy a breeding goat to raise, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose. She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding, with high productivity to get a high profit to improve the living standard of the family.

loans.use: to buy a breeding goat.

loans.name: Efia

texts.fr: Efia est une veuve femme  résidant à Baguida avec un seul enfant à charge. Efia est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend ainsi donc là. Pour financer son achat, Efia nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue de bien revendre et de réaliser plus de bénéfice puis pouvoir aussi relancer son activité afin de soutenir au mieux son enfant et lui permettre une bonne éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Efia is a widow living in Baguida with one dependent child. Efia is a charcoal retailer who gets her supplies twice a month at the market and resells it there.  To finance her purchase, Efia needs this loan to order bags of charcoal in order to increase sales and profits. She wants to revive her business to better support her child and provide him a good education.

loans.use: to buy 08 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Janneth Geovanny

texts.es: Janeth tiene 39 años de edad, estado civil casada su esposo se dedica a la construcción es albañil, tiene 3 hijos Glenda de 20 años, Kevin de 16 y Matshury de 12 años están estudiando en unidades educativas del sector, su tienda inicio hace una año con este ingreso puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar en este momento que se encuentra sin trabajo. Janeth compraría con el dinero  una vitrina para mostrar pan cree así que aumentaría sus ganancias con la venta del pan y podría seguir ayudando a pagar los gastos de alimentación, educación, salud de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Janeth is 39 years old. She is married, and her husband makes a living as a construction worker. She has 3 children: Glenda who is 20 years old, Kevin who is 16, and Matshury who is 12. They study in the educational units of the sector.

She started her store one year ago. With this income, she can help her husband with the household expenses since, at this moment, he is out of work. Janeth would buy a glass case with the money in order to display bread. She thinks that this will increase her profit with bread sales and she will be able to continue paying the food, education, and health expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy a glass case to display bread.

loans.name: Thanh0974's Group

texts.en:
Thanh, born in 1983, is a Thai ethnic man living with his wife and his daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province. His family’s main income is from the civil servant salary of him and his wife, so the monthly income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and have saved a small amount. The next learning term of his daughter is coming, but he does not have enough money to pay for it. Therefore, he wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

He hopes that the loan amount will help his daughter have better learning conditions to have a bright future, and he will work hard to get the money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to pay for education cost

loans.name: Dinh's Group

texts.en:
Dinh, 50-years-old, is a Kinh ethnic woman who joined the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner for 9 years since 2006. She currently lives with her husband and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from growing clean vegetables and breeding. The annual income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family. She wishes to have an amount of capital to invest in breeding to improve the family’s living standards. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to invest in raising pigs.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding, and she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in raising pigs.

loans.name: Niarah Group

texts.en:
The hot summer season has opened doors for Chishamiso who resides in Sunridge suburb in Harare. She makes non-carbonated flavoured drinks that are packed in two sizes (50ml and 100ml) to match other competitors packaging. These small packed frozen drinks are sold for lowest prices of $0.50 and $0.25 per unit. She has to make more than 10 packs of fifty units every day that she sells to vendors as well as to Avonlea primary school pupils, close to her home. She uses a machine which is powered by a simple electric motor for packaging.

Chishamiso is a woman aged 31, is married and is a mother of two, a nine-year-old girl and a four-year-old boy. Her husband assists her during the night to operate the hand machine for packaging. She is a member of Niarah group who have gone through the Thrive Microfinance training, which has helped them to improve on financial literacy and working as a group.

A loan amounting $300 will help Chishamiso to stock enough ingredients for her frozen drinks production. She is also planning to buy a bigger machine, which would improve speed on packaging.

loans.use: to stock enough ingredients for her frozen drinks production. She is also planning to buy a bigger machine, to improve speed on packaging.

loans.name: Chung's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chung, born in 1993, is a Thai ethnic woman, who has been participating in the program of M7-MFI since January 2014. Her family consists of four members including her husband and her two daughters living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation, and each harvest she can earn the income of VND 55 to 60 million. However, the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and to save a small amount. She wants to buy breeding goats to raise but she does not have money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in breeding, and next year the breeding model will bring her family a herd of goat. She will also work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy breeding goats

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells merchandise like cooking oil, seasonings, coffee, powdered milk, pouch vinegar, soap, shampoo, eggs, and chips. Eugenia is a 48-year-old married woman and has two grown children. She lives in the rural town of Pilar.

Eugenia would like to improve her earnings by purchasing assorted supplies for the store such as beverages, soft drinks, rice, and toiletries. These will maintain the inventory of her store and attract more buyers to come. Thus, she will be able to settle her obligation and start to set aside money for future business expansion. Eugenia is doing her best to improve her livelihood by investing other sources of income to become more productive.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as beverages, soft drinks, rice, and toiletries

loans.name: Marlou

texts.en:
Marlou is a married man with three school-aged children. He is a chainsaw operator. He accepts services like cutting trees, for a particular fee. Together with his wife and children, he lives in the town of Pilar.

He needs capital for him to increase his earnings. He needs tools to improve his productivity. Marlou has requested a loan to purchase a cutting chain. This will help improve his daily income. Also, with this his income will be augmented and enable him to pay his obligation.

For the future, Marlou hopes that he can set aside for emergency use and expand the revenues to become sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase  a cutting chain

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 46 años de edad es madre soltera su hijo tiene 7 años de edad, Camilo estudia en una unidad educativa gratuita del sector hace 7 años empezó con su pequeña tienda ella trabajaba como lavandera y enfermo mucho poco a poco con la ayuda de los créditos y su trabajo ha ido incrementando su negocio. Yolanda necesita el dinero para comprar mercadería surtir su tienda aumentar sus ingresos así podría seguir pagando la alimentación, educación, el lugar donde vive a futuro sueña con tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 46 years old. She is a single mother of a 7-year-old son. Camilo attends the free neighborhood school in the community. Seven years ago Yolanda started her small store. She was working as a laundry woman and was sick a lot. Little by little, with the help of loans and her work, she has increased her business.

Yolanda needs money to buy merchandise to stock her store, to increase her income and in this way be able to continue paying for food, education and the place where she lives. In the future she dreams of having her own home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Maria Linda

texts.en:
Maria Linda is a 58-year-old woman who lives in Tubigon, Bohol. She is married and has three children; they are 19, 16 and 13 years old. She helps her husband earn a living by doing a hog-raising business. Her husband works hard as a laborer.

Thus, she wanted to improve her business for their future needs and to support her children’s education. But, with raising pigs, she needs more capital to finance their feed. That is why she is in need of a loan, to sustain buying feed for her pigs. Aside from this, she will also buy banana fruit. Perhaps, she has other business opportunities like buying and selling banana fruit.

loans.use: to buy feed and banana fruit.

loans.name: Phuong1974's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phuong, born in 1982, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. She currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family’s main income is from the civil servant salary of her and her husband, so the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount.

She is studying at an in-service training at a university and will have to pay for the fee of training for the next term but she does not have enough money to pay. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her invest in her education, and when she graduates, she will have a good and stable income. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to pay for training fees.

loans.name: Thua's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thua, 36 years old, a Thai ethnic woman, has been in the M7-MFI’s forerunner program since January 2004. She currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family’s main income is from breeding and cultivation. The total annual income of her family is just enough to cover their living expenses and save a small amount.

Mrs. Thua wants to invest in raising pigs, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to take out a loan for this purpose. She hopes that the loan will help her family invest effectively in the breeding, and next year, it will bring her family a considerable profit, which will help to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to invest in raising pigs

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Luzviminda is 43-years-old and has three children who are presently in school.

Luzviminda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new fish nets, gasoline and materials for boat repair.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new fish nets, gasoline and materials for boat repair.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Ami est une veuve femme  âgée de 44 ans qui vit à Baguida. Mère de quatre enfants, Ami est une marchande de friperies  qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Ami demande ce prêt pour commander des unités de jupes, corsages et des tricots de friperies en vue de bien revendre puis de gagner des bénéfices et pouvoir aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Ami is a 44 years old widow who lives in Baguida. Mother of four children, Ami sells used clothes. She stocks up twice a month at the market and resells at home and in the surrounding neighborhoods. Ami is seeking this loan to order units of skirts, bodices and knitwear with the hopes of making better sales and yield a profit that she will use to help her children in their education.

loans.use: to buy 50 units of skirts, 80 units of bodices and 50 units of knitwear

loans.name: Thanh6918's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh, 28-years-old, is a Thai ethnic woman who joined the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner since 2011. She currently lives with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter, in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is farming, so the income from each harvest is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount. She wants to raise goats to sell but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes much that the loan amount would help her family invest effectively in the breeding model and will bring her family a considerable profit in the next coming period. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to raise goats

loans.name: Tuyen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyen, 33-years-old, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family consists of four members, including her husband and her two sons, living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from breeding and cultivation. The total income of the year is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount. She wants to invest in raising pigs to sell but she does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the pig breeding at high productivity, and next year the breeding model will bring her family a considerable profit. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in raising pigs

loans.name: Noris Del Carmen

texts.es: Con 24 años de edad, Noris es una joven muy responsable y trabajadora quien vive al lado de su padre y sobrino en vivienda propia desde hace 23 años. Ella en busca de cubrir los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo y también vende minutas, negocios los cuales administra de forma ambulante, tanto dentro como fuera de su comunidad. Noris solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra para reparar su pila y el baño, ya que con el paso del tiempo se han deteriorado y es necesario repararlo lo más pronto posible. También se encuentra muy agradecida con el crédito anterior ya que gracias a ello pudo cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
At 24 years of age Noris is a very responsible and hard-working youth who has lived along with her father and niece in their own house for 23 years. Looking to cover the household expenses she works selling beauty products by catalog and she also sells shaved ice cones (minutas). She runs these businesses itinerantly both in her community and outside it.

Noris is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sand, cement and to pay for labor to repair her washstand/water-storage and toilet. With the passing of time they have deteriorated and it is necessary to repair them as soon as possible. Also she is very grateful for the last loan as thanks to it she manage to replace the roof of her house.

loans.use: to invest in sand, cement and to pay for labor to repair her washstand/water-storage and toilet.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is an agripreneur from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 59-years-old, married and has expertise in farming. She runs a rice production business and earns a quarterly income that sufficiently supports her family.

Ruth is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied for a loan to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase a good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce. Ruth continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase a good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce.

loans.name: Margarida

texts.en:
Margarida is 58-years-old widow from Zartonq village of Armavir region. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law and two minor grandchildren. 
Margarida, as she used to since her young age, has been involved in land cultivation. In her own greenhouse near the house, Margarida cultivates cucumber, sunflower and watermelon and sells it in the season with good prices. 
Margarida requested this loan to purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse and prepare it for coming cold season, cucumber seeds and fertilizer for cultivation. This will allow her to not stop cultivation process in winter and sustain her farm. Margarida hopes for lenders' support and faith to develop her farm and help her family with the income from farming business.

loans.use: to pay for polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, cucumber seeds and fertilizer for cultivation

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth used the previous loan to to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell. She is still running a business of selling motorcycle and vehicle spare parts plus their lubricants. She has been doing this business for a period of 5 years, She was inspired by her friend who imports the same spare parts.

She is facing a challenge of price fluctuation and the high foreign exchange rate since all her stock of spare parts is all imported and limited capital which hinder her from expanding her business to new areas. She has asked for another loan to restock her business with motor vehicle spare parts and lubricants to sell.

loans.use: to restock her business with motor vehicle spare parts and lubricants to sell.

loans.name: Nongdernthong Group

texts.en: Tee understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Tee knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Tee purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Tee is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Veuve, Adjo est une femme avec six enfants à charge. Adjo est âgée de 59 ans et habite à Baguida où elle prépare et vend de la pâte bandée faite à base du maïs appelée « Akpan ». Adjo achète le nécessaire servant à la préparation deux fois par mois au marché et vend sa marchandise à la devanture de son domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Adjo demande ce prêt pour commander des sacs de maïs et de charbon de bois en vue de bien vendre puis de gagner plus de bénéfices afin de subvenir à ses besoins et d’améliorer les conditions de vie quotidiennes de ses enfants.
texts.en: Adjo is a widow with six dependant children. Adjo is 59 years old and lives in Baguida where she prepares and sells a polenta-like cornmeal dish known as "Akpan". Adjo buys the necessary ingredients twice a month at the market and sells her food in front of her home and as an itinerant vendor in nearby neighborhoods. Adjo is seeking this loan to order bags of corn and charcoal with the hopes of making better sales and yielding profits to support herself and improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 03 bags of corn and 02 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Rosel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosel works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pre-made food vending. Rosel is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a variety of fruit to sell for her fruit vending business.

Rosel has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Apolinaria is 37 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has an egg vending business in the Philippines. Apolinaria requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional stock of eggs to sell.

Apolinaria has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 47 years old, married, with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Loida requested a 17,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy utensils and ingredients for her food vending business.

Loida has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Loida would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy utensils and ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 38 years old and married.

Lydia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lydia has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lydia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Mariée, Ayawa est une femme sans enfant. Ayawa est âgée de 63 ans et habite à Baguida où elle prépare et vend de la pâte bandée faite à base du maïs appelée « Akpan » et accompagné des poissons frit. Ayawa achète le nécessaire servant à la préparation trois fois par mois au marché et vend sa marchandise à la devanture de son domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Ayawa demande ce prêt pour commander le sac de maïs et des paniers de poissons frits en vue de bien revendre puis de gagner plus de bénéfices afin de subvenir à ses besoins et d’améliorer les conditions de vie quotidiennes de son foyer.
texts.en: Married, Ayawa is a woman without children. Ayawa is 63 years old and lives in Baguida where she prepares and sells a polenta-like cornmeal dish known as "Akpan" accompanied by fried fish. Ayawa buys the necessary ingredients three times a month at the market and sells  her food in front of her home and as an itinerant vendor in nearby neighborhoods. Ayawa is seeking this loan to order a bag of corn and baskets of fried fish with the hopes of making better sales and yielding profits to support herself and improve her household's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 01 bag of corn and 09 baskets of fish

loans.name: Grandes Emprendedores Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 6 personas responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “GRANDES EMPRENDEDORES” una de ellas es la Srta. Angélica Natali de 25 años soltera, se dedica a la venta de golosinas todos los días con el mérito de salir adelante. Con su esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a su familia. Seguir mejorando su negocio, su mayor deseo es tener un local donde pueda vender más de sus productos. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más insumos (chupetes, galletas, gaseosas) y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez la Srta. Angélica Natali se encuentra sentada al centro y se le distingue con una casaca gris, se despide con un abrazo a Kiva y Edaprospo. Agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank, "Great Entrepreneurs," a group formed by 6 persons responsible for different business activities. One of them is Angélica Natali. She is 25 years old, single, and makes her living selling sweets every day with the goal of getting ahead.  With her effort, she has been able to improve her home and help her family. Continuing to improve her business, her biggest desire is to have a place where she can sell more of her products.

With the issued loan, she will invest in buying more stock (suckers, cookies, sodas) and in this way be able to have more income. In the photo you can find Angélica Natali seated in the center and distinguished by a gray jacket. She signs off with a hug to Kiva and Edaprospo. She appreciates the loan offered since it make her progress possible.

loans.use: to purchase sweets (suckers, cookies)

loans.name: Judylyn

texts.en:
Judylyn, 28 years old, is a single woman with two children, who are presently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Judylyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Judylyn requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy more fish to sell at her local market. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her local market.

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es: Jairo tiene 25 años de edad de estado civil soltero, tiene una pequeña tienda que empezó hace un año atrás luego de dedicarse por diez años a pintar casas y ahorrar el dinero para iniciar su negocio, es muy alegre y trabajador. Jairo necesita el dinero para surtir su tienda obtendría mayores ganancias para poder costearse su preparación en música y dibujo, aspira un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Jairo is 25 years old and single. He has a small store that he started up a year ago. He worked for ten years painting houses to save up the money to start his business. He is a happy and hardworking person.

Jairo needs this money to stock his store. This would give him more income to put toward his studies in music and drawing. He wants a better future.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is a 38-year-old man, who earns a living by selling frozen goods like sausage and lumpia (spring rolls). Three years ago he started engaging in his livelihood, serving neighbors in the community. He lives in the town of Talibon, together with his partner in life.

Francisco would like to have more stock available in order to make higher earnings. In that way, he will be able to repay his obligation and set aside some of the profit for future expansion. He hopes that this will help improve the living conditions of his household.

Francisco has requested a Kiva loan through its field partner CEVI to access a loan. He would like to purchase more stock of chorizo (a spicy Spanish pork sausage).

loans.use: to purchase more stock of chorizo (a spicy Spanish pork sausage).

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 62 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Leonisa has been running a general store in the Philippines for three years. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell to her local market, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, snack foods, and personal care products.

In the future, Leonisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell to her local market, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, snack foods, and personal care products.

loans.name: Melmi Nohemy

texts.es: Melmi, tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija con quien vive en el municipio de Gracias Lempira. Ella se dedicaba a estudiar en un tiempo y tenía una pequeña pulpería, ahora lleva 3 años de mantener su propio negocio y mejor surtido con productos como manteca, arroz, frijoles, maíz, comida para animales, productos de limpieza, churros, refrescos, pan, dulces, harina y otros abarrotes. Además tiene cultivo de café y granos básicos en su terreno. Ha solicitado cuatro préstamos en la institución con el actual que es por 20,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de más productos de la canasta básica como ser frijoles, arroz, manteca, maíz, harina, refrescos, productos de limpieza, pan, lacteos y otros abarrotes. para tener surtido y aumentar la clientela y sus ventas. Su meta es seguir creciendo como comerciante y aumentar el negocio.
texts.en:
Melmi, 29, is a single mother. She lives with her daughter in the municipality of Gracias Lempira. She used to be in school and she had a small grocery store. Now she has been running her own business for three years. She has improved its selection of products such as lard, rice, beans, corn, animal food, cleaning products, churros, soft drinks, bread, candy, flour, and other groceries. She also grows coffee and staple grains on her land.

She has applied for four loans from this institution. The current one is for 20,000 Lempiras and she is going to invest it in buying more staple products such as beans, rice, lard, corn, flour, soft drinks, cleaning products, bread, dairy products, and other groceries. A good selection will increase her clientele and her sales. Her goal is to continue to grow as a businesswoman and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more basic staples such as beans, rice, lard, corn, flour, soft drinks, cleaning products, bread, dairy products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ratuqui Solidario Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RATUQUI SOLIDARIO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Collpani, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de coca, venta de ropa, venta de papa, venta de frazadas, servicio de fotocopiadora, tienda de barrio, venta de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marina es integrante, ella indica que es la segunda vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio por iniciativa propia hace dos años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rataqui Solidario" began its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani bank branch. This group is composed of 10 members and is led by a board of directors, of which Marina is President. The businesses of the members of this communal bank are varied. Among them are: coca leaf sales, clothing sales, potato sales, blanket sales, poncho sales, photocopying services and a corner store. 

The loan they will receive will benefit small business owners, including Marina. She says that this is the second time which she has come to Pro Mujer, joining at the suggestion of one of the institution's advertisements. Marina currently owns a corner store, and says that she launched this business on her own two years ago.  

The loan they are taking out now will be used to increase capital (to purchase groceries in bulk) which Marina will acquire from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto, and will later sell in her store. This business allows her to generate an income to support her family economically - Marina lives with her partner and has six children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and the health services which the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 34 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Maricel has had a fish-vending business in the Philippines for eight years. Maricel requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Dona

texts.en:
Ma. Dona is a married, 42-year-old woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ma. Dona has had a fruit and vegetable business in the Philippines for nine years. She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy carrots, beans, potatoes, papaya, and bananas.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell, including carrots, beans, potatoes, papaya, and bananas.

loans.name: Glenda Claribel

texts.es: Glenda de 21 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia al lado de su compañero de vida. Ella es una joven muy trabajadora quien se dedica al cultivo de loroco, esta labor se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: abonos, fertilizantes y demás insumos necesarios para el cultivo del loroco.
texts.en: Glenda is 21 years old. She lives in her own home alongside her life partner. She is a very hardworking young lady who makes a living by farming "loroco" (edible vine flower buds). This work has become her primary source of income, which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in manure, fertilizers, and other necessary inputs for loroco farming.

loans.use: to invest in manure, fertilizers, and other necessary inputs for loroco farming.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 25-year-old woman with four children. One child is currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evelyn has a shell craft business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Evelyn requested a 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy more shells, thread, and other materials needed in her business. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more shells, thread, and other materials needed in her craft business.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 65 years old and married with six children, two of whom are still in school. Marivic works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Marivic has been in this business for three years.

Marivic requested a 10,000 Philippine pesos loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products. In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa tiene 52 años de edad está casada su esposo trabaja junto a ella, su hijo Byron de 18 años de edad le ayuda en el pequeño negocio a vender guatita, encebollado, iniciaron hace 8 años atrás ella trabaja constantemente para que no le falte el pan del día en su familia, Rosa necesita el dinero para comprar vajilla y ollas  ya que las que tiene están deterioradas por su uso, así podría dar una mejor imagen a los clientes obteniendo mayores ingresos para poder satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su hogar.
texts.en: Rosa is 52 years old and she is married. She and her husband work together, and their son Byron, who is 18, helps them with their small business. They sell tripe stew and fish stew. They began the business 8 years ago, and Rosa works constantly so that their family never lacks its daily bread. She needs money to purchase silverware and pans, since those she has now are deteriorated from use. This way she will be able to present a better image to her customers, thereby earning a greater income and being able to satisfy her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase silverware and pans.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 45 years old and married with one child. Lilibeth works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Lilibeth has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items.

Lilibeth requested a 29,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy items to sell like sugar, salt, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, salt, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Manchita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Manchita works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling rice grain. Manchita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, pork, spices and other materials for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Manchita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilou is 32 years old and has one child still in school.

Marilou has a charcoal business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 48 years old. She is married and has four children who are presently in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marilyn has been in this business for 11 years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 47 years old and widowed. She has four children. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Nilda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Nilda has been in this business for 16 years and also earns additional income from selling dried fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago es un hombre digno de admirarse, lleva varios años dedicándose a la agricultura porque es su mayor fuente de ingresos, Santiago es una más de las muchas personas que sus vidas sean visto muy beneficiadas con los créditos de kiva y ADICLA, él cuenta que nuevamente le fue muy bien pues una buena cosecha obtuvo y una ganancia mejor le dejo, él solicita un nuevo préstamo pues para el es de gran ayuda, en esta ocasión comprara semillas de papa he insumos agrícolas para su cultivo de verano.
Santiago conseguir este préstamo para seguir cambiando su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Santiago is a man who deserves admiration. For many years, he has made a living in agriculture, since it is his best source of income. Santiago is one of many people whose lives have benefited from Kiva and ADICLA's loans. He says that, once again, things have gone well for him since he had a good harvest, which gave him better earnings. He is requesting a new loan since it is a big help for him. This time, he will buy potato seeds and agricultural inputs for his summer crops. Santiago wants to get this loan to continue changing his life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Marvin Eliu

texts.es: Marvin, tiene 25 años de edad, está casado, tiene un hijo y reside con su esposa e hijo en una aldea del municipio de la Campa Lempira. Marvin siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura con el cultivo de maíz y frijoles y hace 5 años cultiva café el cual vende en el mercado local ya despulpado y seco. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos. El préstamo que solicita es por 30,000 lempiras  para comprar abonos, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para darle mantenimiento a su finca de café y corte de la cosecha. Su meta es crecer como productor de café y tener un patrimonio familiar.
texts.en: Marvin is 25 years old. He is married, has one child, and lives with his wife and child in a small village in the Campa Lempira municipality. Marvin has always made his living in agriculture, by farming corn and beans, and for the past 5 years he has farmed coffee. He sells the coffee in the local market once it is depulped and dried. This business is his source of income. The loan that he is requesting is for 30,000 HNL to buy manure and fertilizers, and to pay labor to maintain his coffee farm and to harvest the crops. His goal is to grow as a coffee producer and create a family inheritance.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers, and to pay labor to maintain his coffee farm and harvest the crops.

loans.name: Mercedes Magdalena

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por las extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 14 y 11 años de edad los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante. 
Mercedes es una mujer que le gusta a base de trabajo ir mejorando la calidad de vida de ella y su familia, es así que hace mas de 12 años con lo que tenia surtió una pequeña  tienda de víveres en su casa, la misma que con el paso del tiempo y después con la ayuda de los créditos ha mejorado considerablemente, actualmente vende toda variedad de víveres como granos, carnes, lácteos, legumbres, además de varios artículos de bazar y papelería,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio ofreciendo al igual que ella la mejor atención.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar y otros víveres que no tiene para satisfacer a sus clientes. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 10 años y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños  son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Women United Credit Group meets every fifteen days in the Jipijapa canton. The canton is known by the name "the sultan of coffee," due to its vast coffee crops which have an incomparable flavor. It is also known for its gastronomy and for the warmth of its people.

This is where Mercedes lives. She is 32 years old and is in a common law marriage, through which she has two children who are 14 and 11 years old. They study in high school and elementary school. Her husband is a businessman. Mercedes is a woman who likes to work to improve her quality of life and that of her family. This is why, more than 12 years ago, she used what she had to start a small grocery store in her house. As time has passed, and with the help of loans, the store has improved considerably. Now she sells all types of groceries such as grains, meats, dairy, and legumes, as well as various bazaar and stationery items. She works every day from 6:00 AM until 8:00 PM, and sometimes later. Her children help her with the business and, like her, they give it their best attention.

She will use this loan to further stock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, and other groceries that she does not have in order to satisfy her customers. She has been in the Credit Group for 10 years and she likes it because the loans help her a lot. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and other groceries for her store.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Beatriz works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell accessories business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buy-and-sell mineral water. Beatriz is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of accessories to sell in her business.

Beatriz has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of accessories to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Susan is 65 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Susan has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines. Susan requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Susan has been in this business for three years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn is 35 years old and married with six children. With four children in school, Ronalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Ronalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

Ronalyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Ronalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nelsita

texts.en:
Nelsita is 53 years old and married with six children.

Nelsita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional products of Avon, Natasha and other personal care products to sell.

Nelsita has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns an income from food vending.

Nelsita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional products of Avon, Natasha and other personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia is a married woman and 56 years old with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rogelia has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Rogelia requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Rogelia has been in this business for six years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Saralyn

texts.en:
Saralyn is 38 years old and has five children. Saralyn is married and has four children who are still in school.

Saralyn is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Saralyn requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Saralyn has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Saralyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Percie

texts.en:
Percie is 42 years old and married with six children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising ducks in the Philippines. Percie is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and maintenance for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Percie has been in this business for 11 years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Shela Mae

texts.en:
For the past seven years, Shela Mae has earned a living by making amakan (bamboo) matting, which is commonly used for walls in native house in the Philippines. She is 27 year-old and married, with two young dependents. On the other hand, her husband is a farmer. He grows and sells rice. Most of her major expenses are for food and school.

Shela Mae would like to produce more amakan, but she does not have sufficient materials to make it so. Thus, she has requested a loan from CEVI to purchase materials such as bamboo strips. In this way, she will be able to improve her production and gain higher earnings. She may also be able to invest in other sources of income to become more progressive.

She is thankful for the funds and is determined to manage the business successfully in order to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as bamboo strips.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 40 years old.

Zenaida has a dried coconut meat production business in the Philippines. She requested a Loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to pay for the salaries of the laborers for her dried coconut meat production.

Zenaida has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for the of the laborers for her dried coconut meat production.

loans.name: Anneciel

texts.en:
Anneciel is 48 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are still in school.

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Anneciel has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Anneciel has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her activities.

In the future, Anneciel would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 69-year-old widow. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Sonia has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and repair her pig pens. Sonia has been raising pigs for 14 years now, and has borrowed 27 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her activities.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and repair her pig pens.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 65 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Delia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, sugar and other snack foods.

Delia has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, sugar and other snack foods.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 39 years old and has two children. Elsa is married, and both her children are still in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elsa has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her activities. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a 40-year-old married woman with two children who are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Felicidad has had a business selling crabs and shrimp in the Philippines for 14 years. She has requested a 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more crabs and shrimp. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more crabs and shrimp to sell.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is a 40-year-old married woman with five children who are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ginalyn has a bamboo selling business in the Philippines and has requested a 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more bamboo. She has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to sell.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo has been a farmer for a long period of time. He toils the land and grows rice. He resides in Alicia, Bohol. He is married and has four children, whom one is still attending school.

He owns a rice paddy and sells rice to the local dwellers in his place. He faces challenges in his livelihood: the lack of capital and the high cost of farm maintenance.

Wilfredo would like to purchase feed and food for the family.  These will help him boost and improve the yield of his farm. With these, he could start to save for emergency use and would start to invest other sources of income. This enables him to provide his family's needs and continue to expand his farm to become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and food for the family.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 47 years old.

Amelia has a business of buying and selling gasoline in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional containers of gasoline to sell.

Amelia has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is a 39-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are still in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs.

Enriquita has been in this business for six years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Aillen

texts.en:
Aillen is 36 years old and married with four children. With all her children in school, Aillen works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

Aillen has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, spices and other groceries. 

In the future, Aillen would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 42 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Alma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, school supplies, and other groceries.

Alma has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, school supplies, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jardidin

texts.en:
Jardidin is 53 years old and has six children. She is married, and two of her children are still in school.

Jardidin is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Jardidin has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her activities. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are still in school. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Josephine has been in this business for nine years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her activities.

Josephine has requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Marianela Rocio

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señorita Marianela, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de los padres. Ella lleva más de 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan a ella y a sus compañeras para salir adelante.
Marianela es una joven  mujer que le gusta ganarse sus propios ingresos y así mismo ayudara  a su papá el cual junto a ella se dedican al comercio, ellos tienen un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad donde venden frutas y  legumbres, el papá muy de madrugada se desplaza hasta el centro de abasto luego ya con los productos abre su local y empieza con las ventas del día, ella le ayuda más tarde pero por lo general todos los días ella también le ayuda a vender así se gana el sustento diario para ella y su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar frutas y legumbres. Sus sueños son tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” loan group meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa. The canton is known by the name of “the sultan of coffee,” due to its extensive coffee crops, which have an incomparable flavor. It is also known for its cuisine and the warmth of its people.

In this place lives Marianela. She is 23 years old, single, and lives in her parents’ house. She has been in the loan group for more than four years, and she likes it because of the help it gives her and her fellow members so they can get ahead.

Marianela is a young woman who likes to earn her own income. Likewise, she will help her father, who works alongside her in commerce. They have a stand in the city market where they sell fruits and vegetables. Her father goes out very early in the morning to the supply center. Then, with the products, he opens the shop and starts the day’s sales. She helps him later, but generally she also helps him sell every day. In this way she earns daily support for herself and her family.

She will use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables. Her dream is to have a store in her house.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza and her family live in the town of Catigbian, Bohol. She is a 38-year-old woman who is married and has three children; ages 16, 9 and a 1-year-old baby. Her husband buys and sells pigs, while Liza is engaged in the piggery (hog-raising) business. She has been doing this for nine years to help her husband augment their financial stability. 

Liza is asking for a loan to buy feed for her pigs. The other portion of the loan will be used to pay tuition fees (school fees) of her children. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and enhance her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy feed and pay tuition fees (school fees) of her children.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Belinda is 51 years old now.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Belinda has requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy nets and other fishing supplies.

Belinda has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Meljorie

texts.en:
Meljorie is 33 years old, married, and has one child.

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Meljorie has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Meljorie has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her activities.

In the future, Meljorie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is 55 years old and has thirteen children. She is married, and four of her children are currently in school.

Felicisima is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Felicisima has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her activities. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with four children. She is 32 years old and three of her children are currently in school.

Gemma is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Gemma has requested an 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of dried fish to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is a 61-year-old widow with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Jasmin has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. Jasmin has requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

In the future, Jasmin would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Otabek

texts.en:
Otabek is from the district of Shahrituz. He is engaged in animal husbandry and crop yield. He provides to his family and does not have another source of income except this. He works very hard, so that his family does not remain without food. 

Otabek urgently needs to buy a few heads of cattle and feed for them. Currently he has only one cow, but it is not enough! He wants to improve his farming activity to get more effective results and yield. With these new calves, Otabek is sure to produce more, to earn more, and be able to save money for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a few heads of cattle.

loans.name: Alikhon

texts.en:
Alikhon is a hardworking man from the Shahrituz region. He has a large and tight-knit family.  

Alikhon grows crops. His activity is the main source of income for the family. It is work that they have inherited. 

Alikhon has already gathered the autumn harvest and now he needs to plant a new crop. He has bought various types of vegetable seeds, but he did not have enough money to buy mineral fertilizer. For this reason, he has applied for a loan. 

Alikhon hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Godafreda

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Godafreda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Godafreda is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, spices, vegetables, etc. for her food vending business.

Godafreda has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, spices, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is 33 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Josephine has a buy-and-sell shell business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more shells to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more shells to sell.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 38-years-old woman, living with husband in Multan, Pakistan. She is responsible for all the household chores and her husband is into the farming of goats and sheep. He has been in this business for 20 years now. He has a lot of experience and handles his animals with care - that is why he is popular in his area for the animals he sells.

His wife Naseem has applied for a loan amount of 55,000 PKR to buy more goats and sheep. She is thankful to the Kiva team and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for her husband.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is determined and perseveres to succeed on her variety store business because she dreams of having a one-stop shop someday. When her previous loan was granted, the amount made a great impact on the business, causing an increase in the business' revenue. She bought stocks of grocery items and necessary materials for her variety store. She wants to thank lenders for the financial provision. The business is growing, each month and her total income is approximately 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP).

Margaret wants to thank as well Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for approving her previous loan. She is blessed for God’s abundance and the medium of blessing, CCT, and all of the lenders with compassionate hearts. She’s also grateful that CCT conducts seminars for entrepreneurs. She's an entrepreneur who has a dream of traveling abroad with her family. She's requesting for another loan of 22,000 PHP to add products for the business. She’ll use the amount to buy additional grocery items such as bottled drinks, school supplies, sacks of rice, and processed foods.

On a weekly basis, Margaret regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and experience on the business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and direct-selling personal products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda lives in the town of Bilar, Bohol. She owns rice paddies, where she grows and sells rice. She is married and has six children, one of whom is still attending school. Her husband works as a caretaker. They support each other to improve their livelihoods.

For many years now, Erlinda has been engaged in farming, serving locals in her area. She would like to enhance the yield of her farm to become more sustainable.

Erlinda has requested a loan to purchase rice seedlings and fertilizer. She wishes to maximize her resources and augment her income soon. She will also be able to set aside some of her profits for future use.

She dreams of having a small, reliable business that could support her family for the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ma. Roleta

texts.en:
Ma. Roleta is 57 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Ma. Roleta has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more groceries such as canned goods, spices, personal care products and other groceries to sell.

Ma. Roleta has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, spices, personal care products and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luzarina

texts.en:
Luzarina is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 55 years old now.

Luzarina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell. Luzarina has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Alma

texts.en:
Ma. Alma is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Alma is 43 years old and five of her children are currently in school.

Ma. Alma has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested an 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy nets and other fishing supplies.

Ma. Alma has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo con 45 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su cónyuge y sus tres hijos, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuneta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 hectárea de variedad Catimor resistente a enfermedades y plagas, plantación esta en tercer año de producción tiene 4 años de edad,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 10 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, contando a la fecha con 2 reses de su propiedad, así mismo a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar. El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento de 1 hectárea de café en producción, asegurando campaña 2016 con una y mayor producción, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtener mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Lorenzo es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. El firma con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, age 45, is in a common-law marriage. He lives in his own house, built of rustic material, along with his wife and three children, in the district of Santo Tomás, province of Cutervo, department of Cajamarca, Peru. He has very good personal and professional references from the denizens of the zone. The majority of residents of the area work in agriculture, commerce, and cattle raising.

He works in agriculture, specifically in growing coffee. At this time, he has one hectare of the “Catimor” variety, which is resistant to diseases and pests. His plantation is in its third year of production, and is four years old. He has ten years of experience in this line of work. Additional, he works raising cattle. At this time, he owns two cows. He also raises smaller animals (hens, guinea pigs, pigs, and others), and grows staple food crops.

The goal of the loan will be to invest in maintenance of one hectare planted with coffee, guaranteeing a 2016 season with better production, as reflected in a greater sales volume. This way, he can earn better income in order to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Lorenzo is a recurring borrower of Edpyme Alternativa. He is signing with his wife.

loans.use: to invest in maintenance of one hectare planted with coffee, guaranteeing a good 2016 season.

loans.name: Anelina

texts.en:
Anelina’s variety store is struggling, as you can see in the picture. She has a huge debt from her neighbors in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. Many of her debtors pay after several weeks and she cannot force them because she knows that there are times when money is really difficult to earn. It’s a good thing that she has an alternative source of income, which is direct selling of cosmetics and personal care products from a known brand, Avon. She offers it to office workers with regular salaries.
