Her husband, Rodrigo, is a driver and his income somehow sustains their everyday needs. But it’s not enough to support the educational expenses of their two children in college and high school. This is the reason why Anelina aims to improve her variety store so it can augment the growing family's expenses. A loan of 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) would be very helpful for her to buy additional stocks of dry goods, grocery items, and beverages for her store. Part of it will be used to pay for higher quantity of cosmetics and personal care products which she can sell to regular wage earners. You can be the answer to her prayers through your generous support. Thank you so much in advance.

Anelina is an enthusiastic member of CCT, where she gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories of their life and businesses.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dry goods, grocery items, and beverages for her store, plus a higher quantity of cosmetics and personal care products.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open-air food vending business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

With this 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is a married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 31 years old.

Jessie has a tricycle repair business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Jessie has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Ava

texts.en:
Ava is 45 years old and married with five children, one of whom is still in school. Ava works very hard to provide for them.

Ava runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, shampoo, and other personal care products. Ava has been in this business for 13 years.

In the future, Ava would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, shampoo, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Graciana

texts.en:
Graciana is 55 years old and has one child. She is a married woman.

Graciana is in the agricultural business, farming seaweed in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy plastic bags and other supplies needed in her business.

Graciana has been in this business for 8 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Graciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags and other supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is 54 years old and has three children. She is a married woman.

Aurea is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 28,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Aurea has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Aurea would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 37 years old and has two children, one of whom is in school. She is married.

Helen is in the agricultural business, farming rootcrops in the Philippines. Helen requested a loan of 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Helen has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 24 years old and married with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jovelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries. Jovelyn has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a married woman with six children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melanie is 38 years old.

Melanie has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Melanie has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.es:
Gaspar es un hombre de 47 años de edad está simplemente unido con su esposa tiene una familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 10 y1 8 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Gaspar con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes, con este negocio  lleva el 12 años de realizarlo, por los años que tiene de experiencia su negocio a marchando muy bien. Con la época de fin de año la demanda de su negocio incrementa por esa razón ha considerado necesario, solicitar un préstamo para la compra de productos como: golosinas, gaseosas, galletas, azúcar.
Su esperanza de vida es contar con su propio local de negocio y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gaspar is a 47-year-old man. He has a domestic partnership with his wife, and a family of three children, aged between 10 and 18. This family lives in a community of Sololá.

Gaspar, with his desire to earn income and support his family, works buying and selling groceries. He has been performing this business for 12 years. Due to his years of experience, his business is going very well. During the end-of-year season, his business’s demands increase. For this reason, he has found it necessary to request a loan to buy products such as sweets, soft drinks, cookies, and sugar.

His life’s hope is to have his own venue for his business and to improve his home.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as sweets, soft drinks, cookies, and sugar.

loans.name: Duhoze Group

texts.fr:
Bonaventure fait partie du groupe  Duhoze et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 46 ans et est marié à Générose, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants âgés de 3 à 22 ans,  dont 7 étudient.
 
Il fait le commerce de vaches  depuis  6 ans. 

Il est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une vache supplémentaire  à revendre pour gagner plus. 


Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait  acheter des terres cultivables et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en: Bonaventure is a member of the Duhoze group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 46 years old and married to Generose, a farmer. They have eight children ranging from 3 to 22 years of age, 7 of whom are in school. Bonaventure has been selling cattle for six years. He is on his third loan with Turame. Thanks to the Kiva loan he will bolster his capital and buy an additional cow to resell in order to earn more. In the years to come, he would like to buy land for farming and provide for his children's education.

loans.use: to  buy an additional cow for resale so as to earn more.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is a married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Natividad is 52 years old.

Natividad has a business of selling purchase cards in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more purchase cards to sell.

Natividad has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more purchase cards to sell.

loans.name: Aghsaan

texts.en:
Aghsaan is a 24-year-old married young lady from Jenin city. Her husband is a construction worker where he gets a low and unstable income. Thus his income barely covers all the family needs.

Aghsaan is a student in the university, where she studies business administration. She wants to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to support her husband.

Aghsaan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university fees for the first semester. By taking this loan, she will be able to register in the university and pay part of her urgent expenses.

Aghsaan appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay her university fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Nolberto

texts.es:
Nolberto con 60 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos, en el distrito de Querecotillo,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café, de variedad Catimor, con una experiencia en el rubro de 15 años.El préstamo lo utilizará como capital de trabajo,específicamente para la compra de fertilizantes, deshierbos, pago de jornales.Esta inversión lo ayudará a tener mayor capital y así tener mayor liquidez para desarrollar la actividad mencionada.

Nolberto es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Nolberto, age 60, is married. He lives in his own house, built of rustic material, along with his wife and three children, in the district of Querecotillo, province of Cutervo, department of Cajamarca, Peru. He has very good references from the denizens of the zone. The majority of residents of the area work in agriculture, commerce, and cattle raising.

He works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee of the Catimor variety. He has 15 years of experience in this line of work. He will use the loan as working capital, specifically to purchase fertilizers and weed removal and to pay for labor. This investment will help him have more capital, and thereby to have more ready cash to develop the business described above.

Nolberto is a recurring borrower of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to have working capital, especially to purchase fertilizers and weed removal, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 41 years old and has five children. Analyn is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Analyn is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Analyn has been in this business for 5 years now and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Silvena

texts.en:
Silvena is 41 years old and married with six children. With four children in school, Silvena works very hard to provide for them.

Silvena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like beverages, bread, canned goods, and other groceries.

Silvena has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Silvena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like beverages, bread, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married, and has four kids who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a motorcycle spare parts business from home. Her potential customers are motorcycle operators. Her major challenges are high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase stock of motorcycle spare parts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase stock of motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a married woman and lives with her husband and five children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge that is the high cost of transportation. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity butno piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a soft drink fruit juice selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a challenge of seasonality and high cost of transporting raw materials.

With the loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, including mangoes and passion fruits, for making fruit juice for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, mangoes, and passion fruits for making fruit juice for sale.

loans.name: Savriddin

texts.ru: Это молодой человек Савриддин. Он сфотографирован вместе с его автомашин. У него имеется автомобиль марки «TOYOTA STAREXS». Много лет служит Савриддину. Его автомобиль является единственным источником дохода. Савриддин много лет перевозит людей. Он опытный и уверенный водитель. Савриддин живет в городе Вахдат. У него прекрасная жена и дети. Савриддин имеет двое детей. У него один сын и одна дочка. Сын учится в университете города Душанбе в 5 курсе. Его дочка тоже студентка, она учится на третьем курсе. Савриддин хочет, чтобы его дети учились и стали большим человеком. У Савриддин средняя образования, у них небыло возможности поступить в университет. И он был вынужден заниматься таксистом. Савриддин просит кредит оплаты за обучения сына. Он верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
This man's name is Savriddin. He is on the photo with his car. He owns a Toyota Starex  he has been relying on for many years. Savriddin's car is his sole source of income. He has been working as a taxi driver for  a long time. He is an experienced and confident driver. Savriddin lives in the town of Vahdat. He has a lovely wife and children. 

avriddin has two children: one son and one daughter. His son is in his 5th year of studies at the University of Dushanbe. His daughter is also a student, presently in her third year. Savriddin would like his children to receive a good education and  become successful. Savriddin himself has only finished high school; he had no opportunity to go to college. And so he had to work as  a taxi driver. Savriddin is applying for a loan to pay for his son's tuition. He trusts in you and your support.

loans.use: to pay his son's tuition.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina is a mother of three children from Jagna, Bohol. She is the only one providing for her family. She sell bananas and fresh fish in her community. This entails a lot of hard work because she will go in every house and ask if they will buy her fish and fruit, while carrying a pail of fish or a basket of fruits. Justina is persevering. She is asking a loan to buy more fish and fruits to sell so that she can increase her income. In the future, Justina wants to see her youngest child, a 16-year-old graduate from College.

loans.use: to buy fish and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Jamila Bibi

texts.en:
Jamila Bibi is the age of 37 and a mother of two children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She is engaged in embroidery to earn an income. She started her embroidery business 12 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.

Jamila Bibi buys materials such as hand-embroidery kits, ribbon, needles, and embroidery machines from the market. She has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn better profit for her family. She has become an expert in her embroidery business. Jamila Bibi requested a loan so that she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.

Jamila Bibi is thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials for herself.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is a smart young woman. She was born in 1997 and is single.

She studies at the first course of the Technical University of Tajikistan. Madina is a very hardworking student and she always prepares for all subjects, so all teachers are glad from her studies. She dreams to be a good specialist in the future and she is going for it.

Madina is asking for a loan of 4500 Somoni to pay for the university tuition because her parents do not have the opportunity. She awaits your mercy and really needs your support.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Forty-six-year old Marilou sells snack foods to the locals in her place. She sells biscuits and prepares banana cue (deep fried bananas in caramelized sugar), bibingka (rice cakes) and puto (steamed rice cakes).

Marilou is married and has nine children, six of whom are still attending school. Her husband is a carpenter.

Marilou would like to improve her daily production in order to gain higher earnings. She has requested a loan to invest in ingredients like flour, sugar, evaporated milk, and vanilla. These could help her prepare various snack foods to sell. In that way, she could able to set aside some of the profit to invest in other possible sources of income.

She hopes that she will be able to continue providing the needs of her growing children for brighter futures.

loans.use: to invest in ingredients like flour, sugar, evaporated milk, and vanilla.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
Dionisio con 61 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia material rústico,junto a su cónyuge y su nieto, en el distrito de Colasay,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 30 años. Solicita préstamo para invertir en labores de mantenimiento de su cultivo de café,compra de abonos, invertir en labores de mantenimiento de su cultivo etc. Esto le ayudará a obtener mejores rendimientos en su cosecha, mayor ingreso económico, y así mejorara su chacra y su calidad de vida.

Dionisio es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Diniso, age 61, is in a common-law marriage. He lives in his own house, built of rustic material, along with his wife and grandson, in the district of Colasay, province of Jaén, department of Cajamarca, Peru. He has very good personal and professional references from the denizens of the zone. The majority of residents of the area work in agriculture, commerce, and cattle raising.

He works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee, with 30 years of experience in this line of work. He is requesting the loan to invest in maintenance work of his coffee crop, to buy compost, to invest in maintenance work of his crop, etc. This will help him to have better yields at harvest, greater economic income, and thereby he will improve his farm and his quality of life.

Dionisio is a recurring borrower of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in maintenance work of his coffee crop and to buy compost.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is 66 years old and she lives in Kapan City of Syunik region. Nina is not married and she lives alone. She has vocational education and the specialty of economist. All her life she has been engaged in different social and nonsocial work because she has always been a very active and hardworking  woman. 

Now Nina has some health problems which greatly impact her everyday life and activities. Nina requests this loan of 200,000 Armenian drams so that she can pay for a medical exam at the hospital and finally get rid of her health problems.

loans.use: to pay for a medical exam at the hospital and finally get rid of her health problems.

loans.name: Farhana

texts.en:
Farhana is a very well understanding lady with the matters of her husband. She resides in a small area of Multan, Pakistan. She is 35 years of age and a mother of six children, managing her home along with her husband with peace.

For some time, they have been facing hard times. For that very reason, Farhana started her own business and established her own bangles factory. She applied for the loan to buy the raw material for making bangles from Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

She hopes that her family's financial problems will be addressed and they will again live life easily.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her bangles factory.

loans.name: Cahaya Group

texts.en:
Leny, in the middle with a blue shirt, is a 36-year old-woman and is the representative of Cahaya group. The group is made up of 5 members.

Leny is married to Agusta, a 37-year-old entrepreneur. They are blessed with two children: Januarita, 16, in the 3rd of senior high school, and Januariko, 4 years old.

Leny resigned from a private company when she had baby Januariko, and decided to initiate a business of selling meals such as yellow rice (rice steamed with coconut milk, lemon grass, turmeric, etc.) with side dishes such as noodles, omelets, and chicken. Her business is located at a local university near her house. To make more income, she also produces fried corn and salted and sweet sticks and leaves them at kiosks. The business is going well and is profitable. In addition, she also has time to look after her children. Due to the customer demand, Leny plans to sell more portions of yellow rice. Therefore she seeks a loan.

Leny and the other group members learned that TLM focuses on small entrepreneurs by providing a group loan product. They were enthusiastic with the loan product and requested a loan of totaling 8,750,000 from TLM. Leny would like to spend her part of the loan on ingredients, such as rice, seasoning, flours, cooking oil, and sugar. Just like Leny, other members also want to spend the loan to improve their businesses. They wish that their business will be improved with the loan provided by Kiva, through TLM.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients for food and snacks, such as rice, seasonings, flour, cooking oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Martha Del Pilar

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 42  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres  hijos, dos ya mayores de edad y un hijo  de 12 años de edad, el cual  estudia en colegio, todos de sus hijos aun viven en su casa, el mayor es discapacitado. Su esposo es obrero.
Martha es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta a base de esfuerzo ganarse lo suyo y así colaborar con la dura carga de sacar adelante junto a su marido el hogar, para esto ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y en ocasiones también  productos de Avon  y Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella aprovecha las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, ella deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, lleva un año con este negocio el cual le permite ganar algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Lleva  3 ciclos en el Grupo Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The loan group, "Mujeres Unidas (United Women)," gets together every fortnight in the Cantón Jipijapa. It is a canton known as "La Sultana del Café" because of its extensive fields of incomparably flavored coffee, its cuisine and for the warm-heartedness of its people.

Martha lives here. She is 42-years old, married and has three children from that relationship. Two are older and one is 12-years old and goes to school. All of her children still live in her house. The eldest is handicapped. Her husband is a laborer.

Martha is a very determined woman who likes to put effort into doing things on her own and collaborate with the heavy burden of supporting the house with her husband. To do this, she works in business and sells all types of clothing and, on occasions, she also sells Avon and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women). Her sales form is door-to-door. She takes advantage of the morning hours because it is easier for her to do her rounds at these hours. She leaves a credit and charges weekly. She has been in the business for one year, which allows her to earn something for the wellness of her family.

This loan is going to be used to buy clothing, perfume, imitation jewelry, cosmetics and lotions. She has had 3 loan cycles with the loan group and she likes it because with the loans she started her business. Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfume, imitation jewelry, cosmetics and lotions.

loans.name: Eulalia Clorinda

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Eulalia, tiene 58  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro  hijos tres ya mayores de edad y un hijo  de 16 años de edad,  dos de ellos estudian uno en universidad y el menor en colegio, dos de sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es Profesor. Ella hace varios años atrás  aprendió corte y confección en un Academia de la ciudad. 
Eulalia es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante, ella tiene un taller de costura en su casa, allí  ella  confecciona ropa de  mujer y de niños, trabaja en  base de pedidos de personas particulares y  también elabora para la venta al público, ella también compra ropa para la venta lo cual lo realiza en su taller ya que hasta allí llegan sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00 hasta las 19h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, lleva más de 40 años con esta labor la cual le encanta.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar ropa,  telas y otros materiales para la costura. Esta desde el inicio  en el grupo de Crédito y le gusta la unidad del grupo. Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The loan group, "Mujeres Unidas (United Women)," gets together every fortnight in the Cantón Jipijapa, a canton known as "La Sultana del Café" because of its extensive fields of incomparably flavored coffee, its cuisine and for the warm-heartedness of its people.

Eulalia lives here. She is 58-years old, married and from that relationship she has four children. Three are older and one son is 16-years old. Two of them are in school, one in college and the youngest in high school. Two of her children still live in her home. Her husband is a professor.

Several years ago she learned tailoring and design in a city academy. Eulalia is a very determined woman that likes to fend for herself to get ahead. She has a sewing shop in her house. There she makes clothing for women and children. She also buys clothing to sell in her shop because her customers come to her. She works every day from 9AM to 7PM and sometimes later when she has orders to deliver. She has been doing this work for more than 40 years and she loves it.

This new loan will be used to buy clothing, fabric and other materials for sewing. She has been in the loan group since the beginning and she likes the unity of the group. Her dream is to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothing, fabric and other materials for sewing.

loans.name: Esmeralda Gloria

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
Allí vive la señora Esmeralda, tiene 59 años  de edad, es madre soltera de una hija la cual ya es mayor de edad que aun vive en su casa. Ella hace varios años atrás  estudio corte y confección en un Academia de la ciudad.
Esmeralda es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta a base de trabajo salir adelante sin depender de nadie, ella tiene un taller en su casa lugar en el cual confecciona todo tipo de ropa,  lo que más le gusta es  hacer ropa de  mujer, en ocasiones confecciona uniformes para centros educativos, trabaja todos los días y cuando hay bastante trabajo casi todo el día, lleva más de 10 años con su taller el cual le permite salir delante de una manera honrada y haciendo algo que le encanta.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar telas, hilos, botones  y otros materiales de costura. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando con el paso de los días.
texts.en:
The loan group, "Mujeres Unidas (United Women)," gets together every fortnight in the Cantón Jipijapa, a canton known as "La Sultana del Café" because of its extensive fields of incomparably flavored coffee, its cuisine and for the warm-heartedness of its people.

Esmeralda lives here. She is 59-years old and the single mother of a daughter who is grown and still lives in her house. Several years ago she studied tailoring and design in a city academy. Esmeralda is a very determined women who likes to get ahead through hard work without depending on anyone. She has a shop in her house where she makes all types of clothing. The thing she likes the most is making women's clothing. On occasions she makes uniforms for school. She works every day and when there is a lot of work she works almost all day. She has had her shop for more than 10 years and it allows her to get ahead in an honorable manner, doing something that she loves.

This loan will be used to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing materials. She is a founding member of the loan group and she likes it because of the help that the loans give her. Her dream is to keep improving as each day passes.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Zoila Ana

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Zoila, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija de 2 años 6 meses de edad. Su esposo es laboratorista clínico.
Zoila es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante y progresar para el bien de su familia, ella estudia Auditoria en una universidad local, pero también para ganarse sus ingresos que le permitan salir adelante también se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo, tiene unas vitrinas en su casa en la cual exhibe sus prendas, ella también cuando puede sale a vender y también les vende a sus compañeras de clase, tiene muy buena clientela que ha logrado en estos 10 años que lleva realizando esta labor.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Lleva 2 ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son tener su titulo y ejercerlo.
texts.en:
The loan group, "Mujeres Unidas (United Women)," gets together every fortnight in the Cantón Jipijapa, a canton known as "La Sultana del Café" because of its extensive fields of incomparably flavored coffee, its cuisine and for the warm-heartedness of its people.

Zoila lives here. She is 28-years old, married and from this relationship she has a 2.5-year old daughter. Her husband is a clinical lab technician. Zoila is a woman who likes to get ahead and progress for the wellbeing of her family. She studies auditing in a local university but she also works in business to get an income that allows her to get ahead. She sells all types of clothing. She has some showcases in her house that exhibit her items. She also goes out to sell when she can and sells them to her classmates. She has a good clientele that she has achieved in the 10 years that she has been doing this work.

This loan will be used to buy pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing. She has done 2 cycles with the loan group and she likes it because the loans are quick. Her dream is to have a degree and use it.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Dora Petita

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Dora tiene 50  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos  hijos de  30 y 12 años de edad, la menor  estudian en colegio y es la que aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.
Dora es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y así generar sus propios ingresos que les ayuden a salir adelante, para esto ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa la cual la  empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo y que de a poco ha ido mejorando,  vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad así como también de bazar y papelería, ella también parte del crédito se lo da a su marido el cual se dedica a la venta informal de Cd de música o películas, ella lleva 8 años en esta actividad la cual les ayuda a salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres y CD para su marido. Lleva 8 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su tienda la cual es su vida. Sus sueños es seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The loan group, "Mujeres Unidas (United Women)," gets together every fortnight in the Cantón Jipijapa, a canton known as "La Sultana del Café" because of its extensive fields of incomparably flavored coffee, its cuisine and for the warm-heartedness of its people.

Dora lives here. She is 50-years old, married and from this relationship she has two children who are 30 and 12-years old. The younger one goes to high school and is the one who still lives in her house. Her husband is a merchant. Dora is a woman who likes to fend for herself and earn her own income to help her get ahead. To do this, she has a supply shop in her home, which she started with one of the loans that she received from the group and which has slowly improved. She sells all types of staple items as well as dollar store items and stationary. She also splits some of the loan to give to her husband who works selling music CDs and movies. She has been doing this work for 8 years and helps them to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy supplies and CDs for her husband. She has been in the loan group for 8 years and she likes it because with the first loan she started the store which is her life. Her dream is to keep improving her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies and CDs.

loans.name: La Clémence Group

texts.fr: Mahamba est une entrepreneuse, propriétaire d’une pharmacie, membre du groupe de crédits «La Clémence», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 32 ans et mère de 5 enfants parmi eux, 4 étudient et 1 est petit. Elle va acheter des produits pharmaceutiques pour renforcer ses activités. Elle commença ses activités par le capital reçu de son mari depuis 10 ans. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancable.
texts.en:
Mahamba is an entrepreneur, owner of a pharmacy, member of "La Clémence" loan group, and a client of the Hekima MFI. She is a 32-year-old married mother of five children of whom four attend school and one is still an infant.

She is going to buy pharmaceutical products to bolster her activities. She started her business ten years ago with funds received from her husband. Finally, she thanks Hekima for its support to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Iriba Ryiza Group

texts.fr:
Ally fait parti du groupe Iribaryiza et habite à Bujumbura.Il a 45ans et est marié à Pierrette, une magasinière.Ensemble, ils ont 5enfants âgés de 2 à 12ans,dont 3étudient.

Il a sous sa charge 2 orphelins qui étudient.
Il fait le commerce de limonade et  de bière industrielle (amster et primus) depuis 3ans.

Il est son troisième crédit. Avec le crédit kiva ,il va augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de limonade et de bière industrielle à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines année, il voudrait devenir importateur de bière et  voir ses enseigner les enfants.
texts.en:
Ally is part of the Iribaryiza group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 45 years old and is married to Pierrette, a shop-keeper. They have five children aged 2 to 12 years, of whom three attend school. He also has two orphans under his care who attend school.

He has been trading soft drinks and beer (Amstel and Primus) for the past three years. This is his third loan. He will use the Kiva loan to increase his working capital and buy a large amount of soft drinks and beer for resale, to earn more.

In the coming year he would like to become an importer of beer and see to his children's education.

loans.use: increase his working capital to buy a large amount of lemonade and beer for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Elonga Group

texts.fr: Mugabe est une femme d’affaires, membre du groupe de crédits «Elonga», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 59 ans, veuve, mère de 7 enfants dont 1 scolarisé et 6 sont déjà mariés. Elle est vendeuse du kérosène dans la rue de la ville depuis 20 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 160 litres de kérosène. Elle commença son business avec le capital reçu de son mari lors de son vivant. Elle souhaiteaugmenter son activité et nourrir son enfant. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mugabe is a business woman, member of the "Elonga" loan group, and client of the Hekima MFI. She is a 59-year-old widowed mother of seven children, of whom one attends school and six are already married.

She has been selling kerosene on the street in the city for the past 20 years. She is going to buy 160 liters of kerosene. She started her business with funds received from her husband when he was still alive.

She wants to expand her business and feed her child. Finally, she thanks Hekima for its support to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy 160 liters of kerosene

loans.name: Panorama Group

texts.fr: Mbuyiresi est une entrepreneuse, propriétaire d’une alimentation, trésorière du groupe de crédits «Panorama», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 46 ans et mère de 7 enfants tous étudient. Elle va acheter du sucre, riz, huile, farine de maïs pour renforcer ses activités. Elle commença ses activités par le capital reçu de son mari depuis 20 ans. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancable.
texts.en:
Mbuyiresi is an entrepreneur, owner of a grocery store, treasurer of the "Panorama" loan group, and client of the Hekima MFI. She is a 46-year-old married mother of seven children, all studying.

She is going to buy sugar, rice, culinary oil, and maize flour to bolster her business. She began her activities with funds received from her husband 20 years ago.

Finally, she thanks Hekima for its support to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy sugar, rice, culinary oil, and maize flour

loans.name: Dieu Est Bon Group

texts.fr: Yanyi est une femme d’affaires, fournisseur du lait caillé dans la ville, présidente du groupe solidaire «Dieu est Bon», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 46 ans et mère de 7 enfants dont 4 étudient et 3 sont mariés. Elle va s’approvisionner en quatre cents kilogrammes du lait pour renforcer ses activités. Elle commença ses activités par le capital reçu de son mari depuis 26 ans. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancable.
texts.en:
Yanyi is a business woman, supplier of curdled milk in the city, president of the "Dieu est Bon" solidarity group, and a client of the Hekima MFI. She is a 46-year-old married mother of seven children, of whom four attend school and three are married.

She is going to buy four hundred kilograms of milk to bolster her business. She began her activities with funding received from her husband 26 years ago.

Finally, she thanks Hekima for its support to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy 400 kilos of milk

loans.name: Samuel Group

texts.fr: Alya est commerçante, présidente du collectif de crédits «Samuel», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, divorcée, âgée de 51 ans, mère de 4 enfants dont 1 étudie et 3 sont mariés. Elle est vendeuse des poissons salés dans le marché central depuis 27 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en mille poissons. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu après avoir vendu sa machine de couture. Elle souhaite construire une maison et augmenter son capital. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Alya is a merchant, president of the "Samuel" loan group, and client of the Hekima MFI. She is a 51-year-old divorced mother of four children, of whom one attends school and three are married.

She has been selling salted fish at the central market for the past 27 years. She is going to buy a thousand fish. She started her business with funds obtained from selling her sewing machine.

She wants to build a house and increase her working capital. Finally, she thanks Hekima for its support to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy a thousand fish

loans.name: Pastor De La Flor

texts.es:
Pastor de la Flor con 47 años de edad,de estado civil viudo, vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de piña, con una experiencia en el rubro de 07 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Pastor de la Flor es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Pastor de la Flor is 47 years old and he is a widower. He lives in his own home made of earthen materials, along with his two children, in the district of Pucará in the Jaén province in the department of Cajamarca in Perú . He has very good references, both personal and professional, from members of his community. Most of the people who live in this region work in agriculture, business and ranching. 

Pastor de la Flor is a farmer, specifically, he grows pineapple and has 7 years of experience. The loan which he will receive will be used for his agricultural work, to apply and incorporate plaguicides and fertilizers; and to pay laborers for his harvest. This will help Pastor de la Flor improve his crop both physiologically and morphologically, and the productivity as well. In this way he will also have a good harvest, greater production overall and a better quality product. And this way he won't have trouble selling his product.

He is a new client for Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to use to purchase plaguicides, fertilizers and pay laborers for his harvest.

loans.name: Johanna Amelia

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Johanna, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual un hijo de 5 años de edad, el  mismo que estudia en escuela. El marido es Ing. y comerciante. 
Johanna es  una mujer que como muchas mujeres trabajan incansablemente junto a su marido para sacar adelante su hogar, ellos tienen una ferretería en su casa, allí sus clientes encuentran más que todo material para trabajos con madera, clavos, mdf, entre otros materiales que utilizan los artesanos que elaboran muebles,  ellos esperan que con la ayuda de los créditos ir aumentando la variedad de productos pues así ellos saben que más clientes llegaran  a su negocio ya que en estos tres años han logrado buena clientela y esperan seguir aumentando su clientela y sus ganancias.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar madera, clavos y materiales de construcción. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The loan group "Mujeres Unidas" (women united) meets every fifteen days in the Jipijapa canton. This place is known as the coffee sultanate because of its extensive coffee plantations, which have an incomparable taste, and for its gastronomy and the quality of its people.

This is the place where Johanna lives. She is 24 years old and is in a domestic partnership, from which she has one son who is 5 years old and is in school. Her husband is an engineer and a salesman. Johanna is a woman who, like many other women, works tirelessly along with her husband to get their household ahead. They own a hardware store in their home, where their customers can find all they could ever want for projects with wood and nails among other products. They know that more customers will come to their business because during the past three years they have built up a good customer base which they hope to continue expanding, along with their earnings. 

Johanna will use this loan to purchase wood, nails and construction materials. She has been in this loan group for 5 years and enjoys it because the loans are fast and very helpful. Her dreams are to give her family the best.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.ru: Фатима, 54 года, замужем, дети взрослые, самостоятельные. У Фатимы высшее образование, она преподаватель, работает в школе учителем русского языка и литературы. Около 10 лет назад она стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Фатимы на сегодняшний день у нее уже есть 7 коров, 30 овец, 6 лошадей, продает молоко. На 13,85 Га земли выращивает люцерну, пшеницу, ячмень. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Фатима обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от ведения бизнеса позволят улучшить благосостояние семьи и развить бизнес Фатимы.
texts.en:
Fatima is 54 years old, married, and has independent adult children. Fatima has higher education, she is a teacher, and she teaches Russian language and literature in school. About 10 years ago she started working in animal husbandry and agriculture. Thanks to Fatima's persistent hard work, today she has seven cows, 30 sheep, six horses, and she sells milk. On 13.85 hectares of land, she cultivates alfalfa, wheat and barley. Her total monthly income is about 20,000 som (KGS). 

With the view of further developing her business, Fatima has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) in order to buy three dairy cows for increasing the volume of organic milk sales. The funds from the business will allow Fatima to improve her family's wellbeing and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy three dairy cows in order to increase the volume of organic milk sales

loans.name: Twungubumwe  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Claudette fait partie du groupe Twungubumwe et habite à Bujumbura. Elle est mariée à Daniel, un chauffeur. Ensemble, ils ont 9ans agés de 5  à 20ans ans,tous étudient.

Elle a sous sa charge 1 enfant qui étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de riz, haricot, tomates,...dans sa  boutique depuis 8ans.

Elle est à son quatrième crédit à Turame.Avec le crédit kiva qu'elle obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de riz, et de haricot à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines année, elle voudrait voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Claudette is a member of the Twungubumwe group and lives in Bujumbura. She is married to Daniel, a chauffeur. Together they have 9 children ranging in age from 5 to 20 years old, all of whom are students. 

She oversees one of her children's studies. 

She has been running a shop for 8 years, selling rice, beans and tomatoes. 

This will be her fourth loan with Turame [a Kiva field partner]. She will use the loan to increase her business' capital and purchase a large quantity of rice and beans in order to resell them and boost her income. 

In the coming years she hopes to see her children continue their education.

loans.use: to increase her working capital, and to buy a large supply of rice and beans in order to resell them and boost her income.

loans.name: Karamat

texts.ru: Карамат, 46 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Карамат с 1988 года занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 6 коров, 29 овец. На 1,30 Га земли Карамат выращивает арбузы, кукурузу и помидоры для реализации. Благодаря упорному труду, ее деятельность приносит 27,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян, обработку почвы и оплату услуг рабочих для выращивания экологически чистых продуктов. Доходы от кредита позволят Карамат развить ее бизнес и накопить на завершение строительства дома.
texts.en:
Karamat is 46 years old, married, and has five children. She has secondary specialist education. As the main source of her family's income, Karamat has been farming since 1988. On the farm there are six cows and 29 sheep. On 1.30 hectares of land Karamat cultivates watermelons, corn, and tomatoes for sale. Thanks to her persistent hard work, her business brings in 27,000 som (KGS) a month. 

With the view of further developing her business, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) in order to buy seeds, cultivate her land, and pay employees for cultivating organic products. The funds from the loan will allow Karamat to develop her business and save to build a house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and to pay employees for land cultivation and growing organic products

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда жительница Яванского района. Ей 19 лет она замужем и счастливая невестка. На протяжении нескольких последних лет Мавлуда занимается шитьем. И не смотря на то, что опыт в этом деле у нее сравнительно не большой, она смогла достичь не плохих успехов и завоевать доверие своих клиенток. Однако Мавлюде в данный момент не хватает швейной машинки для вышивки. Она  с надеждой обращается к Вам за помощью и верит, что ее заявка не останется не рассмотренной. Мавлуда очень хочет купить эту швейную машинку и предоставлять своим клиенткам новые услуги.
texts.en:
Mavluda is a resident of Yavan region. She is 19 years old. She is married and a happy daughter-in-law. For the past few years Mavluda has been in the sewing business. In spite of her relative lack of experience in this field, she has managed to achieve good success and gain the trust of her clients. 

However Mavluda currently lacks a sewing machine for embroidering. With hope, she is appealing to you for help, and believes that her request will not go unseen. Mavluda very much wishes to buy a sewing machine and offer her clients new services.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery sewing machine

loans.name: Ryskan

texts.ru: Рыскан успешно погасила свой кредит, она использовала средства по назначению и очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Благодаря упорному труду Рыскан, на сегодняшний день она имеет в хозяйстве: 5 коров, 14 овец. Также в наличии имеется 1,04 ГА земли, на которой Рыскан ежегодно сажает арбузы для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 24,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рыскан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян, удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически чистой продукции, оплату услуг рабочих. Доходы от кредита Рыскан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса, а также ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Ryskan has successfully repaid her loan, and she used the funds as specified. She is very thankful to Kiva and every who helped her with financing. Thanks to Ryskan's persistent hard work, today on her farm she has five cows and 14 sheep. Ryskan also has 1.04 hectares of land, on which every year she plants watermelons for sale. Her monthly profit is about 24,000 som (KGS). 

With the view of further developing her business, Ryskan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) in order to buy seeds, fertilisers for cultivating the land and growing organic products, and to pay employees. Ryskan plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further development of her business, and renovate her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and to pay employees for land cultivation and growing organic products

loans.name: Yurik

texts.en:
Having already successfully paid back two Kiva loans, Yurik is sure that his third deal will be profitable for his business and family as well. He lives in Kapan city of Syunik region with his wife. Their children (son and daughter) live and work in Yerevan city and very often, with their children, visit their parents in Kapan.

Yurik still runs his business by cooperating with a very famous company of ice cream, frozen fruits, vegetables and juices which for 22 years already has been one of the most popular and famous companies in the Armenian food market. Yuri distributes the products of this company to different cities of this region such as Kajaran, Agarak, Meghri and Kapan as well. He works with the managers of over 300 food markets who give him orders and Yurik covers all of it due to his responsible and accurate way of working.

This time again, this loan of 500,000 Armenian Drams he is asking for will be used to refresh the assortment of products he distributes which he brings from Yerevan several times a month.

loans.use: to refresh the assortment of products he distributes which he brings from Yerevan several times a month.

loans.name: Pilisikila

texts.en:
Pilisikila is a smallholder farmer based in Kenyenya, Kenya, which is a town near the famous Lake Victoria. Pilisikila and her husband are blessed with three children.

Pilisikila has been a farmer for more than four years. She keeps poultry for eggs and grows maize and vegetables for sale. She also engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. Despite the fluctuation of prices in the Kenyenya market, Pilisikila is very passionate and optimistic about the future of farming in Kenyenya.

She is seeking a loan to expand her farm. She intends to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer. This move is quite a big deal for her. With a loan, she seeks to continue growing a variety of crops, but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Kenyenya and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently.

In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my three children.”

loans.use: to expand her farm business by purchasing quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 29-year-old married father of one child. In January 2015, he established a cleaning detergent manufacturing business, and is working hard on developing it as much as he can, after three years of experience in this domain.

He is a hard-working man who is putting so much effort to balance between developing his business, and replying to his beloved family's needs.

His business income is just good enough to cover his living needs, but not enough to invest in developing and increasing his business production. That's why he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary raw materials to increase his production and manufacture of his cleaning detergents so he has more to sell and can develop his business properly.

Mahmoud is working hard to expand his working zone and start distributing his production all over the Lebanese territory.

loans.use: to buy necessary raw materials to increase production and manufacture of cleaning detergents so he can sell more and develop his business properly.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes to raise them and after that sell them and make some profits.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and eggs. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and eggs.

loans.name: Gloire De Dieu Group

texts.fr: Marcelline est commerçante, présidente de l’association de crédits «Gloire de Dieu», cliente de l’IMF Hekima,  mariée, âgée de 60 ans, mère de 4 enfants dont 1 étudie et 3 sont mariés. Elle est vendeuse de divers articles de la maison et d’habillements dans un magasin de la ville depuis 18 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en postes téléviseurs, chaises, postes récepteurs, pagnes, chemises, pantalons, etc. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite construire une maison et augmenter son capital. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Marcelline is a retailer and president of the loan association "Gloire de Dieu" ["Glory of God"], a client of a microfinance institute called Hekima. She is a 60-year-old married woman and the mother of four children, three of whom are married and one who is a student. For the past 18 years, she has been running a store in the city that sells a variety of household items and clothing. The loan will be used to purchase television sets, chairs, receptor radios, pagnes [traditional Central and West African garment], shirts, trousers and more. Her husband financed the launch of her business. She wishes to build a house and increase her capital. 

She thanks Hekima for proving support to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy television sets, chairs, receptor radios, pagnes [traditional Central and West African garment], shirts, trousers, etc.

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah, a 40-year-old cattle fattener and trader, learned the business from her family. Her customers are markets in the urban centres. A banana plantation provides her other source of income.

Florah wants to buy more cows to raise and trade and so has requested this loan. Hardworking and innovative, her main challenge is climate change, which reduces her profits.

loans.use: to buy more cows.

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
Allí vive la señora Flor, tiene 59 años  de edad, hace muchos años se separo y de esta relación tuvo 8  hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, dos de ellos  aun viven en su casa.
Flor es una mujer que siempre le ha tocado trabajar duro y así salir adelante con su esfuerzo, ella con la ayuda de los créditos que recibió hace mas de 16 años surtió una pequeña tienda en su casa la cual aun mantiene y es la que le da lo necesario para vivir, allí solo vende víveres de primera necesidad, colas, aguas y otras cosas, no es grande su negocio pero lo ha sabido mantener hasta la actualidad y esto gracias a los créditos razón por lo cual está muy agradecida con la institución.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar víveres. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su tienda la cual le permite ganarse la vida. Sus sueños es tener salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Crédito Mujeres Unidas group meets every fortnight in the Jipijapa canton know as “La Sultana del Café” because of its extensive fields of incomparably flavoured coffee, its cuisine and for the warmth of its people.
Flor lives there, she is 59 years old and many years ago she separated from her partner, she has eight children from this relationship who are now adults. Two of them live in her home.
Flor is a woman who has always worked hard and thus has gotten ahead in life thanks to her efforts. With the help of loans that she received more than 16 years ago she stocked up a small shop in her home which she still runs and this gives her what she needs to live. She only sells basic products there, cola, waters and other things. It is not a big business but she has known how to run it up to now and this is thanks to the loans and this is why she is very grateful to the institution.
She is going to use this loan to stock up her shop further. She is going to buy supplies. She has been their since the beginning of this loan group and she likes it because with the loans she started her business which allows her to earn a living. Her dream is to be healthy in order to progress in life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru: 44 летный мужчина Зафар. Он из города Вахдат. Зафар опытный стоматолог. У него есть высшая образования. Он 15 лет работает стоматологом в родном городе. Зафар хороший стоматолог. Он любить помогать пациентам. У него имеется больше и постоянные пациенты. Зафар имее два сына. Сыновьям 21 и 19 лет. Они студенты, учатся в  университете в городе Душанбе. Зафар хочет, чтобы его дети стали образованными. Он хорошо воспитывает своих детей. Зафар запрашивает кредит для оплаты договора за обучения сыновей. У него возникли финансовые проблемы, и он не сможет оплатить за обучения. Зафару очень нужно поддержка. Он верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Zafar is a 44 year old man. He is from Vahdat city. Zafar is an experienced dentist. He has higher education. He has worked as a dentist in his hometown for 15 years. Zafar is a good dentist. He loves helping his patients. He has numerous and constant clients. Zafar has two sons. His sons are 21 and 19 years old. They are university students, studying at the university in Dushanbe city. 

Zafar wants his children to become educated. He has brought up his children well. Zafar is requesting a loan to pay for his sons' education. He has run into financial problems, and he is unable to pay for their education. Zafar really needs support. He believes in you and your support.

loans.use: to pay for his sons' education

loans.name: Sheria Group

texts.fr: Kitsa est commerçante, membre du collectif de crédits «Sheria», cliente de l’IMF Hekima,  mariée, âgée de 63 ans, mère de 1 enfant qui n’étudie plus. Elle est vendeuse des pagnes dans un marché du bidonville depuis 10 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 60 pièces de pagnes. Elle commença son business  avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite construire une belle maison en matériaux durables. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kitsa is a retailer and member of the loan group "Sheria," a client of a microfinance institute called Hekima. She is a 63-year-old married woman and mother of one child who is no longer in school. She has been selling pagnes [traditional Central and West African garment] at a shanty town market for the past 10 years. She will use the loan to purchase 60 pieces of pagnes. Her husband financed the launch of her business. Her goal is to build a nice house made with durable materials. 

Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for supporting non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 60 pieces of pagnes [traditional Central and West African garment].

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 53 years old and has six children. Elsie is married and has two children currently in school.

Elsie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Elsie has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Meryana Group

texts.en:
Marianne is the featured borrower for Meryana Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Marianne is a 38-year-old single lady who is responsible for the needs and expenses of two members of her family. She started, seven years ago, working as a hairdresser. She has wide experience in this domain and she is well-known in her region. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary updated beauty tools which will facilitate her business and help her in better serving her customers.

Marianne is the lady on the right. With respect to the other group members, Samira is the lady standing in the middle, Zainab is the lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy necessary updated beauty tools which will facilitate her business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie manages her van for hire, farming and livestock business. She is 48 years of age, a widow and has been blessed with eight children. Two of her children have settled into marriage; four are working while the other two are still studying.

Rosemarie did her best to sustain her family's daily needs. Now she would like to keep her businesses profitable and progressive. Rosemarie would like to focus herself on her transportation business. She would like to buy new brakes and cover seats for her two units of van. That is the reason why she's asking for additional capital of PHP 25,000.

She hopes and prays for continuous smooth flow of her businesses involvement.

loans.use: to buy brakes and seat covers for her rental van transportation business.

loans.name: Marcia Cristina

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Marcia, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  21 y 14 años  de edad, ambos estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo trabaja en la universidad local.
Marcia es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante y ganarse lo suyo y así colabora ya que los gastos son muchos y a su marido no le alcanza para cubrirlos todos, es por eso que ella se vio en la necesidad de generar sus propios recursos, ella tiene una farmacia en sociedad con una hermana, allí ella trabaja en ciertas horas del día pero aparte de esto ella en su casa también vende colas, aguas, cervezas entre otros productos que le dejan ingresos extra los mismos que le sirven para darle a su hijo ya que el estudia en una universidad en Guayaquil y los gastos son muchos en estadía y gastos propios de su educación.
Este crédito es  para comprar medicinas para la farmacia. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 12 años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos cada vez aumenta su negocio. Sus sueños darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Crédito Mujeres Unidas group meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa canton known as “La Sultana del Café” because of its extensive fields of incomparably flavoured coffee, its cuisine and for the warmth of its people.

Marcia lives there. She is 45 years old, is married and has two children who are 21 and 14 years old. They both study, at university and at school. Her husband works in the local university.

Marcia is a woman who likes to get ahead in life and to earn her own living. She sas that the expenses are a lot and her husband is not able to cover them all. This is why she saw it necessary to create her own income. She has pharmacy with her sister. She works there certain hours of the day but apart from that she also sells colas, waters, beers and other products in her home. This gives her extra income which she uses to give to her child as he studies at a university in Guayaquil and the expenses are high for accommodation and for the education itself.

This loan is to buy medicines for the pharmacy. She has been in the Credit Group for 12 years and she likes it because thanks to the loans she is able to keep making her business grow. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is a married woman, 56 years old with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ma. Luisa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ma. Luisa requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and other materials for her business.

Ma. Luisa has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Angelina is 55 years old and has one child currently in school.

Angelina has a hat making business in the Philippines. Angelina requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed such as bamboo leaves, paints, etc. to use in her business.

Angelina has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Angelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed such as, bamboo leaves, paints, etc. to use in her business.

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
This nice and elegant woman is 69 years old and she lives with her single daughter in Ijevan city of Tavush region. Her name is Seda. She has a vocational medical education and a specialty as an apothecary.

Seda is very clever not only in the field of medicine, but also she is very successful business lady. Before she also worked in her profession, but already for 15 years she has rented a space for her pharmacy and herself works there as an apothecary. She has great assortment of all the innovational medicine that nowadays are of great demand among the people who have directions from the doctors for the treatment of different kinds of disease.

Seda’s daughter is a very good dentist who works now in her profession. Seda’s business has been very profitable for her many years and still today, since by the help of its income she covered the expenses of her daughter’s education and she also bought all the needed medical equipment for her daughter to work according to standards and with modern tools.

Now Seda is asking for this loan of 600.000 Armenian Drams Seda in order to purchase new kinds of medicine with which she will renew the assortment of her pharmacy.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of medicine with which she will renew the assortment of her pharmacy.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Olivia is 16 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Olivia has been working hard to manage her market stall business, which sells silver fish.

To help expand her business, Olivia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add more baskets of small silver fish, and will help Olivia to generate greater profits and take care of her family by providing them with enough basic needs. Olivia hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a bigger restaurant in town.

Olivia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to add more baskets of small silver fish.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 23-year-old single young lady from Jenin city. Her father works in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family needs.

Rana is a student in the university where she studies Community Service. She wants to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to support her family. Rana took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university fees for this semester.

By taking this loan, Rana will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses she has. Rana appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for this semester.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Practically, direct selling business allows customers to shop without sweat. Another awesome perk - they have one-month-to-pay credit for any goods they get. They just have to browse from brochures, place orders, and wait for a day or two for the direct selling representative (or dealer) to deliver the orders, then pay the amount by installment in a month’s stretch.

Merlita, 50 years old, from Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental is into the direct selling business. She has different brochures of known brands like Ever Bilena and Avon. She shows these brochures to her customers where they can choose from different lines of products. There are cosmetics, toiletries, intimate apparel, and household needs. Usually dealers have 25% discount (or higher) from the brochure price which serves as their profit. They also earn from rebates, recruitment rewards, etc.

Merlita meticulously studies the specifications of every product in her brochures so she can easily answer the queries of her customers. Because of this positive attitude, she has gained their trust and confidence. Now she is expanding her network of target customers.

She is expecting a higher demand for her products as the peak season of Christmas approaches. Therefore, she has applied for additional capital worth PHP 40,000 to meet this. Her continuous income adds to her husband Antonio’s salary and supports their usual needs and college expenses of their two children.

She desires for good health, a brighter future for her children and harmonious family relationship where God is the center. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional cosmetics, toiletries, intimate apparel, and household needs.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marilyn offers a variety of vegetables within her local community. She has been in this kind of business for five years.She also raises hogs and corn crops as additional source of income.

Marilyn is thankful for her supportive husband. She would like to improve her sales and income that’s the reason why she’s requesting for a loan of PHP 25,000.

She will use this amount of loan to buy more stocks of vegetables such as cabbage, carrots, potatoes, onions and garlic. She knows that she could keep her business progressive.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables such as cabbage, carrots, potatoes, onions and garlic.

loans.name: Rosaida Margarita

texts.es:
