EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Rosaida tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos todos mayores de edad. Su esposo realiza fletes en un triciclo. Ella hace años atrás aprendió corte y confección en una academia en la ciudad.
Rosaida es una mujer que le gusta ganarse sus propios ingresos y así  ayudar a su marido a salir adelante, para esto ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura, allí ella cose ropa de mujer y de niños, en ocasiones también confecciona uniformes ya sea para instituciones educativas o de empresas de la ciudad, lleva más de 3 años cociendo por su cuenta antes cosía para otra persona por un sueldo, ahora que trabaja para sí misma gana más y con menos trabajo. 
Este crédito es para comprar hilos, telas y otros materiales para la  costura. Lleva más de 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos compro lo necesario para independizarse. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas group meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa canton known as “La Sultana del Café” because of its extensive fields of incomparably flavoured coffee, its cuisine and for the warmth of its people.

Rosaida lives here. She is 40 years old, is married and has two grown up children. Her husband makes deliveries on a tricycle. She learned to cut and sew many years ago in an academy in the city.

Rosaida is a woman who likes to earn her own income and thus help her husband to get ahead in life. In order to do this she has a small dressmaking workshop. The she sews clothes for women and children. Sometimes she makes uniforms for schools or businesses in the city. For three years she has been working for herself, before, she worked for other people in exchange for a salary. Now that she works for herself she earns more even with less work.

This loan is to buy thread, fabric and other dressmaking materials. She has been in this credit group for 5 years and she likes is because with the loans she bought what she needed to become self-employed. Her dream is to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric and other dressmaking materials.

loans.name: Helaria

texts.en:
Helaria is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Helaria is 51 years old and has three children who are in school.

Helaria has a fishing business in the Philippines. Helaria requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other supplies for her business.

Helaria has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Helaria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Emilienne Harinivo

texts.fr:
Emilienne a 35 ans, elle est mariée, le conjoint travaille comme magasinier.  Le couple a 3 enfants de 16, 12, et 3 ans respectivement en classe de première, quatrième  mais le dernier n’est pas encore scolarisé .
Elle est coiffeuse. Elle a créé sa propre activité depuis 2012 pour être autonome.  Avant, elle travaillait comme coiffeuse. Les expériences et la volonté d’être autonome  l’ont amené a créer son propre salon de coiffure.  C’est une femme animée d’un esprit d’entreprise, elle a également comme activité secondaire une pâtisserie.
 L’objectif est  de toujours  diversifier les activités génératrices de revenus, le but étant de pouvoir agrandir la maison et assurer la scolarisation et la réussite des enfants dans leurs études.
texts.en:
Emilienne is a 35-year-old woman married to a shopkeeper. The two have three children aged 16, 12 and 3. The two older children are students, while the younger one is not yet in school. 

Working as a hairdresser for many years, it was her experience and desire to become more independent that led her to open her own hair salon in 2012. She is an ambitious entrepreneur who also runs a bakery. 

She always aims to grow her businesses and diverse her sources of income, with the goal of making her house bigger and ensuring that her children succeed in school.

loans.use: to buy a hair washing unit, a shopwindow, a curling iron, 4 chairs and beauty products.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 50-year-old married mother of three, she has been working in conserving food as Mouneh and selling it since 2000. 
Her business is going on just fine, but her family's needs are increasing, that's why she is working hard to increase her production and sales,to make sure that she will stay capable of replying to her family's needs.

Sabah is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary egg plant, olive, and olive oil to increase her production and selling at the same time.
Her business is expanding, since her good reputation is well circulated among customers and potentials.

Sabah is very excited about this loan, and is willing to invest it in a well managed way.

loans.use: to buy yjr necessary egg plant, olives, and olive oil to increase her production and selling at the same time.

loans.name: Janat

texts.en:
Janat is 16 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Janat has been working hard to manage her charcoal stall business, where she sells charcoal.

To help expand her business, Janat has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal so as to increase her sales, and will help Janat to generate greater profits. Some of her income will be used to pay house rent for the place where they are staying.

Janat hopes for the future - she would love to open up a restaurant business.

Janat is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal so as to increase her sales.

loans.name: Mandiri Group

texts.en:
Mandiri group is composed of 5 energetic women and live next door. They formed the group aim to get a loan from Kiva, via TLM. They desire to improve their businesses but they don’t have enough capital to do so.  Mandiri group is chaired by Rossa,(standing in the middle) a 34 year old woman with two sons, their ages are 9 and 10; they are in elementary school.  To support her husband Luis, a 37 year old labor Rossa sells rice 3 times a week at local market; it is situated about 30 km from home. Every week she buys 100kg of rice from the farmer and resells them. 
  
She is expecting to sell about 200kg rice as it is the staple food for all people so it would be sold out quickly. She hopes to save some money for her sons school cost from the business income. Rossa and other women were interested when an Account Officer introduced the group loan product. They then formed the Mandiri group and requested a loan of totaling IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. They are thankful for Kiva focuses on the small entrepreneur like them.

loans.use: to buy more rice and build her own kiosk at the market

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora lives a simple life with her family in Tubigon, Bohol. She is 53 years old, married and has four adult children. She sells food like native rice cake known as “bingka” and “bodbod” (slightly sweet sticky rice wrapped in banana leaves and coconut milk) in the community just to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years to sustain herself every day.

Thus, Dioscora is asking for a loan to buy food ingredients such as glutinous rice, flour, sugar and coconut milk. In the future, she wishes to improve her business for her sustainability.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as glutinous rice, flour, sugar and coconut milk.

loans.name: Dúo Los Pedregales Group

texts.es:
Dúo Los Pedregales
Este dúo está conformado por Narcisa, ella es originaria de Sumpango, Sac Doña Narcisa se dedica a la venta de Tamales y paches de papa, cada fin de semana prepara 900 tamales ya que tiene un puesto en el mercado de la localidad, ella necesita de un crédito ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y es cuando las ventas incrementan y tiene que comprar ingredientes por mayor para estar preparada antes ya que los ingredientes aumentan de precio, es el cuarto crédito que solicita y agradece a kiva la oportunidad que le han brindado ya gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado a podido sacar adelante a sus 8 hijos.
texts.en:
The "Los Pedregales" Duo

One member of this duo is Narcisa. She is from Sumpango.

Narcisa makes a living selling tamales and "paches de papa" (much like tamales, but made with potatoes instead of corn). Every weekend Narcisa makes 900 tamales for her stall at the local market.

Narcisa needs a loan as the Christmas season is approaching and it is then that sales increase. Narcisa needs to buy ingredients in bulk earlier as prices go up.

This is Narcisa's fourth loan application. She is grateful to Kiva for this oppportunity as, thanks to this help, she has been able to help her eight children move forward in life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for producing tamales to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica con 37 años de edad,vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a sus dos menores hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como cremas,cosméticos,perfumes y accesorios,con una experiencia en el rubro hace 06 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría y comercio de ganado caprino. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de ganado caprino y de productos de belleza, con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.

Mónica es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha trabajado dos créditos de S/.800 y S/.1000 de los cuáles a pagado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Mónica is 37 years old. She lives in her own home which is made from rustic materials. She lives there with her two youngest children in the district of Pomahuaca, in the province of Jaén in the department of Cajamarca in Peru. She has very good personal and professional references from the inhabitants of the area. The inhabitants mainly earn a living in agriculture, business and livestock breeding.



She earns a living selling beauty products like creams, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories. She has six years of experience in this. She also earns a living breeding and selling goats. This loan is to invest in buying goats and beauty products. With this she will earn a better income and will be able to improve her quality of life. There is no better competition in the area in this business and so she will get better prices.



Mónica is a recurrent member of Edpyme Alternativa. She has worked with two loans, one of 800 dollars and one of 1000 dollars. Both of which she has paid punctually.

loans.use: to buy goats and beauty products.

loans.name: Flavia Francisca

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Flavia tiene 58  años de edad, está separada y de esa relación  tiene 6 hijos mayores  de edad, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa. Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia local. 
Flavia con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura hace mas de 20 años,  ahí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas y niños, trabaja en  base de pedidos de personas particulares y  en temporadas también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja casi  todos ya que cuenta con muy buena clientela que le llevan sus prendas lo cual es bueno para ella ya que así se gana la vida.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Está desde el inicio en el grupo de Crédito y le gusta la unidad del grupo y el apoyo de la fundación. Su sueño es tener un taller más grande.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Unidas meets twice a month in Jipijapa canton, a canton known as the Coffee Sultaness because of the incomparable flavor of its extensive coffee cultivation, and also for its cuisine and for the warmth of its people.

Flavia lives here. She is 58 years old, separated, and from that relationship she has six adult children. Three of them are still living at home. Several years ago she learned dressmaking at a local academy.

In order to obtain her own income and take advantage of her dressmaking expertise Flavia put a small sewing workshop into her home more than 20 years ago. She works there making all types of clothing for women and men. She takes orders from individuals and during the season she makes uniforms for institutions, schools, and colleges in the area. She already works with very good clientele and they buy her clothing which is good for her as she earns a living.

She is going to use this new loan to buy fabric and other sewing supplies. She has been with the communal bank since it began and she likes the unity and support of the foundation. Her dream is to have a larger workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other supplies for sewing

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lilibeth works hard to support her family.

She has a jeep transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Lilibeth is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts, gasoline and do maintenance for her business.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, gasoline and carry out maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell .to customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Amy's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 56 years old and married with five children. Elvira works very hard to provide for them.

Elvira runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, bread and other groceries.

Elvira has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, juices, sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, junk foods, hopia, candies and other groceries.

In the future, Elvira would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, bread and other groceries.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 50 years old and married with two children. Nora works very hard to provide for them.

Nora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, noodles, snack foods, bread, eggs and other personal care products.

Nora has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Nora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, noodles, snack foods, bread, eggs and other personal care products

loans.name: Lilubha And Group

texts.en:
40-year-old Lilubha hails from the Kamrup district of Assam. She lives there with her husband and her two daughters. She seeks a loan to expand her clothing business. She runs the business in addition to managing the household chores. Currently, she earns a monthly income of INR 7,000. She expects her monthly income to go up by INR 1,000 if she adds to her stock of clothes. With the loan, she plans to purchase in bulk and sell shirts, kurtis, pants, etc.

Just like Lilubha, five other women need a loan to expand their respective businesses. They have come together to apply for a loan. The loan will help this group of women contribute more to their household income and lead a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to expand her clothes selling business to sell kurtis and pants.

loans.name: Amudan

texts.en:
Amudan who is aged 32, is a very hard-working married man charged with the responsibility of taking care of 3 children. All three attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He deals in produce, primarily buying and selling of maize and beans on a small scale around town, as his main business.

He can make an average income to support his family. In order to supplement his income, he carries out farming, predominantly growing beans, soybean, and ground nuts among other items. He desires to grow and expand his business so as to improve on the standards of living of his family. He is limited by inadequate capital and price fluctuation.

He is seeking for the loan facility to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Vixaisong Group

texts.en: Songkan understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Songkan knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Songkan purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Songkan is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs Lan is 46 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling rice noodle for more than 10 years. Lan lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village. Her family has a downgraded toilet .
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic.

She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.
This is Lan first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution
.
With her business profit, Lan hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is a 38-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Juvelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 10 years. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, vegetables, spices, etc..

In the future, Juvelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 31 years old and single.

Jean is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jean requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Jean has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jean would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a widowed woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marina is 65 years old now.

Marina has a buy and sell spices business in the Philippines. Marina requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of spices to sell.

Marina has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Marina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of spices to sell

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is 52 years old, married woman and a mother of 4 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales with the support of her son, who is also shown in the photo.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she has requested for a Murabaha loan of 30000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

Gulshan aspires to further expand her business and increase the number of animals she at present owns.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase milk sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Roxana Leonor

texts.es:
La Sra. Roxana tiene 24 años de edad vive en el Canton Ventanas con su conviviente y sus tres hijos.
Roxana trabaja en la agricultura en la siembra demaiz y creianza de gallinas para luego ser comercializadas.

Roxana comenta que el credito va ha ser invertido en la compra de insumos para la siembra de maiz.

El sueño de Roxana en el futuro es poder comprar un terreno propio, en sus tiempos libre se dedica a realizar deportes.
texts.en:
Roxana is 24 years old and lives in the Ventanas canton with her partner and her three children.

She works in agriculture sewing maize and breeding hens to sell.



Roxana says that the loan will be used to buy supplies for planting maize.



Her dream for the future is to be able to buy her own land. She dedicates her spare time to doing sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies for planting maize.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 49 years old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband. She is having six children and one of her sons drives a van in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to change the van's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work.

That is why Shehnaz has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 35000 PKR for her son to buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers. Shehnaz is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en:
Saeeda is 49 years old, married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been successfully running a small general store. He has become popular in his community for providing good quality products and makes enough to meet the expenses of their 2 children.

Currently, she has requested for a Murabaha loan of 25000 PKR for her husband. He needs to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating healthier source of income

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina and her family live in Guindulman, Bohol. She is 51 years old with five children aged eight to twenty. Catalina's husband is a farmer, and as a wife she helps him in any way that she can. She is engaged in buying and selling bananas in town to supplement her husband's income.

She also sells ready-to-wear clothing locally known as RTW. Catalina needs additional funds so she can support their farming business with fertilizer, bananas from other farmers, and buy more new clothes to sell.

Catalina wishes to improve her businesses so her family can live a good life and her children can go to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, bananas and clothes.

loans.name: Yesica Mireya

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Yesica, tiene 36 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y tiene 3  hijos de 15, 11 y 10 años de edad, todos  estudian  en colegio y escuela. El marido es mecánico.
Yesica es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta ganarse lo suyo y así colaborar con los gastos que genera el hogar y la educación de sus hijos, para esto ella se dedica al comercio, ella vende  ropa de todo tipo, cosmético y productos Yanbal, Avon y Belcorp  (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale todos los días por las mañanas, en la tarde no sale porque tiene que ayudarles en las tareas a sus hijos ya que ella quiere  que sus hijos sean muy cumplidos y buenos estudiantes para que se forjen un mejor futuro, por esa razón lucha día a día desde hace mas de 9 años que lleva en este negocio para darles lo mejor.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas entre otras prendas.  Lleva 10 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Crédito Mujeres Unidas group meets every 15 days in the Jipijapa Canton. The canton is known as the sultan of coffee, for its vast plantations of coffee, which have an incomparable flavor, for its cuisine, and the warmth of its people.

In this place lives Mrs. Yesica. She is 36 years old, has a common-law marriage, and has 3 children who are 15, 11 and 10 years old. They all study in college and school. The husband is a mechanic.

Yesica is a very tough woman that likes to earn her own way and help with household and educational expenses of her children. For this she makes a living in commerce. She sells all types of clothing, cosmetics, and Yanbal, Avon and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women.)

Her way of selling is door to door. She goes out every day in the mornings and in the afternoons she does not go because she has to help her children with homework. She wants her children to be very accomplished and good students in order that are forged a better future. For this reason she fought daily over the 9 years that she has been in this business in order to give them the best.

This loan will be used to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and other garments. She spent 10 years in the credit group and likes it because with one of these loans she launched her business. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts and other garments.

loans.name: Takesure

texts.en:
Takesure is a mother of three children, though she is only taking care of her last born who is about to graduate with her first Degree from Great Zimbabwe State University. She is 55 years old and her husband is now a pensioner, so she is the one taking care of the family.
When she joined Thrive in March 2013, she was in a group called Zvikomborero translated as ‘Blessings’. Initially she was rearing 50 birds at a time though she had the capacity of larger batches but due to financial inadequacy, she was failing to keep larger batches.

The group received financial literacy training and as a group, this improved their knowledge in recording keeping, savings, and making good borrowing plans. They got their first loan, which improved their businesses though with an insignificant magnitude.

They took repetitive loans up to the fourth loan but the group size diminished with each loan cycle, up until now we have Takesure applying for her second loan as an individual. In her previous loan as an individual, she managed to finance her poultry business and later on ventured into selling Russian sausages, which is only profitable if she moves bigger volumes. She repaid well her previous loan.

She is applying for an individual loan of $700 repayable in 6 months to finance the existing poultry and new Russian sausage business.

loans.use: to finance the existing poultry and new Russian sausage business.

loans.name: Muborakkhon

texts.en:
Muborakkhon was born in 1951. She is widowed and raised two children. She is a very kind and responsible woman.

With her higher education, she worked in school for many years. Now she works in a local market as a math teacher. Her colleagues respect her and her pupils like her classes.

Muborakkhon now needs to financial support because her daughter is ill. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy medicine for the treatment of her daughter. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicine for the treatment of her daughter.

loans.name: Angelica Rosaura

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Angélica, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad, la mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo se dedica al comercio.
Angélica junto al marido tienen una microempresa, ellos elaboran deliciosos helados de paila en diversos colores y sabores, tienen un local en el cual día a día muchas personas llegan a servirse sus helados pues su sabor es inigualable ya que lo preparan con mucho amor, ellos también cuentan con dos  maquinas ambulantes en las cuales trabajan dos personas, ellos recorren toda la ciudad vendiendo estos deliciosos de helados los mismos que sirven en conos, vasos y otras presentaciones,  lleva más de 2 años con este negocio el cual  va creciendo ya que sus ventas cada vez son mejores.
Este crédito es para comprar frutas, azúcar, huevos, saborizantes y todo lo necesario para elaborar los helados. Lleva 3 ciclos en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir aumentando su empresa para seguir siendo fuente de ingresos para su familia y para las personas que laboran con ellos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidos (United Women) loan group meets every fortnight in the Jipijapa canton. Jipijapa is known as the sultan of coffee because of its extensive coffee crops that have an incomparable flavour. It is also known for its gastronomy and for the warmth of its people.

This is where Angélica lives. She is 28 years old, married and has had two children from this relationship who are 6 and 4 years old, the eldest of whom goes to school. Her husband works in business.

Angélica and her husband run a micro-business making delicious hand made ice cream in different colours and flavours. They have a store where many people come day after day to help themselves to their ice creams as the flavour is unbeatable because they are made with a lot of love. They have two ice cream street stalls where two people work for them by walking all around the city selling delicious ice creams which they serve in cones, cups and other ways. Angélica and her husband have run this business for more than two years and it is growing with more and more sales than ever.

This loan will be used to buy fruit, sugar, eggs, flavouring and everything necessary to make ice cream. Angélica has been through three loan cycles with this loan group and she likes it for the support they always give her with her loans. Her dream is to keep building up her business so it can continue to be a source of income for her family and for the people that work with them.

loans.use: to buy fruit, sugar, eggs, flavouring, etc.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 22-year-old single man, the sole breadwinner to five other members of his family. He started his own barbering business five years ago. Since then he has been developing it properly upon his financial abilities to make sure he is replying to his customers' diversified needs and requests.

Husein is a hard worker, with a very good reputation in his region. He had to quit school during the intermediate classes and start working to support his family. Working provided him with good skills and talents in his domain.

Husein has been an Al Majmoua borrower for two consecutive cycles. His previously acquired loan helped him to update his business' decor to fit with customer expectations.

Today, his Youth loan acquired from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will be invested in buying a specialized facial wax machine which will help him in providing extra facial and cleansing services for his customers.

Husein is looking forward to changing the shop's decoration in the future so that he can provide his customers diversified beauty services in a well-designed space.

loans.use: to buy a specialized facial wax machine which will help him in providing extra facial and cleansing services to his customers.

loans.name: Mercedes Ermelina

texts.es: Mercedes, tiene 37 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene tres hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio del progreso Yoro junto a su esposo, hijo y su madre. Ella trabajo por un tiempo en una maquila como operaria y hace dos años al quedar sin empleo decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de elotes (maíz tierno) asados, montucas, tamalitos, fritas todo de elote. Su negocio lo ha mantenido con buena clientela y lo ha establecido a orilla de la calle como punto estratégico de venta. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 20,000 lempiras para comprar elotes recién cortados para asar y también va comprar harina, carne de pollo, bananos verdes, frijoles, queso y otros insumos para vender comidas como baleadas y pollo frito con tajadas de bananos verdes, con esta inversión ella espera incrementar sus ingresos. Su meta es ahorrar para establecer una pulpería después y poderle dar un buen estudio a su hijo.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 37 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage with her husband with whom she has three children. She lives in a village in the municipality of Yoro with her husband, child, and her mother. She worked for a while as a worker in an assembly plant.

After two years of unemployment she decided to open her own business selling corn (sweet corn), roasts, montucas (a kind of tamale), tamalitos (corn cakes), and fried whole corn. She has managed her business with good customers and has established it on the roadside as a strategic point of sales.

She is asking for of 20,000 HNL to buy freshly cut corn for grilling. She will also buy flour, chicken, green bananas, beans, cheese and other supplies. She will sell food such as baleadas (a traditional dish from Yoro composed of a flour tortilla stuffed with mashed fried beans) and fried chicken with slices of green bananas.

She hopes to increase her earnings through this loan investment. Her goal is to save so she can open a grocery store later and to give her child a good education.

loans.use: to buy corn to grill and sell and to buy supplies to make and sell food such as fried chicken, sliced green bananas, and traditional baleadas.

loans.name: Dua'

texts.en:
Dua' is a 26-year-old married woman from Dier El Balah city, located in the Gaza Strip. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. However, she wants to improve her family standard of living to help them live more comfortably.

Dua' took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a solar water heating system for the family home. By taking this loan, Dua' will be able heat water more efficiently, enable the family to take warm showers, while also decreasing the electricity expenses.

Dua' appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar water heating system for the family home.

loans.name: Alicia Minelly

texts.es: Alicia es una mujer de 24 años que vive en compañía de su cónyuge en un barrio de Soledad, hace tres años cuando se comprometió, alternamente emprendió su propio negocio para ayudarle a su compañero sentimental con los gastos en el hogar e inició con un pequeño capital su venta de ropa con muy buenos resultados. En su local apertura de lunes a sábado a partir de las 10 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. un horario adecuado para que sus clientes lleguen a observar las nuevas colecciones y realicen sus compras. Alicia es madre de una pequeña niña de 1 año de edad y combina sus compromisos y sus roles para que ninguno intervenga con el otro. En la actualidad realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar jeans, blusa, shorts, pantalones, vestidos, camisas entre otros. Ella considera que esta inversión es muy apropiada por la temporada de fin de año y que le será de mucho bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Alicia is a 24-year-old woman who lives in the company of her spouse in a neighborhood of Soledad. She got engaged three years ago, and she alternatively started her own business to help her partner with the living expenses. She began selling clothing with a small amount of resources and with good results. Her shop is open from Monday to Saturday, from 10 a.m. until 8 p.m., which is a suitable schedule for her customers to arrive to see the new collections and make their purchases. 

Alicia is the mother of a 1-year-old girl and she combines her commitments and her roles so that neither interferes with the other. She currently made a request for a loan, a Kiva loan, for the opportunity to connect with her financial life through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to purchase jeans, blouses, shorts, pants, dresses and shirts, among others. She considers this investment very appropriate for the end-of-year season and it will be very helpful for her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, blouses, shorts, pants, dresses and shirts, among others.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen uses his own truck and has been involved in stone transporting and selling for 2 years. He lives and works in the village of Karmirgyugh with his parents who are also involved in farming. Armen drives long distances to sell stones, so that his family has appropriate income for living. 

The requested loan will help Armen to purchase six winter tires and a battery as well as cover costs of renovating his truck. This loan will be a big support for Armen's business, helping to sustain it. He wants to increase the business in the future to have more partners and enter new market areas.

loans.use: to pay for six winter tires and a battery as well as cover renovation work on his truck

loans.name: Omar Elizardo

texts.es:
Omar de 24  años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado de nivel académico, está casado, su esposa se dedica a ayudarle a hacer pan, tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos inició a estudiar parvularia. Con Omar solo vive su esposa y los hijos por lo tanto solo ellos dependen de los ingresos que él tiene.

 Omar, se dedica a la elaboración de pan desde hace 6 años, oficio que aprendió cuando trabajaba  en una panadería; luego decidió poner su propia panadería en su casa y actualmente solo a eso se dedica; Omar, se levanta todos los días a las tres de la mañana para preparar todo para hacer el pan, luego durante la mañana sus hermanos salen a vender el pan por todo el cantón y caseríos aledaños


 Omar, necesita el crédito para comprar 5 bolsas de harina, levaduras, aceite, azúcar, sal, etc para elaborar pan, ya que la época navideña se acerca y estará haciendo pan francés por encargo esto le ayudará mucho ya que serán muy buenos los ingresos para él y su familia


Los sueños que Omar tiene es poder salir adelante y tener una panadería muy reconocida en la comunidad y poder surtir de pan a todas esas tiendas y qeu no les falte nada a los hijos.
texts.en:
Omar, 24, went to school until the fourth form.
He is married and his wife helps him with the bakery.
They have five children, one of whom started kindergarten. This is Omar's only family and he works to support them.
Omar has been a baker for six years, a trade he learned by working at a bakery.
He decided to start his own at his house and this is his only source of income at the moment.
He wakes up every morning at three to bake bread, which is sold in the morning by his siblings in the town and the surrounding areas.
Omar needs the loan to buy five sacks of flour, leavening agent, oil, sugar, salt, etc. to bage bread.
With the holiday season approaching, he will fulfill orders for baguette and this will increase his income.
Omar dreams of improving his family's lot in life and of increasing his bakery's renown.
His goal is to sell bread to every shop in the neighbourhood and to make sure his children want for nothing.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients he needs to bake bread.

loans.name: Dúo Las Sumpangueras Group

texts.es:
Dúo las Sumpangueras
Este dúo está conformado por Elsa es casada y es originaria de Sumpango, Sac , Elsa se levanta muy temprano diariamente ya que empieza a tejer blusas típicas pues gracias a Dios tiene muchos pedidos ella no ha tenido dificultad para pagar, y ahora necesita nuevamente de capital ya que desea comprar hilo por mayor y así aumentar aún más su negocio, ya que el sueño que tiene es de tener tejidos de distintos colores y tamaños, ella agradece akiva por la ayuda que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of Duo Las Sumpangueras; she is married and comes from Sumpango, Sacatepéquez.
She wakes up very early every morning to weave traditional blouses.
She has many orders and thus always manages to repay her loan on time.
She needs more working capital to buy thread wholesale and improve her business.
Her dream is to weave garments of all colours and all sizes.
She thanks Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: to buy materials to weave traditional clothing.

loans.name: Hikoyat

texts.ru: Хикоят живет в Яванском районе. Она 54-летная счастливая мать троих детей.  Вот уже 17 лет как она занимается шитьем. Этому ремеслу в свое время научила ее мать. В данный момент сама Хикоят учит свою единственную дочку. Теперь Хикоят хочет приобрести новую швейную машинку с дополнительными функциями пошива. И в  этом она ищет поддержки со стороны программы Кива. Хикоят верит, что с Вашей помощью она сможет купить новую швейную машинку и за счет полученного дохода выдать дочку замуж.
texts.en:
Hikoyat lives in the Yavan region.  She is a happy 54-year-old mother of three children.  She has been in the sewing business for 17 years now.  At one time her mother taught her to sew, and now she is teaching her only daughter.  

Currently Hikoyat wants to buy a new, multifunction sewing machine and she is looking for help through Kiva.  Hikoyat believes that with your help she will be able to buy a new sewing machine and, with the additional income that she will earn, give her daughter in marriage.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of two children, Salvacion works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her general store.  Salvacion is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine vending business.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Adis Paola

texts.es: Adis de 32 años es una tendera por tradición que aprendió en el seno de su hogar este oficio, su madre siempre tuvo tienda y ella paso gran parte de su vida siendo su ayudante. La gran mayoría de su familia se dedica a esta actividad y su hermano le permitió trabajar con él durante tres años y cada salario que le cancelaba, ella lo ahorraba para su proyecto de negocio.  En el año 2009 aperturó su tienda de víveres en un barrio de Barranquilla en el que ha tenido mucho éxito.  Ella vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos de 10, 8 y 2 años de edad a quienes ofrece bienestar con el fruto de su negocio. Ella es una mujer muy planificadora y desea abastecerse de cervezas y gaseosas para la temporada navideña y de carnavales, por eso realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para lograr manejar mejores precios y contar con un stock acorde a la demanda. Su meta a futuro es comprar casa y allí adecuar su negocio.
texts.en:
Adis, 32, comes from a family where everyone manages a shop, and thus she learned the trade very early on.
Her mother has always had a shop and Adis helped her there for a very long time.
Most of her family is in this trade and she worked for her brother for three years.
She saved every salary to set up her own shop.
She finally opened it in 2009 in Baranquilla, and it has been very successful since.
She lives with her husband and their three children (aged 10, 8, and 2), whom she supports thanks to her shop.
Adis knows how to plan ahead and thus wants to buy beer and fizzy drinks for the holiday season (Christmas and Carnaval).
This is why she asked for a Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo's financial services.
Her goal is to buy wholesale to get a better price and to have enough stock to meet demand.
She aspires to buy a house in the future where she could set up her shop.

loans.use: to buy beer and drinks to sell during the holiday season.

loans.name: Maily Hajaira

texts.es:
Maily es una joven estudiante de Tecnología de Procesos de Producción de Prendas de Vestir, la cual le interesa mucho porque desde pequeña le interesaba mucho todo lo que tenga que ver con ropa y medidas ya que algunos de sus familiares desarrollan esa actividad.

Siente que esa carrera la beneficiará mucho en un futuro no muy lejano, porque es una de las carreras más demandadas en la actualidad. Debido a ello, Maily quiere prepararse bien y conocer un poco más sobre las confecciones para que forme su propia empresa y pueda trabajar con sus familiares cercanos, así como también con personas de su comunidad.

Se encuentra estudiando 2 años, aún le falta un año más para que pueda culminar su carrera y cumplir su mayor sueño que es formar su propia empresa familiar. El obstáculo principal por el que está atravesando Maily, es el económico, debido a que las mensualidades de su carrera están cada vez más costosas y la economía en su familia es baja. Lo que pone en riesgo que Maily pueda continuar estudiando. 

Es por ello, que Maily está solicitando este crédito a KIVA para que la puedan apoyar y pueda pagar sus mensualidades, lo que le permitirá continuar esforzándose para terminar su carrera, obtener su título profesional y cumplir su sueño de ser una empresaria de éxito. Para poder especializarse, ella piensa trabajar en una empresa de Diseño de Modas.

Maily, desea dedicarles unas líneas a los inversionistas de KIVA:"Me siento muy bien al saber que gracias a ustedes puedo seguir estudiando mi carrera que tanto me gusta. Gracias por apoyarme sin conocerme, porque por ustedes, podré culminar mi carrera y realizar mis sueños, apoyando también a personas que lo necesitan."
texts.en:
Maily is a young student of Clothing Production Process Technology which really interests her. Ever since she was little she has been very interested in everything to do with clothing and measurements since some of her relatives work in this industry.

Maily feels that this course will be of great benefit to her in the not too distant future because it is one of the most in demand courses at the moment. Because of this, Maily wants to be well prepared and know a bit more about dressmaking so she can create her own business and work with her close relatives as well as people in her community.

Maily has been studying for two years and has just one more year to complete her course and fulfill her big dream of creating her own family business. The main obstacle which Maily has to overcome is her finances since the monthly fees for her course are increasingly more costly and her family's finances are low, which puts Maily's continued studies at risk.

This is the reason why Maily is applying for a loan with Kiva so they can support her to pay her monthly fees which will allow her to continue striving to complete her course, obtain her professional title and fulfill her dream of being a successful businesswoman. She is thinking of specialising by working for a fashion design company.

Maily would like to dedicate a few words to Kiva lenders:

"I feel really good knowing that thanks to you I can continue studying the course that I enjoy so much. Thank you for supporting me without even knowing me because with your help, I will be able to finish my course and make my dreams come true while also helping people who need it".

loans.use: to continue her studies in Clothing Production Process Technology

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe A Cb Group

texts.en:
Noella is a group leader, aged 29. She is married with two children who are 1 and 3 years old. The group is called ABISHYIZEHAMWE which means “People with Solidarity” in English. The group in general sells different items and they wish to expand their businesses in order to have better futures.

Noella sells milk and has been running this business for the past 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more milk for sale. With the profits from the business, she will buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more milk for sale

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana is a 40-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She requested a loan for her husband’s green grocery business. Her husband has been selling vegetables for many years. He sells seasonal fresh vegetables in his hometown. He has been using a four wheel manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another. Now he has opened a shop for selling vegetables but he does not have enough cash-in-hand to buy initial inventories to run his shop in a good manner.

His children are growing and their needs are increasing. To cope with the rapid increase in the school fees, books, utility bills and household expenses, he wants to establish his business but he does not have enough savings to buy vegetables in bulk.

Therefore, Shabana has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal vegetables for her husband's green grocery business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 35 years old and married with one child. She lives in a rural community outside of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She operates a small general store selling a variety of food items such as rice, noodles, biscuits, sugar, and canned food. She has been doing this for almost five years.

Rebecca requested a loan to buy food items to help assist her in running the business. She plans to use her profit to help cover her family's daily expenses and also provide a better living for her family in the future. 

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy food items such as biscuits, sugar, and bales of rice for her small general store

loans.name: Juan Romy

texts.es:
El Joven Juan es soltero vive con sus Padres en la Provincia de los Rios en el Canton Ventanas.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura siembra cosecha de arroz y maiz, Juan comenta que el credito va hacer invertido para la compra de insumos para la agricultura.

El sueño de Juan en el futuro es seguir trabajando para salir adelante, en los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Juan, a young man, is single and lives with his parents in Los Ríos province, Ventanas district.
He is a farmer and grows rice and maize for a living.
He will use the loan to buy farm supplies.
Juan's dream for the future is to keep working to improve his lot in life.
In his spare time, he likes to practice sports.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Khuriniso

texts.ru: Хуринисо жительница города Вахдат. Ей 48 лет. Она родилась и выросла в городе Вахдат. Она вышла замуж за бизнес мена. У них две детей. Детям 19 и 21 лет. Старшая дочка учится в университете. Младшая школьница. Сама Хуринисо гостеприимная и жизнелюбивая мать. Она 3 года назад научилась кроить и шить женские одежды.  До сегодняшнего дня Хуринисо продвигает свою любимую дело. Она просто обожает шить и ей нравится сшить разное платье. Хайринисо вот так зарабатывает и  помогает мужу обеспечить семью. Она не смогла копить определенную сумму денег для оплаты договора за обучения дочери. Хуринисо не знает, как оплатить за обучения. Из-за нехватки она решила взять кредит и оплатить за обучения. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей дочери продвигать обучения. Хуринисо заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
Khuriniso is 48 years old and lives in Vahdat, where she was born and raised.  She married a business man and now she has two children, one 19 and the other 21 years old.  Her eldest daughter studies at the university.  Her youngest daughter is in school.  Khuriniso is a warm and cheerful mother.  Three years ago, she learned how to make women's clothing and to this day she is advancing her beloved business.  She simply loves to sew and she enjoys making different types of dresses.  This is how she earns her living and helps her husband provide for their family.  

Khuriniso was not able to save up enough money to pay her daughter's tuition and she doesn't know where the money will come from.  Because of the shortage of funds, she has decided to take out a loan for the tuition.  The requested loan will help her daughter move forward with her education.  Khuriniso would like to express her gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition

loans.name: Suhbatullo

texts.ru: Сухбатулло военный человек. Он служил армии, и после службы он решил заниматься мастреом по ремонту домов. Потому, что у него была мечта стать мастером. Сейчас он ремонтирует домов. Он 11 лет занимается своей любимой работой. Он научился к этому ремесло в армии. Сухбатулло честный и ответственный человек. Он женат и имеет двое детей. Дети еще маленькие им по 8 и9 лет. Они учатся в средней школе. Сухбатулло обратился за кредитом для купли стромйматериалы и для ремонта своего дома. Сухбатулло хочет улучшить жилищные условия семью.
texts.en:
Suhbatullo is a military man.  After serving in the army, he decided to go into business as a master builder because this was his dream.  He learned how to build in the army and now he has been in his beloved line of work remodeling houses for 11 years.  Suhbatullo is an honest and responsible man.  He is married and has two children, who are both still young at 8 and 9 years old.  They both go to school.

Suhbatullo has applied for a loan to buy building materials for his home.  He wants to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia hails from the town of Antequera. She is a 47-year-old married woman and has four children, of whom two are still attending school. She earns a living by making native baskets made of buli (palm). 

She would like to boost her earnings by acquiring more materials, but she does not have enough funds to do bulk purchases. 

Sergia has requested a loan to buy materials like buli and nito (a kind of palm) and wicker (pliable twig). Then she would be able to produce quality baskets that could enable her to provide her family with proper diets and be able to support the education of her two children.

In the future, Sergia is looking forward to have a stable income source and extends thanks for the support.

loans.use: to buy materials like buli and nito (a kind of palm) and wicker (pliable twig).

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marites is 37 years old and has four children who are in school.

Marites has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marites requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, fish, meat, etc.

Marites has been in this business for two years. In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, fish, meat, etc

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 50 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lolita has an internet café business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new computer supplies.

Lolita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new computer supplies

loans.name: Onis Elizabeth

texts.es:
Onis de 35   años de edad estudio hasta bachillerato por problemas económicos no pudo seguir con sus estudios actualmente es madre soltera de dos hijos el cual uno de ellos está en la escuela el otro es pequeño. Con Onis solo vive su padre y sus dos hijos por lo tanto solo ellos dependen de ella.

Onis tiene 1 año de poseer un negocio propio de venta de zapatos para hombres y mujeres, anteriormente ella trabajó  8 años ayudándole a su prima en el negocio de ropa, y desde entonces le gustó este oficio y desde ahí decidió independizarse con el negocio, ella se levanta a las 5 de la mañana a dejarle todo listo a su hijo para la escuela y a las 6:30 am se va para el negocio el cual viaja 30 minutos en bus. 

El préstamo solicitado en Credicampo lo necesita para comprar  más calzado para hombres y mujeres ya que viene la época navideña y es ahí donde ella vende más de este producto,  el crédito  le ayudará mucho ya que serán muy buenos los ingresos que tendrá para darle a sus hijos lo que necesitan. 
 
Onis sueña con tener un bazar de calzados muy grande, esto lo logrará con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio para tener siempre el sostén de la familia y que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Onis, 35, studied until highschool. Due to economic problems, she couldn't continue with her studies. She is now a single mother of two children, one of whom is in school and the other is young. Onis only lives with her father and two children, and therefore they depend on her. Onis has owned her own business for one year selling men's and women's shoes. Before this, she worked for 8 years helping her cousin with her clothing business, and since then she has liked this profession and decided to become independent in the business.

She gets up at 5 a.m. to leave everything ready for her child for school, and at 6:30 a.m. she travels 30 minues on the bus to the business. The requested loan in Credicampo is needed to purchase more footwear for men and women as the Christmas season is approaching and it is then that she sells more of these products. The loan will help her a lot, as the revenues will be so good that she will have enough to give her children what they need. 

Onis dreams of having a very large bazaar of footwear, which she will achieve with a lot of effort and sacrifice, so that she can always support her family and so that her children don't lack anything.

loans.use: to purchase more footwear for men and women.

loans.name: Yosor

texts.en:
Yosor is a 41-year-old married mother of four. Almost a year ago, she opened a grocery shop to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and ambitious woman who is trying to gain loyal customers and become well-known in her region.

Yosor is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with new items and products to satisfy her customers' demands. She hopes to expand her shop more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new items and products to satisfy her customers' demands.

loans.name: Dodihudo

texts.ru: Это дехканин Додихудо. Он сильный и ответственный человек. Ему 60 лет. Додихудо нравится постоянно двигаться. Он работает на земле. Ему в работе помогает сыновья. Додихудо нравится зарабатывать честно нажитым трудом. Он счастливый дедушка. У него есть сыновья и внуки. Сыновья учатся и работают.  Додихудо хочет заниматься купле продажей скота. Ему не тяжело выращивать крупнорогатого скота. Он уверен в себе, что справится с этой делом. Додихудо просит кредит для купли крупнорогатого скота. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ему приобрести скота и начать новый бизнес.
texts.en:
This farmer is Dodihudo.  At 60 years old, he is a powerful and responsible man.  He has sons and grandsons and he is a happy grandfather.  He loves to always be in motion.  His sons go to school and help him with his work on the land.  Dodihudo likes to earn his living through his own hard and honest work.  Dodihudo wants to get into the cattle business.  It's not difficult for him to raise cattle and he's confident that he can handle this business.

Dodihudo is asking for a loan to buy cattle.  The requested funds will help him to buy cattle and start his new business.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela es una mujer de 35 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijas de 3 y 16 años, y su negocio es la tienda de barrio.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora y muy constante. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘cruce villa Adela’ caracterizado por encontrarse el cruce de caminos que conectan con diferentes zonas alejadas de la ciudad, de este lugar se puede encontrar transporte público casi las 24 horas.
Angela es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado y baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla dentro de su entorno familiar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como chofer asalariado y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propiedad de los familiares construido de adobe con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio, los artículos más vendidos son, hojas de afeitar, champú, papel higiénico y otros, y los alimentos más vendidos son, pan, azúcar, refrescos, golosinas y otros, “empecé vendiendo golosinas frente a un colegio, reuní un pequeño capital y abrí mi tienda de barrio…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque abre durante toda la semana y hasta altas horas de la noche. La ventaja de su negocio es que no cuenta con competencia en el lugar, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer y surtir el negocio. Su sueño es tener una casa propia, ella desea abastecer su tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad. El motivo de esta solicitud es para poder continuar trabajando en su negocio ya que si no cuenta con mercadería su negocio no funciona. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que  Angela solicita un préstamo para abastecer su tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Angela, 35, is married and has two daughters (ages 3 and 16); she owns a grocery shop.
She is independent, full of enterprising spirit, and very dependable.
Her shop is located at the Villa Adela intersection, which is an intersection people take to reach faraway neighbourhoods in the city. This means that there is public transport almost 24/7.
Angela is not very tall, has dark skin, and wears her long black hair in a braid. Her mother tongue is Aymará, which she speaks at home. She learned Spanish and speaks it with her customers.
Her husband is employed as a driver and the couple's children go to school.
The family lives in a room owned by their extended family.The walls are of sun-dried brick, the roof is of corrugated iron, and the floor is of cement. The room has running water and electricity and is connected to the sewer system.
Angela sells basic household items and groceries at her shop. Among the most popular items are: razor blades, shampoo, toilet paper, bread, sugar, drinks, and sweets.
She says that she started selling sweets outside a school and that then she saved some money and opened her neighbourhood shop.
Business is booming because the shop is open every day and until very late at night.
The advantage is that there is no competition, but Angela struggles with a lack of capital to replenish her stock.
Angela dreams of having a house of her own; right now, she wants to replenish her stock of basic groceries.
She asks for a loan to keep her business going: if she has nothing to sell, she will not keep her customers!
This is Angela's first loan with the field partner in the five years she has been in business. Angela asks for a loan to buy basic groceries to sell at her shop.

loans.use: to buy basic household items and groceries to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar is a kind woman. She is married and has 2 children. Dilbar always tries to ensure the well-being of her children. She has had her own business dealing with buying and selling food items for more than 10 years.

Dilbar has a food shop. She is very responsible woman and she runs her business deal well. Dilbar’s husband helps her with managing the business. Dilbar periodically fulfilled the assortment of goods.

She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni now because she is going to buy juice, biscuits, candies and other things to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy juice, biscuits, candies and other things to increase working capital.

loans.name: Noime

texts.en:
Noime is a woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Noime is 23 years old now.

Noime has a food vending business in the Philippines. Noime requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, sugar, oil, bananas, etc.

Noime has been in this business for one year. In the future, Noime would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as sugar, oil, bananas.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 61 years old and is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Jessica has a general store business in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Jessica has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: María Gloria

texts.es: María es una mujer de 64 años de edad con inmensos deseos de salir adelante y lograr solventarse, ella es viuda y madre de dos hijas mayores de edad.  Durante años vendió carne de res en compañía de su cónyuge, sin embargo tras el fallecimiento de su compañero, no continuo con esta actividad pues no disponía del tiempo y tampoco del conocimiento para el reparto de la mercancía. Ella siempre ha sido una mujer dinámica y una de sus hijas le llevó dos vitrinas e inició un nuevo negocio de venta de accesorios, diademas, prendas de vestir y fragancias. Hoy en día cuenta con una gran clientela conformada principalmente por sus vecinos y amigos, ellos le ayudan a incrementar su base de clientes con referidos de este modo cada vez más requiere incrementar sus inventarios. María realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar pañoletas, collares, aretes, diademas y demás productos que le ayuden a incrementar sus ventas.  A futuro María se proyecta con mejores utilidades y mayores posibilidades de ayudar a sus nietos.
texts.en:
María is a 64 year old woman with an enormous desire to get ahead and find solutions for herself. She is a widow and mother of two adult daughters.

For years she sold beef with her husband. After the death of her partner she did not continue with this work because she did not have the time or the knowledge to distribute the goods.

She has always been a dynamic woman and one of her daughters took two showcases and started a new business selling accessories, headbands, clothing and fragrances. Today she has a large clientele made up mainly of her friends and neighbors. They help her to increase her customer base with referrals so that she has to continually increase her inventory.

María has completed an application for credit, a Kiva loan. This is an opportunity to join the world of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to buy shawls, necklaces, earrings, headbands, and other products that will help her increase her sales. Mary is planning a future with higher earnings and more possibilities to help her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy shawls, necklaces, earrings, headbands, and other products that will help her increase her sales

loans.name: Anjana And Group

texts.en:
23-year-old Anjana seeks a loan to start her jewellery business. She hails from Assam, where she lives with her husband and child. She currently runs a tailoring business, from which she earns INR 3,000 every month.

She now seeks funds to start her jewellery business. She expects to increase her monthly income by INR 4,500 by adding another source of revenue. She plans to sell ear rings, necklaces, bangles, etc through her jewellery business.

Anjana leads a group of 6 women. The other women, just like Anjana, seek a loan to invest in their respective businesses. They all hail from similar backgrounds and have come together to apply for a loan. They are grateful to their lenders for their timely financial support and encouragement.

loans.use: to start her jewellery business and sell bangles and ear rings.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a divorced woman and has been blessed with one son. She lives with her son in a very small house.

For the past 16 years, she has worked in a variety of jobs to provide a living for her son. Now she is working in her mom's beauty salon as a hairdresser. Beside her work she is selling clothes to increase her income.

Iman applied for a loan to purchase winter clothes to sell and to be ready for the season. She needs your support.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothes to sell to be ready for the season.

loans.name: Jahongir

texts.ru: Джахонгир молодой, но активный парень ин Шахритуса. Ему 24 года и пока что неженат. Занимается животноводством. С самого детства он помогал отцу и с возрастом принял его дело.  Теперь он самостоятельно выращивает и продает животных на местном рынке. Семья Джахонгира с нетерпением ждет, когда он женится и приведет в дом невестку. Однако для покупки приданного,  Джахонгиру нужна материальная помощь. Джахонгир просит ему помочь достойно отпраздновать свадьбу.
texts.en:
Jahongir is a young, but up and coming, fellow from Shahrituz.  He is 24 years old, and for now, unmarried.  He is in the animal husbandry business, which he learned from his father starting at an early age.  Now he independently raises and sells cattle at the local market.  

His family is eagerly waiting for him to get married and bring his bride into their home.   However, to pay for the dower, Jahongir needs financial help and he is requesting a loan so that he can have a dignified wedding.

loans.use: to hold a wedding

loans.name: April Rose

texts.en:
April Rose is a 22-year-old young entrepreneur living in Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. Even at a young age she learned how to engage in a business of calamay (sticky sweet delicacy that is popular in many regions of the Philippines. It is made of coconut milk, brown sugar, and ground glutinous rice). April Rose also raises hogs.

Calamay is a kind of food which is very famous in terminals and ports where tourists buy products and food from the province of Bohol. Due to the demand, she is asking for a loan to buy stocks of sticky rice, sugar, muscovado sugar and feed for her hogs.

In the future, she hope to develop her skills when it comes to business and make a good life and help support her parents.

loans.use: to buy sticky rice, sugar and feed.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 62 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Perlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries.

In the future Perlita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Skeeter

texts.en:
Skeeter is married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice and beans.

loans.name: Mildreth Cecilia

texts.es: Mildreth es una mujer de 35 años que conformó su hogar y fruto de su amor nació su único hijo de 10 años. Ella aprendió en su hogar materno a comercializar productos a emprender negocios fue formada para ser una trabajadora independiente. En la actualidad se dedica al expendio de comidas rápidas y servicio de video juegos,  actividades que le generan un ingreso seguro para el bienestar de su familia.  De lunes a sábado a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. apertura sus negocios y sus principales clientes son vecinos del sector de diferentes edades que ingresan al video juegos a pasar un rato agradable o simplemente a degustar un perro caliente, hamburguesa, salchipapas y refrescos.  Mildreth realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar materias primas: panes, salchichas, jamones, salsas, carnes e incorporará a su oferta prendas de vestir. Esta inversión le permitirá aprovechar la temporada de fin de año para incrementar sus ingresos y ofrecer bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mildreth is a 35-year-old woman that formed her home and as a fruit of her love, her only child, 10, was born. She learned to sell products and start businesses in her childhood home, which made her an independent worker. She currently works in the sale of fast food and in video game services, which are activities that generate a reliable income for her family's well-being. 

Her businesses are open from Monday to Saturday, from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m., and her main customers are neighbors in the area of different ages that pay for video games to pass the time nicely or simply to enjoy a hot dog, hamburger, fried potatoes with hot dog and soft drinks. 

Mildreth made the loan request, a Kiva credit, for an opportunity to connect to her financial life through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to purchase staple goods, such as bread, sausages, ham, sauces and meat, and to add clothing items to her supply. This investment will allow her to take advantage of the end-of-year season to increase her income and provide comfort to her family.

loans.use: to purchase staple goods, such as bread, sausages,  ham, sauces and meat, and to add clothing items to her supply.

loans.name: Mabel Antonia

texts.es: Mabel de 43 años es una comerciante que por tradición familiar decidió continuar con este legado, ella comercializa prendas de vestir, calzado y fragancias a vecinos y conocidos del barrio donde habita ubicado al sur de Barranquilla. Ella está casada y tiene dos hijos de 23 y 22 años de edad, en su negocio cuenta con 15 años de experiencia y con muy buenos resultados.  Sus comprar las realiza a almacenes distribuidores que le ofrecen buenos precios y calidad, es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para contar con el capital requerido para comprar nuevo surtido de ropa, calzado y fragancias, que promoverá en la temporada que se avecina.  Con esta inversión logrará utilidades para el beneficio de su familia y se acercara a su meta de tener una miscelánea y realizarle adecuaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en: Mabel, 43, is a merchant, who for the sake of family tradition decided to continue this legacy. She sells clothing, footwear, and fragrances to her neighbors and acquaintances in the neighborhood where she lives, located in the south of Barranquilla. She is married and has two children, who are 22 and 23 years old. She has 15 years of experience in her business, which has been going very well for her. She makes her purchases from warehouse distributors that offer good prices and quality. For this reason, Mabel applied for a Kiva loan, which gives her the opportunity to gain access to financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan, she will have the required capital to buy a new assortment of clothing, footwear, and fragrances that she will promote during upcoming season. With this investment, she will earn profits that will benefit her family and will bring her closer to her goals of having a small shop and of making improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of clothing, footwear, and fragrances.

loans.name: Rajabali

texts.ru: Рачабали 26 летный бизнес мен. Он занимается животноводством. У него имеется коровник и все удобство для выращивания скота. 5 лет Рачабали выращивает скота. Он покупает молодых телят, откармливает их 40-60 дней, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке. Рачабали холостой парень. Он живет в городе Вахдат вместе с родителем.
