Now a days she sells a variety of products including appliances, home goods, clothing, shoes and face, body and hair care products. She is very committed and works Monday through Saturday since early in the morning to 8 p.m. selling her products door to door.

She requested a loan, a credikiva, an opportunity to link herself to the financial life through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to meet her clients' product requirements in clothing, toiletries and small appliances such as irons, blenders and coffee makers, among other products.

In the future, Carmen sees herself with a well-stoked store and providing for her family's well being.

loans.use: meet her clients' product requirements in clothing, toiletries and small appliances such as irons, blenders and coffee makers.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is requesting a loan to buy cocoa. He got in involved in cocoa farming in 1998 to get money to look after his family.

He has six children, five attend school. His dream is to build a permanent house for the family and educate his children.

Despite his dreams, Deo is affected by unfavorable weather conditions which sometimes affect his expected profits.

loans.use: to buy cocoa.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is both a businesswoman and a farmer. She deals in selling local porridge made out of millet flour that is a local delicacy for the community people.

She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to help her buy flour and fermenters that will help her to increase her production and sales.

Deborah is grateful to Kiva for the financial boost and will repay to qualify for another loan next cycle.

loans.use: to buy flour and fermenters.

loans.name: Odhiambo

texts.en:
Odhiambo is a married woman with three children, all attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and running water.

She has operated a retail shop business for two years to sell wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors paying in a timely manner.

She will use the loan to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Alliyah

texts.en:
Alliyah is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up in Burundi, which borders Rwanda to the south. Due to her dedication and tremendous academic record, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. Alliyah chose Kepler because it presented the option of earning an international degree without leaving East Africa. She is only one of 5 students from Burundi ever accepted to the Kepler program.

Alliyah plans to major in Communications with a concentration in business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she wants to either work in business or become a journalist. A naturally hard worker, she wants to succeed and eventually open an orphanage.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Festo

texts.en:
Festo is involved in the business of cocoa buying and selling to cocoa companies in Bundibugyo, Uganda.

He is a widowed man with two children and the sole responsibility of looking after them rests on him. He is such a loving father that he strives hard to make sure that the children don’t lack anything.

Festo started business in 1998 and is so happy about the progress so far. He intends to use this loan facility to buy cocoa for selling as he dreams of completing his residential house. However, his biggest problem is over depending on the cocoa business, which is seasonal.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.name: José Edwin

texts.es:
José de 30 años de edad, tiene sexto grado de educación básica, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la venta de pupusas por encargo, también  él se dedica a la ganadería. José vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos por lo tanto solo ellos dependen de él.


José se dedica a la ganadería, compra ganado y lo engorda, luego lo vende después de un tiempo. También él se dedica a la albañilería, oficio que aprendió hace poco con la ayuda de un amigo que le enseñó, él viaja en moto hacia su trabajo y decidió hacerlo por los buenos ingresos que tiene, y porque fue la mejor forma que encontró para ayudar a su familia.


 El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar maíz, quesillo, frijoles, chicharrón, loroco, aceite, gas para la venta de pupusas, y para ajustar a comprar una novilla.

  Su sueño para su familia, es que sus hijos estudien y saquen una carrera que les permita vivir dignamente, lucharán mucho junto a su esposa trabajando para lograr todos sus sueños.
texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Jose has a sixth grade primary school education and lives with his common law wife who takes care of the household chores. He sells pupusas on order and also makes a living raising livestock. Jose lives with his wife and their two children, so they are his only dependents.

Jose makes a living raising livestock, buying and fattening up cattle, and then sells them after a time. He also works in masonry, a trade he learned not long ago with the help of a friend that taught him. He travels to work by motorcycle; he decided to do that because of the good income he has and because he decided it was the best way he found to help his family.

The loan he is requesting is to buy corn, fresh cheese, beans, fried pork rinds, loroco, oil, and gas to sell pupusas, and to arrange to buy a cow.

His dream for his family is that his children will study and have careers that will allow them to live with dignity. He and his wife have struggled together a lot, working in order to achieve all their dreams.

loans.use: to buy corn, fresh cheese, beans, fried pork rinds, loroco, oil, and gas to sell pupusas, and to arrange to buy a cow.

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en:
Ezra a married man with four children who operates a retail shop in Bundibugyo-Uganda. He has been in business for 13 years. To supplement his income, he grows cocoa ti harvest after every two weeks. The need to educate his children forced him to engage in business.

Ezra requests a loan to purchase biscuits, battery cells, sodas, and others to sell this Christmas season. He complains of inflation, inadequate capital, and the constant price changes of retail products. He has a dream of transforming his business into a mini- super market.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, battery cells, sodas, and others to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Kerria

texts.en:
Kerria is a first-year student at Kepler. Due to her dedication and tremendous academic performance, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. She grew up in Burundi, which borders Rwanda to the south, one of only 5 Burundian students accepted to Kepler.

Kerria plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. At Kepler, she hopes to develop her business and critical thinking skills in order to start her own business someday.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a 30-year-old married mother of one girl, and she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her daughter's school tuition fees.

The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back-to-School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students from low income families. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses.

By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Malak hopes to continue supporting her daughter's education and improve their living.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Duhuzijambo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Duhuzijambo comptait 14 membres dont 2 membres ,ont été exclus après la prise de photo: Michel en T-shirt orange debout sur la première ligne et Silvère,il est sur la dernière ligne , le quatrième, de droite à gauche. 
Désiré est le représentant du groupe et  habite à  Bubanza. Il a 36 ans et est marié à Goreth, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 3 à 14 ans,  dont 3 étudient.
 
Il fait le commerce du haricot, du riz, du sucre dans sa boutique  depuis  10 ans. 

Il est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz, et de haricot à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait  faire la culture du riz et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
The Duhuzijambo group was made up of 14 members but two have been excluded since the photo was taken: Michel, wearing an orange T-shirt and standing on the front row, and Silvère who is on the back row, standing fourth from the right.

Désiré is the representative of the group and lives in Bubanza. He is 36 years old and married to Goreth,a farmer. They have five children together, whose ages range from three to 14 years old, and three of the children are at school.

Désiré has been buying and selling beans, rice and sugar in his shop for the past ten years. He is on his third loan from Turame, and with the Kiva loan he is granted, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice and beans to resell, so he can make more money. In the coming years he would like to grow rice and see his children through school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice and beans to resell, so he can make more money.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the 25,000 KES, Amina wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Laura Alicia

texts.es:
Laura, de 34 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene seis hijos, es una mujer esforzada y trabajadora, día con día lucha para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos.

Laura, hace un año decidió instalar su puesto de venta de tortillas en su casa y sus clientes se han ido incrementando y que gracias a Dios sus ingresos son buenos.

Laura, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz, leña y para poder ampliar más el lugar donde vende.

Laura, sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y que sus hijos puedan estudiar y ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Laura is 34 years old and a single mother. She has six children. She is very hard-working and strong. Every day she works hard to provide her children with what they need.

A year ago, Laura decided to open a tortilla stall in her home. Her number of customers has been increasing and, thanks to God, her income is good.

Laura needs this loan in order to buy corn and firewood in order to expand her stall.

Laura's dream is to expand her business and to see her children study and learn a profession.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood and to build an extension on her home.

loans.name: Maristela

texts.es:
Maristela, de 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 7 hijos por los ha luchado para salir adelante.

Maristela, debido a la necesidad de subsistir con sus hijos, decidio colocar una tienda en donde vende productos de la canasta básica y con gran sacrificio ha salido adelante. 

Maristela, necesita el préstamo para surtir la tienda con productos como: maíz, arroz, frijoles y otros para poder obtener mejores ingresos.

El sueño de Maristela, es poder ampliar más su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maristela is 46 years old. She is a single mother to seven children. She has worked hard to help them to move forward.

In order to support her children, Maristela decided to open a shop where she sells staple goods. With a lot of sacrifice, she has made progress with this shop.

Maristela needs this loan in order to stock up her shop with products such as corn, rice, beans and more and to earn a higher income.

Maristela's dream is to expand her business further and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to stock up her shop with products such as corn, rice, beans and more.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Doña Raquel, de 55 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en el municipio del Progreso, Yoro. Ella cuenta con un negocio de ventas de cosméticos, donde ofrece productos como ser cremas, champu, lociones, accesorios para damas como ser aretes, pulceras, cadenas, maquillaje y otros. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años de forma ambulante, entregando producto por pedidos. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de productos lácteos como ser cuajada y más. Actualmente solicita la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras que invertirá en la compra de más productos como lociones, champú, aretes, pulceras, cadenas y cremas para aumentar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias. Su meta es lograr expandir su negocio y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Doña Raquel is 55 years old, and she is a single mother who lives with her two children in the municipality of Progreso, Yoro. She relies on her business of the sale of cosmetics, where she offers products such as cream, shampoo, lotion, and women's accessories such as earrings, bracelets, necklaces, makeup, and more.

She has been doing this business for 3 years as a traveling merchant, delivering products for orders. Previously she worked in the sale of dairy products, such as cheese curd and more. 

Currently she is requesting the amount of 15,000 Honduran Lempiras that she will invest in the purchase of more products, such as lotion and cream, shampoo, earrings, bracelets, and necklaces, in order to increase her sales and get better profit. Her goal is to expand her business and to have better economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase products to supply her business, such as lotion and cream, shampoo, earrings, bracelets, and necklaces.

loans.name: Marisol Marlene

texts.es: Doña Marisol de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 30 años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de lunes a viernes y tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Marisol is 52 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her husband and two children.

She has had a small beauty salon in her home for 30 years. She works from Monday to Friday and has many customers as she does good work. With profits from her business and support from her husband, the couple is able to cover household costs.

Marisol is applying for a loan in order to buy products for her beauty salon, including creams, shampoo, hairpins, scissors and other items that she needs. She can thus earn higher profits, which will help her to be more financially stable.

loans.use: to buy products for her beauty salon, including creams, shampoo, hairpins, scissors ando other items that she needs.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA DE CALCA, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia Vilma tiene 32 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocios de crianza de animales menores como cuyes entre otros, la socia cría a estos animalitos para engordarlos y luego venderlos a sus clientes que más le solicitan, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y responsable, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y alimentos.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the "Señor de Huanca de Calca" communal bank, located the in the province of Cusco, and department of the same name.

Vilma is 32 years old and is single. She has a business raising small animals, including guinea pigs. She raises the animals in order to sell them to customers. Vilma is enterprising and responsible. She wants to continue working in order to keep on supporting her family.

Vilma is applying for a loan in order to buy guinea pigs and feed.

Vilma is grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and feed.

loans.name: Birashoboka Ii Group

texts.fr:
Digne fait partie du groupe Birashoboka et habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 31ans et est mariée à Prudence un maitre. Ensemble, ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 3ans à 8 ans, tous étudient.

Elle a sous charge 2 personnes  dont 1  étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de bière, de  riz, de haricot, …depuis 21 ans.

Elle  est  à son dix-huitième  crédit à turame. Avec le crédit kiva qu'elle obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bière à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait faire le commerce des habits.
texts.en:
Digne belongs to the Birashoboka group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 31 years old and is married to Prudence, who is a primary school teacher. They have two children (three and eight years old), both of whom are at school. She also has two other dependants, one of whom is at school.

Digne has been buying and selling beer, rice, beans, etc. for the past 21 years. She is on her 18th loan from Turame and with the Kiva loan she is granted, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of beer to resell, so she can earn more money. In the coming years she would like to buy and sell clothing.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of beer to resell, so she can earn more money.

loans.name: Edgar Adrian

texts.es:
Edgar, es un joven estudiante de la carrera de Matriceria, la cual eligió porque tenía poca experiencia en ese campo desde hace algún tiempo y quería especializarse más para poder lograr sus metas propuestas. Esta carrera lo beneficiará económicamente porque es una carrera de alta demanda laboral y le permitirá ayudar a su familia, desarrollando un centro de labores en beneficio familiar.

Edgar, está estudiando su carrera dos años y medio, le falta muy poco para poder culminar sus estudios. Le va muy bien, aprovecha cada enseñanza brindada, le dedica 15 horas diarias a sus estudios, entre clases prácticas y clases teóricas. 

Cuando acabe su carrera, piensa trabajar en todo lo relacionado a Matriceria, desea lograr experiencia a nivel extranjero y seguir más adelante otra materia relacionada a su carrera.

Uno de sus grandes sueños es poder cumplir sus objetivos profesionales, ser un profesional exitoso bien capacitado. Edgar es una persona que lucha siempre por salir adelante y más aún estudiando la carrera que tanto le gusta, por la cual se esfuerza mucho.

El mayor obstáculo que tiene Edgard por ahora es no poder terminar su carrera por problemas económicos, porque sus padres no se encuentran en una buena situación económica, lo que pone en riesgo la continuidad de su desarrollo profesional. Es por ello, que recurre a KIVA para que le puedan brindar su apoyo con este crédito, lo que le permitirá poder ayudar a sus padres con el pago de sus estudios, y lo principal es que podrá concluir su carrera en el tiempo estimado.

Edgard, quiere expresarles unas líneas a los inversionistas de KIVA: "Muchas gracias KIVA por el apoyo que me brindan sin conocerme, me siento muy alegre y mi familia también les agradece de corazón el apoyo que me están brindando. No los defraudaré, haré que se sientan felices porque sabré corresponder cada centavo que me presten.
texts.en:
Edgar is a young student in the field of die-stamping, which he chose because he had a little experience in this field, and he wanted to specialize more to be able to achieve his goals. This career will benefit him economically because it is in high demand, and it will allow him to help his family, developing a work center for the family benefit.

Edgar has been studying this career for 2 1/2 years, and he has very little left to finish his studies. It is going very well for him. He takes advantage of every opportunity for learning, dedicating 15 hours per day to his studies, between practical and theoretical classes. When he finishes his studies, he intends to work in the trade of die-stamping. He wants to gain foreign-level experience and continue farther in other matters related to his field. 

One of his biggest dreams is to be able to fulfill his professional objectives to be a successful and well-trained professional. Edgar is a person that always strives to get ahead, and he puts forth effort even more so because he is studying a career that he enjoys so much.

The biggest obstacle that Edgar has right now is not being able to finish his studies due to economic problems because his parents are not in a good economic situation, which puts the continuation of his professional development at risk. It is because of this that he is asking Kiva to provide support with this loan, which will allow him to help his parents pay for his studies, and the main reason is that he will be able to conclude his studies in the estimated time.

Edgar wants to express a few sentences to the investors of Kiva: "Thank you, Kiva, for the support that you offer me without knowing me. I feel very happy, and my family also gives you heartfelt thanks for the support that you are offering. I will not disappoint you; I will make you happy because I know I will repay every penny that you lend me."

loans.use: to continue with his studies in the trade of die-stamping and fulfill his dream of becoming an excellent professional.

loans.name: Ephrahim

texts.en:
The above client is a new borrower from UGAFODE Nakasero Branch. He is married with six children of whom all are school going.

He came to UGAFODE for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 purposely to buy a music system to keep his business up-to-date so that it creates more income.

Pictured is the client (left) and the UGAFODE credit staff.

loans.use: to buy a music system.

loans.name: Rose..

texts.en:
Rose.. is a cocoa trader who is requesting a loan to buy cocoa to sell. She has been in business for the last 15 years having started with a small plantation.

She is happy with her business progress because she has achieved a lot, especially the fact that she has been able to take good care of her family. Unpredictable weather changes have been a problem to her business in that the cocoa takes a long time to dry during the rainy season.

Her greatest dream is constructing a family house.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Malak 2 Group

texts.en:
Ola is the featured borrower for Malak 2 Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and make a living at the same time.
Ola is a 37-year-old married mother of four. Three years ago, she started cooking at her house and selling to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is working hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy nuts, nylon bags, and a freezer which will help her increase her production. She is the first lady on the left. With respect to the other group members, Sarah is the lady in the middle, and Douaa is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy nuts, nylon bags, and a freezer to increase her production.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco a sus 40 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 14 y 16 años de edad, además tiene dos hijos mayores de edad que apoyan con los gastos de la casa. Él es muy trabajador y se dedica a prestar sus servicios varios en una hacienda cercana a su vivienda, por lo que se siente feliz, de poder llevar el sustento a su familia. Francisco desea mejorar el cuarto en el que preparan los alimentos de su familia, ya que este no se encuentra protegido, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, clavos, alambre y madera para reconstruir el cuarto de la cocina y tener un lugar adecuado para los alimentos.
texts.en: Francisco, at 40 years old, lives with his life partner and their two children, who are 14 and 18 years of age.  Francisco also has two older children who help support the home expenses.  He is a very hard worker, and to make a living, he offers his various services at a ranch close to his home, and it makes him happy to earn a the means of living for his family.  Francisco wishes to improve the room in which his family’s food is prepared, since it is not protected.  For this, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: sheet metal, nails, wire, and wood to rebuild the kitchen and have a suitable room for food.

loans.use: to invest in sheet metal, nails, wire, and wood to rebuild his kitchen and have a suitable room for food.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 44-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three school-aged children.

He has been working independently since 2005 as a beekeeper and his wife owns a cloth shop. Due to their bad financial situation, Hasan seeks a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay for his children's stationery and materials for school. The aim is to ensure a good education for them.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school stationery and materials.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en: Julita is from Solana. She is married and had three children. She and her spouse are farmers who plant and harvest rice to sell. She would like to improve crop production that is why she is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy insecticides, pesticides and herbicides use in farming. This will help improve crop production and someday acquire better yields. She hopes to continue acquiring good profits to save fund for family's emergency expenses.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, pesticides and herbicides use in farming

loans.name: Faisi

texts.en:
Faisi is a married woman with five children, who all live in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in the buying and selling of cocoa, a business that has grown drastically.

The idea behind engaging in this business was to care of her home and educate her children. She meets a difficulty of too much rainfall that hinders cocoa from drying.

Faisi is focusing on educating her children until they finish school. The purpose of the loan is to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Azizi

texts.en: Azizi a resident of Bundibugyo district and is a married man with four children. He owns a general merchandise retail shop selling products like sugar, soap, soda, maize flour and many other items. To supplement his incomes he also does baking of bans and chapattis as well as farming. He started his retail business in 2009 to raise income to support his family, being their only provider. Azizi wants to  stock up for the Christmas season where he is expecting to make big sales, but the money at hand is not enough to do so. He intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise like balloons, bread, sodas, rice and many other items to sell. His aspiration is to buy land to grow bananas for commercial purposes.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like balloons, bread, sodas, rice and many other items to sell.

loans.name: Wend Yam Group

texts.fr: Zonabou est mariée mère de 8 enfants et âgée de 44 ans. elle vend de la friture dans son quartier et cela fait 4 ans qu'elle exerce cette activité. elle a besoin d'un prêt pour acheter du haricot à 100 000 f, 2 bidons d'huile à 14 000 f et du tubercule (ignames, bananes, et de la farine) à 45 000 et le reste 16 000 pour charger les gaz afin de pouvoir vendre ses fritures. Dans le quartier Zonabou est la seule à faire cette activité ce qui fait bien marcher son activité de friture en plus de cela elle est très propre et ses friture ont un goût très particulier que les clients aiment. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire des épargnes, de s'occuper de sa famille et aussi de continuer ses activités. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt une fois et à rembourser à la date prévue à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Zonabou is a married mother of eight and is 44 years old. She sells fried food in her neighborhood and has been doing this for the past four years. She needs a loan to buy beans to a value of 100,000 francs, two containers of oil for 14,000 francs and tubers (yams, bananas and flour) for 45,000 francs; the balance of 16,000 francs will be use to load the gas, so she can sell her fried food.

Zonabou is the only person to carry out this activity in her neighborhood so it works.well; furthermore she is very clean and her fried food has a very specific taste which her customers like. Once she has sold her goods, she will have sufficient profit to save some money, take care of her family and continue her business. She has already had one loan and repaid ACFIME on time.

loans.use: to buy beans to a value of 100,000 francs, two containers of oil for 14,000 francs and tubers (yams, bananas and flour) for 45,000 francs; the balance of 16,000 francs will be use to load the gas.

loans.name: Gilma Yunisa

texts.es:
Gilma, de 27 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos por los cuales ha luchado para salir adelante.

Gilma, vendía ropa tres veces a la semana de manera ambulante; pero ahora quiere colocar un puesto de venta de tortillas, porque debido a la situación delincuencial no puede ir a vender a algunas zonas donde hay muchas pandillas.

Gilma, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz, leña y para reparar el techo del lugar donde vendera las tortillas. 

Gilma, sueña con tener su propia vivienda y ver a sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales.
texts.en: Gilma is 27 years old. She is a single mom, she has two children for whom she works hard to get ahead. Gila used to sell clothing three times per week on the street. Now, she has a tortilla stand, because she is not able to go to some neighborhoods to sell due to gang activity. Gilma needs a loan to buy corn, firewood and to repair the roof of the building where she will sell the tortillas. Gila dreams with having her own home and to see her chilren turn into professionals.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, and to repair the roof of the building where she will sell tortillas.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Like many women it was financial constraints that played a potent factor in encouraging Naseem to approach Kashf Foundation in search for a loan. Naseem is a 27 years old married woman and mother of 2 children. In order to support her husband (shown in the photo) in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated.

She has requested for a Murabaha loan of 40000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase milk sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Zohida

texts.ru: Зохида  молодая и жизнерадостная женщина. Она родилась 1980 году. Она родилась и росла в рабочей семьи. После окончание школы, вышла замуж. У  Зохиды среднее образование. Она заботливая мать двоих  детей. Муж Зохиды, Хуршед. Работает сантехником. Но его заработная плата не хватит на содержание семьи и учебы детей. По этому Зохида вместе с мужем  решили дома заняться животноводством, что приносит им дополнительный доход. В месяц два раза муж  Зохиды покупает скот из рынок скота. Зохида вместе с детьми откармливает их. И спустя два или три месяца снова  продает их. Часть полученную выручку они тратят на покупку корма для скота. А другую часть тратят на  содержание семьи. Дети Зохиды в свободное время помогает ей по хозяйству. А Зохида может большую часть свое свободное время тратит на ухаживанием скота. Поэтому посоветовавшись  с мужем Зохида решила расширить свой объем поголовье скота. Но у неё не хватает собственных средств. Поэтому они решили обратится в МДО “Арванд” за кредитом. На полученный кредит они хотят расширят свой бизнес.  И таким образом получить дополнительный доход, что хватит им для учебу детей и для содержание семьи.
texts.en: Zohida is a cheerful young woman. She was born in 1980 and grew up in a working class family. She married after completing high school, and is now the mother of two children. Her husband is a plumber, but he doesn't make enough to support the family and pay for the children's education. Because of this Zohida and her husband decided to raised livestock to earn additional income. Twice a month her husband buys animals at the livestock market, and Zohida and the children feed them. After two or three months the animals are resold. Some of the money earned goes to purchasing animal feed, and some is spent on the family. Zohida spends much of her free time caring for the animals, and the children help her as well. Zohida and her husband together decided to increase the number of animals they raise. To do this they will need additional capital, so they decided to request a loan from Arvand. The loan will be used to expand their business. The additional income earned will be used to provide for the family and pay for the children's education.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is 41 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is her son, who is a barber by profession. He is known in his town for doing good hair styling and cutting. He makes enough to contribute in the family income. Now, he needs to serve more customers, time after time.

For this reason Nagina has obtained a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR, for her son. It enabled him to purchase more packs of hair scissors, brushes and combs, along with some furniture for his salon.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of hair scissors, brushes and combs and some furniture for her son's salon.

loans.name: José Ezequiel

texts.es:
José de 34 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, José en esta relación ha procreado un hijo que depende de él al igual que su esposa.


José se dedica a la carpintería desde ya hace15 años, oficio que aprendió de un familiar que se dedicaba a lo mismo, fue así como el le gustó este trabajo y decidió implementar su propia carpintería, desde entonces es su principal fuente de ingresos y de eso ha podido sacar adelante su familia.


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar una máquina cepilladora de madera que le están vendiendo a buen precio, es una maquina que le va a beneficiar mucho porque tiene bastante trabajo encargado y así quedarán muy bien elaborados.


Los sueños que él tiene es que Dios le dé vida para seguir trabajando, que la carpintería sea muy conocida en la comunidad y algún día asociarse con las comerciales para proveerles los muebles que él elabora.
texts.en:
Jose is 34 years old, and has a seventh grade education. He is in a common-law relationship, and his partner takes care of the household chores. From this relationship, Jose has a son who depends on him as does his wife.

Jose has been engaged in carpentry for fifteen years already. He learned this trade from a family member who is also a carpenter and, since he liked this work, he decided to open his own carpentry shop. Since then, this has been his main source of income, which has enabled him to get his family ahead.

The loan he is requesting is for the purchase of a wood planing machine, which is being sold for a very good price. This machine will be of great benefit because he has quite a lot of work orders, and so the furniture will be very well made.

Jose dreams that God gives him life to keep working, his carpentry shop is well-known in the community, and that someday he will become associated with businesses so that he can provide them with the furniture that he builds.

loans.use: to purchase of a wood planing machine, which is being sold for a very good price.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 21-year-old, single young lady who works as a tutor to cover her needs and expenses, as she is responsible for one member of her family. She is a young, ambitious lady who is loved by her students for her professional skills and patience.

Fatima is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to achieve her dream by traveling and visiting holy places. This loan will help her refresh and get back to her students full of energy.

loans.use: to achieve her dream by traveling and visiting holy places.

loans.name: Samiha

texts.en:
Samiha is a 47-year-old married mother of three. She has been baking Saj bread and the famous traditional Manakish since 1997 to support her husband who works providing cleaning services with a limited monthly salary.
Samiha works hard to cover her family's increasing living needs, which is why she has to make sure that her business is well developed to cover these needs. For this reason, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a dough mixer machine which will make her work require less effort and be more productive.
This is Samiha's first loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. She is working hard so that in the future she can expand her business and start distributing her Saj bread to nearby restaurants and grocery stores.

loans.use: to buy a dough mixer machine which will make her work require less effort and be more productive.

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es: Julio vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la venta de lazos, hamacas y productos de plasticos su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y se dedica desde hace 10 años a la ventas y es gracias a su trabajo como ha podido salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para tener un buen inventario y asi continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en: Julio lives in his own house with his family. He sells ropes, hammocks, and plastic products. His business is located at the municipal market and he has worked here for the past 10 years. Thanks to this job he has been able to manage his household expenses, and he is asking for a loan to buy more products wholesale to have  good inventory and to continue with his sales.

loans.use: To buy ropes, hammocks and plastic products wholesale

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta de 38 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo y su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano para damas y caballeros su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 7 años y con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas fardos de ropa ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y asi podra tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Marta, 38 years old, is a single mother living in her own house with her son and her mother.  She sells second-hand women’s and men’s clothing for a living. Her business has been located in her place of residence for 7 years, and with the earnings she makes from her sales she manages to settle some home expenses.  She is requesting a loan to buy more bundles of clothing since Christmas season is coming and thus she will be able to have better income.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of clothing.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 48-year-old Lebanese married woman and mother of four children, two of whom are still studying. Her husband is the main income source in the family. He is a retired soldier in the Lebanese army. Today, she needs a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the school fees for her children. She is very happy that she will be able to ensure a good education for them, which makes her very happy and thankful for Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.name: Justina Antonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA DE CALCA, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia Justina  tiene 43 años de edad y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su negocio de agricultura, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que espera mediante su negocio obtener más ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, a la vez la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, la socia desea poder continuar trabajando parta de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar abono, semillas entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank SEÑOR DE HUANCA DE CALCA. The bank is located in the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.
The member Justina is 43 years old and married. She varies her daily activities by devoting herself to her farming business. She is grateful for the loan and promises to meet her quota payments. She is a fighting and entrepreneurial woman, who hopes to earn a higher income through her business so that she can continue supporting her family. She also breeds small animals. Justina wishes to continue dividing her working time, so that she can continue to support her family. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds, among other things.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds, among other things.

loans.name: Layali

texts.en:
Layali is a married, 30-year-old Lebanese woman living with her husband and two children. She is a housewife taking care of her children while her husband is covering their needs.

Her husband has worked as an employee in a restaurant since 2001. Due to the hard financial situation, she is in need to take a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy school stationery and pay the registration fees.

She said that she is very happy and eager to take additional loans to help her children continue their education suitably.

loans.use: to buy school stationery and pay the registration fees for her children.

loans.name: Marufe

texts.en:
For the past three years, Marufe has engaged in hog raising for a livelihood. She raises and sells pigs to the local settlers in her place. She is thirty-eight years old and a married woman with seven children. Four of them are still attending school. Her income goes for food and school expenses. Her husband is a fisherman.

She also engages in selling chorizo (spanish sausage).

She has requested a loan to buy piglets, feed and additional capital for chorizo vending. These could help enhance her source of income and slowly enable her to settle her obligation. In that way, she will experience improvement in her livelihood and continue to manage it efficiently.

Marufe is thankful for the funds and is determined to manage it successfully to support the education of her children for a brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and additional capital for chorizo (spanish sausage) vending.

loans.name: Bonefance

texts.en: Bonefance is a 55 year old married man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He has a business of retail selling general store items. He has been in this business for 11 yeas. He started on a small scale being inspired by his fellow business men in his village. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital that hinders expansion of his business and diversification. Besides that, he is working hard to make sure all his children are educated and his business grows to a wholesale shop. He has asked for a loan to help him buy stock of sugar, salt,cooking oil and blue band for selling.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, salt,cooking oil and blue band for sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith owns an eatery in Jagna, Bohol. She also operates a bakeshop which she started six years ago. From her earnings of PHP15000 per month, she is motivated to do more to improve her profits. She is asking a loan to buy lard, margarine, sugar, flour, cellophanes, vegetables, meat, fish, pots and chicken. Once these ingredients are available Judith can produce more which will help her produce more bread to sell and increase her income. Judith is 54 years old and her earnings will help her youngest child's education expense and their family daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy lard, margarine, sugar, flour, cellophanes, vegetables, meat, fish, pots and chicken

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 33 year old married man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He owns a retail shop plus selling waragi, which he has been doing for a period of four years and 10 years in retail trade. To start these businesses he had little capital, but has now acquired assets like land and a motorcycle.

He is charged with the duty of looking after his children, by providing all the basic needs at home. His business is not facing big challenges so far, and is looking at building a commercial house in future. John has asked for a loan to help him buy stock of sugar, cooking oil, soap, Omo, sodas, rice and waragi a local drink in his village for sale.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, cooking oil,  soap, Omo, sodas, rice and waragi, a local drink in his village, for sale.

loans.name: Great Heights Group

texts.en:
At the entrance of her gate a visitor is greeted by the aroma such that one is forgiven for suggesting that Matilda of Great Heights does not need an air freshener, as the air circulating around her house is always sweetened by her baking.

Matilda is a married mother of 2 children, who resides in Dzivaresekwa Extension in Harare the capital of Zimbabwe. She and her 3 group members named themselves Great Heights, because they have envisioned elevating themselves in business to bigger and better levels after being given a loan. There are currently on their 2nd loan and the positive changes in their businesses indicate that one day they will reach their target.

Clad in her white baking overalls and her head covered for hygiene purposes Matilda begins her typical day. Her main ingredients are flour, margarine or cooking oil, eggs, flavoring and sometimes fruits depending on the product being baked that particular day. In the process Matilda adds different forms of icing and other small decorating items like “hundreds and thousands”.
Matilda business has grown to the extent that she receives at least 2 orders of cakes from her clients daily. She usually supplies cake to clients in her neighborhood of Dzivaresekwa Extension and also to various pre-schools surrounding the area. She has created good customer loyalty because her cakes are delicious and well appreciated.

Currently Matilda applied for a loan of $600 with this amount she intends to restock various ingredients and various additives in order to meet various tastes of her clients. She is also planning to expand from the state she is and open a small baking shop in the area.

loans.use: to restock flour and various baking ingredients and additives in order to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Umoja Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Beatrice, a member of Umoja women. She is twenty six years old, married and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and has benefited from enterprise development training.

Beatrice does poultry, beans maize and farming in her small farm. She is taking a Kiva loan to enhance her poultry business by buying poultry feeds she says that this will help her get increase yields thus better income to enable her support basic family's needs such as education, medical care and clothing.

She is happy with Kiva and their lenders for their intervention; she promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds for more yields and income to support family's basic needs

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 26-year-old married father of two, who has been working in making necessary maintenance to tractors' hardware and spare parts for the past nine years. 
In 2008, he opened his own business in order to increase his income and develop his family's living.

His business is going on just fine, especially after his previously funded Kiva loan which was invested in buying a power generator necessary for his business' development, since electricity is highly requested in his domain and it is a major problem in his region.

Today, Bilal has two employees who work hard with him to provide the customers with the best and fastest services. 

He is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to  buy a  necessary machine for the tractors and trucks hoses' maintenance which will help in business development.

He hopes that in the future he can open another branch and expand his working zone.

loans.use: to buy a  necessary machine for his the tractors and trucks hoses' maintenance which will help his business development.

loans.name: Maydagul

texts.ru: Майдагул 58 летняя счастливая бабушка. Она имеет двоих детей. У нее одна дочка в возрасте 26 лет, и сын в возрасте 25 лет. Невестке 29 лет.  Майдагул  20 лет назад решила начать зарабатывать и помочь обеспечить семью. Майдагул решила создать свой бизнес, она начала продавать средства гигиены и разную косметику. Майдагул вот уже 20 лет своей жизни продвигает данную деятельность. Она знает все тонкости своей работы. Майдагул хочет расширить деятельность и привлечь больше клиентов. Она собирается увеличить ассортимент товара. Но для совершения данной операции ей не хватает средств. Майдагул надеется на получения кредита. Она хочет создать устойчивый бизнес добиться признания в этой сфере деятельности.
texts.en: Maydagul is a happy 58 year old grandmother. She has two children - a 26 year old daughter and 25 year old son. Her daughter in law is 29. Twenty years ago Maydagul decided to start working to help support her family. She began her own business selling hygiene supplies and makeup, and has continued for the past twenty years. She knows all the fine points of the work, and now wants to expand her business and attract more customers. She plans to expand her inventory of goods, but doesn't have the necessary capital. Maydagul is hoping to receive a loan. She wants to have a sustainable business and gain recognition in this sphere.

loans.use: to expand her inventory and her business

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 42-year-old married mother of three. She has been baking Saj bread and the famous traditional Manakish since 2013 to support her husband who works transporting students.

Sanaa works hard to cover her family's increasing living needs, which is why she has to make sure that her business is well developed to cover these needs.

For this reason, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a dough mixer machine which will make her work require less effort and be more productive.
This is Sanaa's first loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. She works hard so that in the future she can expand her business and start distributing her Saj bread to nearby restaurants and grocery stores.

loans.use: to  buy a dough mixer machine which will make her work require less effort and be more productive.

loans.name: Dúo San Antonio La Comunidad Group

texts.es: Dúo San Antonio la Comunidad Francisca de 53 años de edad es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de tamales, paches, chuchitos y comidas para eventos especiales. Hace mas de 15 años se dedica a este negocio, el cual le a ayudado a salir adelante y le a sido de mucha bendicion para su famillia. El sueño de francisca es tener un negocio mas grande y asi atender mejor a sus clientes, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la elaboración de tamales para la venta.
texts.en: The San Antonio la Comunidad Pair: Francisca, 53 years old, is a merchant and works selling tamales, pahces, chuchitos [traditional foods] and food for special events. More than 15 years ago, she dedicated herself to this business, which has helped her to get ahead and has been much blessing for her family. Francisca's dream is to have a larger business and therefore tend to her customers better. She is applying for this loan for the purchase of edible products for making tamales for selling.

loans.use: to buy edible products for making tamales for selling.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa con 36 años de edad, de estado civil viuda, vive junto a sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos como arroz,azúcar,fideos,aceite,entre otros, su negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 01 año. Solicita préstamo para implementar su negocio, para la compra de más insumos. De esta manera incrementar sus ventas y obtener mayores ganancias.

Nicolasa es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado tres créditos anteriormente los cuáles los canceló de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is 36 years old and a widow. She lives with her two children in Pucará district in the Jaén province. Jaén is in the department of Cajamarca in Peru. The locals here mainly work in farming, cattle-breeding and trade.

Nicolasa receives good personal and professional references. She makes a living selling products such as rice, sugar, pastas, oil and more. Her business is located in her home. She has more than a year's experience with the business. Nicolasa is applying for a loan to invest in her business; she will use it to buy more supplies, and thus increase her income and earn higher profits.

Nicolasa is a repeat borrower at Edpyme Alternativa. She has had three loans, all of which she repaid on time.

loans.use: to invest in her business; she will use it to buy more supplies.

loans.name: Bizumrat

texts.en:
Bizumrat is a married parent of two children. She was born in 1985. Bizumrat lives with her family in the northern part of Tajikistan. She works in a kindergarten as a nurse. Bizumrat has worked in the kindergarten more than a year. Bizumrat likes children, and she does her job with pleasure.

Bizumrat now needs financial support because her teeth are making her ill. Bizumrat is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to treat her teeth. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to treat her teeth.

loans.name: Monica Liseth

texts.es:
Mónica Liseth con 23 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia,junto a su a cónyuge y sus tres menores hijos, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la actividad de la crianza y venta de animales menores,estos animales son criados en el corral de su domicilio el cuál esta acondicionado para esta actividad, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 01 año. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de animales con lo cuál la ayudará a incrementar sus ventas. Las perspectivas del mercado son buenas ya que Cayalti está creciendo de manera rápida y hay demanda de los pobladores.

Mónica Liseth es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, con un crédito anterior el cuál fue cancelado de manera oportuna.
texts.en:
Mónica Liseth is 23 years old. She is a common law wife who lives in her own house with her partner and their three small children in the district of Zana, Chiclayo province, department of Lambayeque, in Peru. She has very good personal and business references from the people in the zone. The population primarily works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

She works raising and selling small animals,. These are farmyard animals raised in her house which has been adapted for this activity, with one year of experience. The present loan will be used to buy farmyard animals which will increase her sales. The market perspectives are good since Cayalti is growing and there is a large demand from the population.

Monica Liseth is a recurring member for Edypme Alternativa, with a previous loan which was paid on time.

loans.use: To buy farmyard  animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 54 years old, widow with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Melinda has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. Melinda requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her tricycle passenger.

Melinda has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Melinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her tricycle passenger.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 34 years old and married with three children. Her three children are still in school, Mary Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, noodles, snack foods, bread, eggs and other personal care products.

Mary Grace has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Mary Grace would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, noodles, snack foods, bread, eggs and other personal care products

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 31 years old and has three children. Mary Jean is married and has three children who are in school.

Mary Jean is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Jean requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Mary Jean has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Jean would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is a married woman, 23 years old with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

May has a food fending business in the Philippines. May requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as, fish, pork, meat, spices, vegetables and other ingredients for her food vending business.

May has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as, fish, pork, meat, spices, vegetables and other ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 55 years old and widowed with nine children. With three children still in school, Juliana works very hard to provide for them.

Juliana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items, like canned goods, cereals, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

Juliana has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cereals, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, soft drinks, etc.

Juliana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items, like canned goods, cereals, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen of age 63 is married with 3 children with one child attending school in Hoima Uganda. He deals in produce primarily buying and selling of maize, beans alongside farming and cattle fattening. He started his business in order to raise incomes to support his family.

He plans to develop and expand his business the more, by buying a motorcycle to enable him to move to market places with ease, as well as educating his children. However, inadequate capital and price fluctuation hinder his desires. He is planning for the festive season to sell many cows but at he moment he does not have the money to buy the animals. He will be seeking for credit to buy more cows to sell this festive season.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Masitura

texts.en: The purpose of Masitura’s loan is to buy cocoa to sell. She is an enterprising woman and is married with a stable family. She is a cocoa trader, which is the major economic activity in Bundibugyo district. She has been in business for the last twenty years, having started from a small cocoa plantation, and now boasts of having expanded her plantation. She has a family dream of sending her children to university and also becoming a lead cocoa supplier in her area. In spite of this, she faces setbacks from seasonality changes and seasonal incomes.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en:
Ofelya, an accountant by profession, has been involved in cosmetics sales in Artik town. She organizes sales from her house, and sells the rest of the products in nearby villages.

Ofelya lives with her husband and three children ranging from the age of 11 through 26.

Ofelya has applied for this loan to purchase new stock of cosmetics for resale. She will be able to complete her current orders, as the demand for cosmetic products is increasing because of the coming holidays.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: José Matilde

texts.es:
José de 72 años de edad estudió hasta 9 grado, está casado, en esta relación han procreado  un hijo que es ya mayor de edad y tiene su propio hogar.  Actualmente José vive con su esposa que se dedica a los oficios domésticos. 


José tiene 21 años de trabajar como panificador, inició trabajando como ayudante, al aprender bien el oficio y ver que daba buenos ingresos  decidió poner un negocio propio. Hoy en día, se levanta a diario a las 5:00 am a elaborar el pan que luego sale a vender en su vehículo, una vez lo vende todo regresa a su casa, por lo general cerca de las 10:00 am. 


El préstamo solicitado en Credicampo  será utilizado para comprar azúcar, bandejas, harina, huevos, levadura, etc. debido a que la panadería está creciendo.


 José se proyecta tener una panadería muy reconocida en la ciudad, que todos busquen y disfruten de su pan , y trabajar también por encargos, para tener ingresos económicos seguros y disfrutar su vejez al lado de su esposa.
texts.en:
Jose is 72 years old, and has a ninth grade education. He is married, and has a son who is already an adult, living in his own home. Currently, Jose lives with his wife, who takes care of the household chores.

Jose has worked as a baker for 21 years. He began as an assistant, and once he learned the trade well, and saw that it provided good income, he decided to establish his own business. Today, he arises at 5:00 a.m. to make bread, which he later sells from his vehicle. One he sells everything, he returns home, generally around 10:00 a.m.

He will use the loan he is requesting from Credicampo to purchase sugar, trays, wheat, eggs, yeast, and other items as the bakery is growing.

Jose plans to have a bakery that is well-known in the city where everyone seeks and enjoys his bread. He also wishes to work on an on-order basis so that he will have secure income, and be able to enjoy his old age along with his wife.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, trays, wheat, eggs, yeast, and other items as the bakery is growing.

loans.name: Minu And Group

texts.en:
Minu is an ambitious entrepreneur from the Kamrup district of Assam. She lives there with her husband and school-going child. She runs a clothing business to contribute to the household income. The income she earns from the current scale of her business is insufficient to meet the rising cost of living. She thus wants to expand her business to sell pillow covers, bed sheets, sarees, etc. She expects her monthly income to go up by Rs. 1,000. This will help her meet her household expenses better. 

Minu leads a group of five women who have come together to apply for a loan. All group members – Minu, Pranita, Shahin, Krishna and Rina are involved in income generating activities and seek a loan to invest in their respective businesses.

loans.use: to expand her clothing business to sell pillow covers, bed sheets, etc.

loans.name: Zain

texts.en:
Zain is a 19-years-old single young lady from Nablus city. His mother works in a public sector where she gets a low and unstable income. Thus income is barely covers all the family needs.

Zain is a student in the university where she studies Elementary Education. She wants to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to support her family.

Zain took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university fees for this semester. By taking this loan, Zain will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for this semester, for a degree in Elementary Education

loans.name: Dúo Inspiración Group

texts.es: Dúo Inspiración, representado por doña Mirna casada y tiene un hijo, su esposo es piloto de un camión que transporta verduras, doña Mirna se dedica a la venta de ropa típica desde hace mas de cinco años, en el mercado municipal Santiago Sac, vende cortes típicos, fajas, blusas, güipiles. Y otras cosas, en ocasiones venden frente a su venta otras cosas de épocas, este es su cuarto crédito con su misma compañera, ella quiere o desea que su hijo estudie, quiere apoyar a su esposo con los gastos y mejorar su hogar, esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de ropa tipica para la venta.
texts.en:
The "Inspiración" Duo

One member of this duo is Mirna. She is married and has one son. Her husband drives a lorry used to transport vegetables.

Mirna has been working selling traditional clothing at the Santiago Sac municipal market for five years. She sells traditional items, such as blouses, skirts and sashes among other items. Sometimes she also sells seasonal products.

This is Mirna's fourth loan with the same fellow borrower. Mirna wants her son to study, and she wants to support her husband with household costs and make improvements to her home. Mirna is applying for this loan in order to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: Ana es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de productos básicos, entre alimentos y productos de limpieza e higiene persona, actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años en su vivienda. Ella tiene 55 años de edad y vive con su esposo en casa de su propiedad desde hace 25 años, la cual lograron comprar con mucho esfuerzo. Ana desea mejorar el techo de su vivienda, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina, madera, polines y pines para mejorar el techo y brindar protección a su vivienda.
texts.en: Ana is a hard working woman who is engaged in selling basic products including food, and cleaning and personal hygiene products.  She has been operating this business in her home for eight years.  She is 55 years old, and she and her husband have been living in their own home, which they managed to buy through much effort, for 25 years.  Ana wishes to make improvements to her home’s roof, and for this reason, she is requesting a loan from Fusai to purchase laminated sheets, wood, posts, and pins to repair the roof and provide her home with protection.

loans.use: to purchase laminated sheets, wood, posts, and pins to repair the roof and provide her home with protection.

loans.name: Antonio Alexander

texts.es:
Antonio solicita un nuevo crédito en Padecomsm por el apoyo que recibe de manera rápida y porque la deuda la puede pagar en cuotas considerables, él comprara primordialmente abono, maíz y herbicidas, para desarrollar sus actividades agrícolas y sacar una buena cosecha, así podrá continuar trabajando y teniendo un buen desarrollo económico.
Con el financiamiento anterior su negocio ha mejorado y sus utilidades han incrementado un poco, lo cual le permite mantener su buen record crediticio y atender las necesidades que surgen en su hogar.
texts.en: Antonio is asking for a new loan from Padecomsm because of th support he receives in a quick manner, and because the loan can be paid in manageable installments. He will buy primarily manure, corn and herbicides to develop his agricultural activities and have a good harvest, thus to continue working and having a good economic outcome.  With the last loan his business improved and his profits have increased a bit, which allows him to have a good credit recor and to handle his household needs.

loans.use: To buy manure, corn and herbicides, to develop his agricultural activities and have a good harvest.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is engaged in selling of variety vegetables for 13 years. She also run her hog raising and corn farming business. Cecilia would like to have continuous growth of her fruits and vegetable vending business that’s the reason why she’s asking for a loan of PHP50,000 .She will use this amount of loan in buying variety vegetables such as cabbage, carrots, tomatoes and seasoning. She hopes that she could keep her business profitable.

loans.use: to be use in buying variety vegetables such as cabbage, carrots, tomatoes and seasoning to sell.

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.ru:
Курбон жизнерадостный мужчина 64 лет. Он женат и имеет семерых детей, с которыми живет в одном большом дворе. Курбон живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Курбон очень трудолюбивый и серьезный человек, он знает свои возможности и реально смотрит на жизнь. 
Сыновья Курбона  помогают во всем ему. Некоторые из них в данный момент находятся в России на заработках. Они ежемесячно присылают Курбону денежные переводы. Недавно Курбонали  всей семьей начали дополнительную постройку к дому. Но из-за недостатка собственных средств, стройку остановили. 
В данный момент Курбон хочет возобновить стройку в своем доме, для этого ему нужны денежные средства. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд за помощью.
Он заранее благодарить Арванд за предоставленную помощь и надеется положительный результат.
texts.en:
Kurbon is a cheerful 64 year old man. He is married and has seven children who live in one large complex. Kurbon and his family live in a rural area. He is a hard working and responsible person who knows his abilities and has a realistic outlook on life. His sons help him with everything. A few of them are currently working abroad in Russia, and send him money transfers each month.

Recently the family began building an addition to the house, but it has stalled because of a lack of money. Kurbon needs additional cash to restart the work so he came to Arvand for assistance. He thanks Arvand in advance for the help and hopes for a positive result.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Abdugafur

texts.ru:
Абдугафур жизнерадостный мужчина 41 года. Он женат и имеет пятерых детей. Абдугафур живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он очень позитивный молодой человек. Абдугафур старается во всем видеть хорошую сторону. 
Абдугафур любит, разводить, и ухаживать за крупнорогатым скотом. Он покупает на базаре скот, потом откармливает его и перепродает. Жена Абдугафура всегда помогает ему в этом. Полученное молоко они продают своим соседям. Соседи с удовольствием покупают у семьи Абдугафура молоко, сливочное масло и т.д., потому что продаваемое ими продукты всегда свежие и вкусные.  Вот уже 13 лет Абдугафур занимается этим делом, от этого дела он получает хороший стабильный доход.
В данный момент Абдугафур хочет приобрести корм для скота на зиму, для этого ему нужны денежные средства.
Он заранее благодарить «Арванд» за предоставленную помощь и надеется положительный результат.
texts.en:
Abdugafur is a cheerful 41 year old man. He is married and has five children. He lives with his family in a rural area. He is a very optimistic man, and tries to see the positive side of everything.

Abdugafur loves to raise and care for cattle. He buys them at the market, fattens them and resells. His wife always helps with the work. They sell the milk received to their neighbors. The neighbors are happy to buy milk, butter, and other products from them, as their products are always fresh and delicious. Abdugafur has been in this business for 13 years already, and it earns him a good stable income.

Currently Abdugafur wants to buy winter feed for his animals, and he needs extra cash to do so. He thanks Arvand in advance for the assistance and hopes for a positive outcome.

loans.use: purchase of livestock feed.

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es:
María de 64 años de edad, es una señora emprendedora, estudio solo el primer grado en la escuela pues sus posibilidades económicas eran difíciles,  quedó viuda hace tres años pero vivió buenos recuerdos con su esposo, con él procreó cuatro hijos de los cuales uno vive con ella y los otros tres ya formaron sus propias familias.

María vende frutas y verduras en la comunidad, labor que realiza desde hace 10 años, decidió dedicarse a esto porque necesitaba tener una fuente de ingresos para los gastos familiares y más ahora que tiene que cuidar sola de uno de los hijos menores,  las ventas las realiza de casa en casa en la comunidad pero es algo que realiza con muchas ganas pues sus deseos de superación son inmensos.

Los fondos serán invertidos para comprar más frutas y verduras y seguir adelante con su negocio, pues necesita que sea rentable para obtener buenos ingresos económicos. 

María sueña con seguir trabajando y tener salud para continuar y darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en: María is 64 years old. She is an entrepreneurial woman, she studied through first grade in school since her economic possibilities were very difficult. She became a widow three years ago, and she has very good memories of her husband. They had 4 children,  of which one of them lives with her.  The other three have their own families. Maria sells fruits and vegetables in the community, which she has been doing for the past 10 years.  She decided to work in this field to have a source of income and more now that she has to take care of one of the younger children. She sells from house to house in the community, but it is something that she enjoys doing because of her desire to improve are immense. The funds will be invested to buy more fruits and vegetables and to continue with her business, as she needs this to be profitable to have good income. Maria dreams to continue working and to have good health and give the best to her son.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables and continue her business.

loans.name: José Eliseo

texts.es:
José de 28 años de edad, estudió hasta el noveno grado, por dedicarse al trabajo dejó la escuela, está acompañado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios de la casa y cuidar de los tres hijos que tienen y los cuales aún no tienen edad para asistir a la escuela, por lo tanto de José solo dependen sus hijos y la esposa.

José se dedica al enderezado y pintura en automóviles desde hace cinco años, por lo tanto tiene una gran experiencia la cual le ha ayudado a mejorar las capacidades y quiere montar su propio taller, ya que en este momento trabaja en otro lugar y quiere independizarse.
   

Con los fondos otorgados en este crédito, José comprará lijas, pinturas y  otros materiales con los cuales empezará a realizar sus propios trabajos y empezar a ganar clientes, ya que algunos de los clientes que atiende por el momento ya lo conocen, y confían en su capacidad.

El sueño de José en tener un taller propio y mejorarlo con el mejor equipo de lijado y pintura para atender cualquier trabajo que se le presente.
texts.en:
José is 28 years old. He studied until ninth grade, and to begin working he left school. He is married, and his wife works to maintain the house and care for their three children who are not yet old enough to attend school. Therefore Jose’s children and wife depend on him alone.

José has worked in auto body repair and painting for five years, so he has great experience which has helped him improve his abilities. He wants to set up his own repair shop, since in this moment he works in another place and he wants to be independent.

With the funds granted in this loan, José will buy sandpaper, paint, and other materials with which he will start to carry out his own projects and begin to gain customers, since some of the customers he looks after already know him and trust in his abilities.

Jose’s dream is to have his own repair shop and improve it with the best sanding and painting equipment to attend to any and all customers.

loans.use: To buy sand paper, paint, and other materials with which he will start to carry out his own projects.

loans.name: Ivanna

texts.en:
Ivanna has been selling clothes and shoes for 16 years. Every morning, Ivanna arranges the goods on a table for sale in a crowded place. She is a peaceful and hardworking person. Ivanna hopes that her business will endure during difficult times in Ukraine.

Ivanna is asking for a loan of 20,000 UAH to purchase clothes and shoes for the winter season. The loan will help her to increase the assortment of goods and serve more clients.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and clothes for the winter season.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.ru: Муродчон ответственный, коммуникабельный, пунктуальный мужчина из городка Курган-Тюбе. Ему 43 года. Он отец четверых детей и верный муж. Муродчон занимается изготовлением и продажей холодца. В торговом бизнесе он уже 19 лет. Дети Муродчона растут, и на их образования уходит больше денег. Муродчон хочет расширить бизнес и открывает еще одну торговую точку. На покупку точки и производства холодца на 2 раза больше, нужны средства и он надеется решить свою проблему с помощью кредита.
texts.en: Murodjon is a responsible, communicative, punctual man from Kurgan-Tube. He is 43 years old, is a faithful husband and has four children. Murodjon produces and sells jellied meat. He has been in the sales business for 19 years already. His children are growing and a lot of money is spent on their education. He wants to buy a kiosk and double production, but he needs additional capital. He hopes to solves this issue with the help of a loan.

loans.use: to obtain a kiosk and produce jellied-meat

loans.name: Saluwa

texts.en:
Saluwa is 16 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Saluwa has been working hard to manage her charcoal stall, which manages a charcoal business. 

To help expand her business, Saluwa has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.
