The loan will be used to increase on her stock and buy more sacks of charcoal to sale them during the festive season, and will help Saluwa to generate greater profits and increasing on the quality of her charcoal supplies. Saluwa hopes that in the future she will be able to add another types of items like raw foods to increase on her sales. 

Saluwa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to increase on her stock and buy more sacks of charcoal to sell them during the festive season.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Carmen

texts.es: Esperanza de 42 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero y de engorde desde hace 10 años, la clienta quiere mejorar su vivienda encementando el piso pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso esta solicitando nuevamente un credito pero en esta ocasion para la compra de los materiales de contruccion necesarios para tener una vivienda mas comoda y limpia.
texts.en: Esperanza is 42 years old and is a single mother who lives in her own home with her four children. She has worked raising dairy cows and cows for fattening for ten years. The client wants to improve her home by cementing the floor but she does not have sufficient capital. This is why she is again requesting a loan but, this time, for the purchase of necessary construction materials in order to have a home that is more clean and comfortable.

loans.use: to buy necessary construction materials.

loans.name: Nolberto Israel

texts.es: Nolberto tiene 57 años de edad y vive con su compañera de vida y su grupo familiar desde hace 11 años en vivienda de su propiedad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se dedica a prestar sus servicios de albañil independiente, además se gana la vida como motorista, buscando siempre obtener la mayor cantidad de ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. Nolberto es un hombre muy trabajador, que siempre busca lo mejor para su hogar, por lo que desea colocar techo al área de baño y lavadero, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina, madera, clavos y alambre para colocar el techo al área de baño y lavadero de su vivienda.
texts.en: Nolberto is 57 years old, and has lived in his own home with his life companion and family for eleven years.  He is a hardworking man who provides his services as an independent construction worker.  He also earns a living as a driver, always seeking to obtain the greatest income to get his family ahead.  Nolberto is a very hard worker, always seeking the best for his home.  For this reason, he wishes to attach a roof to the bathroom and laundry area.  He is seeking a loan from Fusai to purchase laminated sheets, wood, nails, and wire to attach a roof to the bathroom and laundry area of his home.

loans.use: to purchase laminated sheets, wood, nails, and wire to attach a roof to the bathroom and laundry area of his home.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal is a 34-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and three school-aged children. Her husband is the main income provider; he has operated a mini-market for 15 years. He is a very hard worker and does not tire of work, with the aim to develop it and benefit from it. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the educational fees for her children. She will be able to help them to pursue a good education, which makes her very happy.

loans.use: to pay the educational fees for her children.

loans.name: Fahime

texts.en:
Fahime is a 44-year-old married woman living with her husband and six children. Three of her children are still attending school. Her husband represents the main source of income for the family. He works as a taxi driver. Due to their bad circumstances, she works at home and prepares dairy products to collect enough money to be able to pay their heavy living expenses.

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children's educational fees. This is her first loan, but she said that she will be a permanent client and eager to borrow additional loans in the future.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees.

loans.name: Marta Beatriz

texts.es:
Marta de 52 años de edad, estudió hasta el tercer grado de educación básica por motivos de recursos limitados no pudo continuar con los estudios, está casada y el esposo se dedica a la agricultura, juntos tienen un hijo el cual trabaja, en casa solo vive la familia de Marta.


Marta se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y a los oficios del hogar, este trabajo lo realiza desde hace más de veinte años, el trabajo lo realiza ya que en el campo es el único trabajo rentable que se puede realizar, en la crianza de cerdos le ayuda el esposo quien es el encargado de recolectar alimentos para los animales.


El presente crédito lo necesita para comprar cerdos de engorde para sacarlos a la venta en la época de verano que es cuando el valor económico de estos animales sube en el mercado nacional.

El sueño de Marta es tener recursos para apoyar a su hijo a continuar con sus estudios y sacar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Marta, 52 years old, studied until third grade of primary school. Because of limited resources, she couldn't continue with the studies. She is married and the husband works in agriculture. Together they have a son who works. Only Marta's family lives in the house. Marta works at raising pigs and at the tasks of the home. She has done this work for more than twenty years. She does this work since in the country this is the only profitable work that one can do. Her husband, who is in charge of collecting feed for the animals, helps her with the pig raising.

She needs the current loan to buy pigs for fattening to take them for sale in the summer season which is when the economic value of these animals increases on the national market.

Marta's dream is to have resources to support her son to continue with his studies and get a university degree.

loans.use: to buy pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina is a 52-year-old married mother of four. Five years ago, she started selling home products to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is well-known among her region and has her loyal customers. She is working hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase and diversify her merchandise with new items to satisfy her customers' demands.
Zeina hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase and diversify her merchandise with new items to satisfy her customers' demands

loans.name: Rafael Eduardo

texts.es: Don Rafael de 60 años de edad vive solo en casa propia, el se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de pescado y mariscos de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentan cerca de su casa y es gracias a ese trabajo como puede salir adelante, el cliente esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Rafael, 60 years old, lives alone in his own house. For the past 10 years, he has worked selling fish and shellfish on foot in the different neighborhoods that are found near is house. It's thanks to this work that he could get ahead.

The client is applying for a loan for the purchase of more products in bulk to be able to continue with his sales and therefore be able to have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy fish and shellfish in bulk.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es una mujer de 30 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 1, 5, 6 y 7 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa para niña.
Ella es buena madre, luchadora y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por acoger a la mayor parte de la población, por la manufactura en todas las áreas y por el comercio informal, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo. 
Lidia es de tez morena, cabello negro y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla dentro de su entorno familiar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua potable energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa para niñas como, calzas, poleras, faldas, shorts y otros, actividad que realiza junto a sus hijos menores y de forma ambulante en zonas y áreas comerciales, “estoy consolidando mi negocio, la ropa que vendo es sencilla de confeccionar y las ventas son buenas, es por eso que deseo abrir un taller de costura para vender mis propias confecciones…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque la ropa que vende es de bajo precio. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son continuas, la desventaja es la falta de una máquina de coser para confeccionar ropa. Su sueño es independizarse como productora de ropa para darle bienestar a su familia, ella desea comprar una máquina de coser para confeccionar ropa de niña. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lidia solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina de coser industrial para confeccionar ropa de niña.
texts.en:
Lidia is 30 years old and lives with her partner. She has 4 children, ages one, five, six, and seven. Her business is the sale of girls' clothing. Lidia is a good mother--she is a fighter and a hard worker. Her business is done in the southern zone of the city, where the majority of the population lives, and where there is a hot and humid tropical climate. This zone has manufacturing in all areas and informal commerce.

Lidia has a brown complexion, black hair, and a thin frame. Her first language is Guaraní, which she speaks within her family, and she speaks Spanish in the general culture and in doing business. She shares her life with her partner, who works in construction, and with her children, who are in school. They live in a rented room built from brick with a tin roof and dirt floor, and they have drinking water, electricity, and a sewage system.

Her business is the sale of clothing for girls, such as leggings, shirts, skirts, shorts, and other items. She takes her younger children with her while she is working, and she is a traveling merchant in commercial areas. She says, "I am strengthening my business. The clothing that I sell is simple to make and the sales are good, which is why I want to open a sewing shop to sell my own clothing."

Her business is successful because the clothing she sells is low-priced. The advantage of her business is that the sales are continuous, and the disadvantage is the lack of a sewing machine to make clothing. Her dream is to be an independent producer to provide for her family's well-being. She wants to purchase a sewing machine to make girls' clothing. This is the first loan with the institution in the 4 years that she has been involved in this business. 

It is for these reasons that Lidia is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine to make girls' clothing.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine to make children's clothing.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan con 41 años de edad, de estado civil casado,vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su esposa y su hijo de 12 años de edad,distrito de Aramango,provincia de Bagua,departamento de Amazonas,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente al cultivo de piña,con una experiencia en el rubro de más de 05 años. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en el mantenimiento del cultivo de piña. Esta inversión le permitirá obtener ganancias para mejorar su condición económica y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida.

Juan es socio reactivado para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Juan, 41, is married and lives in his own home made of rustic material with his wife and 12-year-old son in the district of Aramango, province of Bagua, administrative division of Amazonas, and country of Peru. He has many good references, both personal and professional, from the residents of the area. The majority of the residents of this town work in agriculture, trade and ranching.

He works in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of pineapple, with more than five years of experience in this line of work. He will use the loan to invest in the maintenance of his pineapple crops. This investment will allow him to make a profit to improve his economic condition and to invest in better living conditions. 

Juan is a reactivated member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of pineapple crops.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.en:
Nigina was born in 1995. She is a smart and hardworking woman.

Nigina is single and she lives with her parents. She is a student, studying in her third course. Nigina studies well and she is one of the best students. Nigina’s parents are farmers and they do not have the opportunity to pay for her university tuition. So, Nigina is asking for a loan to pay for her university tuition.
She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for University tuition.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad was able to buy additional supplies and merchandise, which she already has distributed to her clients. She is able to provide them with new products that made her attract additional patrons. She wants to extend her sincerest appreciation to lenders and Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for the financial assistance they’ve provided.

The business does not earn good profit all the time, since there are also competitors in the same area, which she considers a challenge in the business, and late payments of customers as well. Soledad also aims to buy more items, since complete products will also produce good revenue. That’s why she applied for a loan amount of PHP 50,000. This loan assistance will buy additional products such as clothing items, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. She is faithful in paying all that is due on time, for she values the lenders' trust in her.

Soledad is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group, which consists of 15 to 30 members, for CCT partners. The fellowship group is where she gains spiritual strength from members' life-changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans, and hear God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics, needed in her business.

loans.name: Arpenik

texts.en:
Arpenik is 27 years old and she lives with her with her husband and three children in Tsovagyugh village of the Gegharkunik region. Her daughters are already school-aged and her son is only a year old.

Arpenik is a farmer and, with her husband, she takes care of her not so small farm. She has cows, calves, heifers, bulls, a pig and chickens. Potato cultivation is also rather profitable for her family since this vegetable is very popular in this region and re-sellers buy right from the local farms. Arpenik also sells her farm’s milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, meat and eggs. She sells all these goods from her farm since the care of their children and house does not leave her any time to reach the city’s wholesale market for her to sell her farm produce.

Arpenik asks for this loan of 690,000 AMD as she decided increase her meat sales by purchasing two more calves. It will be very profitable for her farm. Also she wants to buy fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her farm cattle and increase her meat sales by purchasing two more calves. It will be very profitable for her farm.

loans.name: Rosie Ann

texts.en:
Rosie Ann is 35 years old and married with six children. With four children in school, Rosie Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Rosie Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care, and other groceries.

Rosie Ann has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Rosie Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine lives in Hoima ,Uganda. He is aged 45 married with 6 children and all attend school. He deals in produce mostly buying and selling of maize, beans and rice. He also ventured into a lucrative business of motor cycle riding while transporting people in order to supplement his incomes as well as farming.

He intends to grow and develop his business as well as paying school fees for his children. He will use the loan facility to buy more maize for sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize for selling

loans.name: Maria Sara

texts.es:
María se siente muy satisfecha por haber utilizado el crédito anterior en su negocio, pues hoy en día su negocio continúa con vida y ha logrado tener los ingresos que necesita para cancelar sus deudas y otros compromisos familiares.
Con la finalidad de seguir teniendo clientes satisfechos y un nivel de ventas estable requiere de un nuevo crédito para poder surtir su inventario con la compra de cebollas, chiles, tomates, frijoles, arroz, aceite, café, etc., con estos materiales preparara la venta de meriendas, sus proyectos son seguir trabajando para tener un mejor bienestar junto a su familia.
texts.en:
María feels very satisfied by having utilized the previous loan in her business. Well, today in her business she continues with life and has achieves having the income she needs to pay off her debts and other family commitments.

With the goal of continuing to have satisfied clients and a stable level of sales, she requires a new loan to be able to stock her inventory with the purchase of onions, chiles, tomatoes, beans, rice, oil, coffee, etc. With these materials, she will prepare the sale of snacks. Her projects are to continue working to have a better wellbeing with her family.

loans.use: to buy onions, chiles, tomatoes, beans, rice, oil, coffee, etc. With these materials, she will prepare the sale of snacks.

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
Santos, de 58 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado y vive junto a su esposa, ambos procrearon tres hijos los cuales ya son independientes y formaron sus propias familias, mientras su esposa trabaja junto a él.

Santos, junto a su esposa tienen una panadería desde hace más de cinco años, antes de emprender el negocio por cuenta propia, Santos trabajaba de panadero y ahí fue donde aprendió a elaborar pan y gano mucha experiencia, que ahora la pone en práctica en su propia panadería, en donde participa la mayoría de su familia y de ahí depende sus ingresos familiares.

Santos, necesita el préstamo para comprar harina, manteca, levadura, azúcar y para comprar una bicicleta para emplear a una persona para que salga a vender el pan a las comunidades; porque se acercan las fechas donde aumentan las ventas y quiere estar preparado para ello.

Santos, sueña con tener una panadería más grande y que su negocio sea una fuente de empleo para más personas.
texts.en:
Santos is 58 years old and is a hardworking man. He has a sixth grade education, is married, and lives with his wife. Together they have three children who are now independent and have started their own families. His wife works with him.

Santos and his wife have had a bakery for over five years. Before starting his own business, Santos worked as a baker and learned how to make bread and gained a lot of experience which he now puts into practice with his own bakery. The majority of his family works in his bakery which they depend on for their family income.

Santos needs a loan to buy flour, butter, yeast and sugar and to buy a bicycle in order to employ someone to go out and sell bread in the community because he is approaching the busy season where bread sales increase and he wants to be prepared for this.

Santos dreams of having a bigger bakery and that his business can provide employment to more people.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, yeast, and sugar and to buy a bicycle so as to employ someone to go and sell bread in the community.

loans.name: Shamira

texts.en:
Shamira is 16 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Shamira has been working hard to manage her vegetable stall, which sales raw vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Shamira has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase for more vegetable like tomatoes,onions and cabbage so as to have enough sales, and will help Shamira to generate greater profits and to pay for her operational rent. Shamira hopes that in the future she will be able to have a business of her own and stop sharing the current business with her mother. 

Shamira is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase for more vegetable like tomatoes, onions and cabbage to have enough for sales,.

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 60-year-old married mother of five children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Eleven years ago, she opened a grocery shop to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their children.

Souad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business through increasing her merchandise with new items and products to satisfy her customers' demands.

She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new items and products to satisfy her customers' demands.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: Don Ramon de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hija, el posee un servicio de transporte desde hace mas de 12 años, y es asi como puede solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo y las ventanas pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito a INTEGRAL para la compra de las laminas, polines, ventanas y pago de mano de obra para tener una vivenda mas segura.
texts.en: Ramon, 51, lives in his own home with his life partner and daughter. He has owned a transportation service for more than 12 years, and in this way he can cover some of his housing expenses. He wants to improve his residence by changing the roof and windows, but as he doesn't have the sufficient funds, he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to purchase sheet metal, beams and windows and to pay for labor to have a more secure home.

loans.use: to purchase sheet metal, beams and windows and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 19-years-old married young lady from Jenin city. His husband works in a public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers their needs.

Wafaa is a student in the university, where she studies Law. She wants to take her BA degree and find a job in the future to help support her husband.

Wafaa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university fees for this semester. By taking this loan, Wafaa will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

loans.use: to pay her university fees for this semester, leading to a degree in Law

loans.name: Dúo Nueva Peronia 2 Group

texts.es: Dúo Nueva Peronia 2 Margarita de 55 años de edad es comerciante y se dedica a la confección de vestidos de novia, vestidos de primera comunión y vestidos de quinceañeras y otras prendas como uniformes para estudiantes y todo lo que los clientes le requieran. Margarita solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de telas y otros materiales que le son necesarios para la realización de sus prendas. Margarita sueña con tener un negocio mas grande y tener mas clientes para asi poder expandir su negocio.desde ya les agradese por su ayuda brindada con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
"Duo Nueva Peronia 2"
Margarita is 55 years old and is a business woman. She works making wedding dresses, First Communion dresses, quinceañera dresses, and other articles of clothing including school uniforms and anything that her clients need.

Margarita is asking for a new loan to buy fabrics and other materials that are necessary for the production of clothing items. Margarita dreams of having a bigger business and to have more clients in order to expand her business. For now, she thanks you for your support in providing her with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to make clothing.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Judith is 29 years old and has one child currently in school.

Judith has a food vending business in the Philippines. Judith requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, sugar, flour, etc..

Judith has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Judith would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda, from Ijevan city of Tavush region, starts her first Kiva loan and hopes to be supported. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren.

Seda has higher education and a specialty of accountant. For many years until today, she has worked as an accountant at different companies. Seda mentions that all her family members are employed, and they do their best to provide the children with the best living conditions.

Seda’s daughter-in-law has health problems, which must be solved as soon as possible; this is the direction of the doctor. Now Seda asks for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams to pay for the solution of the health problem of her daughter-in-law as quickly as possible.

loans.use: to pay for the solution of the health problem of her daughter-in-law as quickly as possible.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
This woman’s name is Karine and with her husband and two daughters she lives in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. Karine’s daughters are already students; the elder is a future psychologist and the smallest daughter is a future economist. Karine’s husband works at a private company.

Karine has a higher pedagogical education. For several years she worked at a school as an elementary class teacher. Now she works at the city’s art school as a teacher of The History of Arts. Karine mentions that she likes her work very much and does her best to organize interesting and informative lessons for her pupils, who have chosen the way of art which is so nice and magical.

Karine is asking for this loan of 690,000 AMD as she wants to buy a computer and also some accessories for it. It will serve as a way of self-development for her, as it will be the source of awareness of all the news in the world of arts.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also some accessories for it and it will serve as a way of self-development for her.

loans.name: Emilse María

texts.es: Emilse de 65 años es una mujer con una increíble vitalidad, ella es una confeccionista que durante años se ha dedicado al oficio y desde niña aprendió esta labor de su madre. Ella vive con su cónyuge y es madre de cuatro hijos, su taller está ubicado en su vivienda y confecciona paños de algodón y ropa para dama a almacenes en el centro de la ciudad.  Durante 40 años ha apoyado a  su cónyuge con los gastos en el hogar y en la actualidad realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar materias primas: telas de algodón, hilos, cremalleras entre otros. Emilse desea ampliar su gama de productos y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, por lo pronto está inversión le permitirá responder oportunamente a los requerimientos de sus clientes.
texts.en: Emilse, 65 years old is a woman with incredible vitality.  She is a clothing manufacturer who, over the years, has worked in this trade for a living.  She originally learned needlework from her mother when she was a little girl.  She lives with her spouse and is the mother of four children.  Her workshop is located in her home and she fabricates cotton cloth and women’s clothing for stores in the center of the city.  Over 40 years she has supported her spouse with home expenses and presently has completed a loan application, which is an opportunity to be linked to finances through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to buy premium materials: cotton fabrics, threads, zippers and others.  Emilse wants to expand her range of products and improve the conditions of her home, and this investment will allow her to respond opportunely to the requirements of her customers.

loans.use: to buy premium materials: cotton fabrics, threads, and zippers among others.

loans.name: Jose Ramón

texts.es:
Ramón, de 47 años de edad, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar y tienen tres hijos, dos que estudian bachillerato y uno que está en la escuela primaria. 

Ramón, se dedica a la agricultura, la ganadería y además a la venta de queso, él trabaja la agricultura con sus hijos cuando ellos tienen tiempo libre y vende queso casa por casa en la comunidad.

Ramón, necesita el préstamo para comprar 100 libras de queso, para aprovechar que sus hijos van a estar de vacaciones y ellos puedan salir a vender el producto.

Ramón, sueña con ver a sus hijos como profesionales y que tengan mejores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ramón, 47 years old, is married. His wife works at the domestic chores of the home and they have three children, two of whom study in high school and one who is in primary school. Ramón works in agriculture, animal husbandry and, additionally, selling cheese. He works in agriculture with his children when they have free time and sells cheese house by house in the community.

Ramón needs the loan to buy 100 pounds of cheese, to take advantage that his children are going to be on vacation and they can help go out to sell the product. Ramón dreams of seeing his children as professionals and that they have better work opportunities.

loans.use: to buy 100 pounds of cheese for selling.

loans.name: Chumi And Group

texts.en:
Chumi is 33 year old and comes from the Kamrup district of Assam. She is a widowed mother of two children. Bothl of them are attending local school in different grades. Besides being a housewife she also provides sewing services. She is the sole earner in the family. Therefore she works diligently to earn for her family with her sewing business. Currently she earns Rs. 3900 every month. She is worried that her current rate of earning would not help her sustain her family in the long run.

She wants to expand her business and increase her monthly earning. She will use the loan amount to purchase a sewing machine and raw materials to sew shirts, salwars, blouses, kurti and nighties etc. Chumi leads a group of 5 women – Babi, Ranju, Manju and Pramila.

Together they need a group loan to expand their respective businesses. They are grateful to their lenders for the financial support and encouragement.

loans.use: to purchase sewing machine and materials to sew shirts, salwars and kurti etc.

loans.name: Bukuba Grammar School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Denis. He is the Head Teacher of Bukuba Grammer School, a mixed school in the rural area of Mitoma town in Sheema district with 280 students.

Bukuba Grammer School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a Tulip water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced.

The loan will enable the school to purchase a Tulip Filtration water treatment system, With 5 Sets of 20 Litre Buckets which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Bukuba Grammer School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Denis ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es:
Ana de 36 años de edad, no estudió pero aprendió a escribir con ayuda de unas personas de la comunidad, es viuda y procreó cuatro hijos de los cuales uno falleció hace dos años y los otros tres viven con ella.

Ana se dedica a comprar y vender granos básicos, labor que lleva haciendo desde hace 10 años, el trabajo lo aprendió de su esposo quien se dedicaba a este oficio, además ella siempre se ha dedicado a los oficios del hogar, de modo que es una mujer luchadora que se esfuerza por sacar adelante a sus hijos sola.

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar maíz, frijol, arroz, etc. y continuar con su negocio de venta de granos básicos, ya que comprar al por mayor para que sea mas barato y sacarle más ganancias a la hora de venderlo.

Sus sueños son mejorar el negocio de venta de granos básicos y apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
36-year old Ana did not attend school but she learned to write with help from people in the community. She is a widow and has four children, one of whom died two years ago. The other three live with Ana.

She earns her living selling basic grains, a job she's had for ten years. She learned about selling grains from her husband who used to do this work. She is also in charge of household tasks.

Ana is a hardworking woman who makes a big effort to help her children get ahead even though she is alone. She is seeking a loan to buy corn, beans, rice etc. and continue with her business. Buying these items in bulk is cheaper so she earns more money when she sells them. Ana's greatest wishes are to improve her business selling grains and to support her children with their education.

loans.use: buy corn, beans, rice etc. and continue with her business selling basic grains

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 20-years-old single young lady from Qalqilya city. His father works in a public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. Thus income is barely covers all the family needs.

Sajida is a student in the university, where she studies Arabic language . She wants to take her BA degree and find a job in the future to support her father.

Sajida took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university fees for this semester. By taking this loan, Sajida will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

loans.use: to pay her university fees for this semester for a degree in the Arabic Language

loans.name: Lailani

texts.en:
Lailani sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy stringed instruments like violins and guitars for her buy-and-sell business, stock of books, and raw materials to make PE uniforms. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 30,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional materials and other supplies to increase her inventory and definitely grow her sales at the same time. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Lailani wants to improve their present financial status and give her family a better future. She also dreams that someday her shop will be able to make its own name in the local or even national market.

She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy stringed instruments such as violins and guitars for her buy-and-sell business, stock of books, and raw materials to make PE uniforms.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Thirty-five-year old Marites engages of basket weaving business.  She is married  and has two young children.
Her husband is a carpenter. She lives in the town of Antequera, Bohol.

She would like to increase her production, but the problem is the shortage of funds to acquire more materials.

Marites has requested  to buy basket materials like wicker (pliable twig and nito and buli (a kind of palm). These could help improve her both sources of livelihood and continue to expand her livelihood.

She is hoping that someday, she will continue improve her basket weaving business to continue support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy basket weaving materials like wicker (pliable twig), nito and buli (a kind of palm).

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 39 years old and married with six children. With five children in school, Lerma works very hard to provide for them.

Lerma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Lerma has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, biscuits, juices, vinegar, soy sauce, soap, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, Lerma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Jose Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime, de 39 años de edad, es comerciante y está casado, estudio hasta bachillerato, su esposa trabaja en un cafetin en la escuela de la comunidad y juntos tienen dos hijos que asisten a la escuela.

Jaime, tiene un pick-up en el cual hace viajes desde hace cinco años, pero también tiene un negocio familiar con su esposa, ellos trabajan en un cafetin en la escuela de la comunidad de lunes a viernes de 7:00 a.m. a 12:00 p.m.

Jaime, necesita el préstamo para comprar golosinas, dulces, bebidas y también para comprar verduras y frutas para salir a vender en su vehículo.

Jaime, sueña con ver a sus hijos estudiando y que se superen academicamente y mejorar el negocio para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jaime is 39 years old, a merchant, and married. He finished high-school. His wife works in a small cafe in the community's school and together they have two children, who attend school.

Jaime has a pick-up truck in which he has been making trips for five years. But he also has a family business with his wife. They work in a small cafe in the community's school from Monday to Friday, 7.00 am - 12.00 pm.

Jaime needs the loan to buy candy, sweets, and drinks and also to buy vegetables and fruit to sell from his vehicle.

Jaime's goals are to see his children studying and to succeed academically, and to improve his business to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy candy, sweets, drinks and also to buy vegetables and fruit to sell them from his vehicle.

loans.name: Ranogul

texts.ru: Раногул женщина в возрасте 41 года. Она проживает на районе Бохтар с мужем и детьми. У нее двое детей. Дочку зовут Бибичон ей 19 лет, сыну 18 лет его зовут Шукурчон. Шукурчон и Бибичон учатся в Университете. Они много стараются, и большое внимание уделяют учебе. Раногул конечно же поддерживает своих детей. Ее дети учатся на платной основе, и каждый год оплачивать за два обучения тяжело. И сейчас нужно внести оплату. Раногул по этой причине обратилась за кредитом. Также она планирует купить один ноутбук для их домашнего задания.
texts.en: Ranogul is a woman of 41 who lives in the Bohtar region with her husband and two children. Her daughter, Bibijon, is 19 and her son, Shukurjon, is 18. Shukurjon and Bibijon are both university students. They try hard and put their focus on their studies. Ranogul, of course, supports her children. She needs to pay for their studies every year, which is difficult since there are two of them. Now she needs to pay their tuition. For this reason she is looking for a loan. She also wants to buy a laptop so they can do their homework.

loans.use: to pay her children's university tuition and buy a laptop

loans.name: Dúo La Bendición 2 Group

texts.es:
Dúo La Bendición 2
Doña estela es la de la gabacha morada es dueña de una tortillería la bendición, es madre soltera y trabaja por sus hijos de 12 y 9 años de edad de los cuales los dos estudian ella quiere invertir en maíz, y en la compra de gas para vender por mayor ya que es difícil sacar para invertir por mayor sus clientes son personas vecinas, encargos de fábricas, y amigos ella tiene 2 empleadas quienes le ayudan a trabajar ella quiere agrandar su tortillería y poder ayudar a mas madres solteras sus metas son : mejorar la calidad de vida, fortalecer el negocio, pagar gastos de la casa  es en primer crédito que solicita a fape y espera la ayuda para su negocio.
texts.en:
Dúo La Bendición 2

Doña Estela is the one wearing the purple smock. She is the owner of a tortilla business called la bendición [the blessing]. She is a single mother and works to support her children, ages 12 and 9, who both study. She wants to invest in corn and in buying gas to sell wholesale, since it is difficult to achieve investing by wholesale. Her customers are neighbors, heads of factories, and friends. She has two employees who help her work. She wants to make her tortilla business bigger and be able to help more single mothers. Her goals are: to improve her quality of life, strengthen the business, and pay the expenses of the home. This is the first loan she is requesting from FAPE and she waits for help for her business.

loans.use: to buy corn and gas to sell.

loans.name: Batoul

texts.en:
Batoul is a 26-year-old married woman living with her husband and her child, who is still attending school. She cooperates with her husband, who works in the Lebanese army, to improve their lifestyles and be always able to meet their child's needs.

Two years ago, she decided to open her own business and opened a mobile shop in her town. She is a talented person and welcoming person; this allowed her to gain a good reputation in her town.

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her child’s school fees. The family's only target and dream is to see him achieving his education appropriately.

loans.use: to pay her child’s school fees.

loans.name: Tres De Mayo De Simatauca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO DE SIMATAUCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Genara ,la socia continua con su negocio de agricultura, La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua sembrando  maiz,papa,trigo entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abono entre otros.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de animales, negocio de venta de ganadería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank, "Tres de Mayo de Simatauca." This bank is located in the district of Chinchero, part of the province of Urubamba, and the city of Cusco.

Genara is a member of this group. She works in agriculture. She is thankful for those who have taken part in her dream through this group, and she is committed to making her payments within the determined repayment plan. She continues to grow corn, potatoes, wheat and other products that her clients request. She has had her business for a number of years and it is successful thanks to the effort that she puts forth every day. This is what allows her to carry her family forward. The member is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other products.

The other members of the group have businesses where they work with animals, sell livestock, have a grocery store, and sell animals.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Yesenia Marilu

texts.es:
Yessenia, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, se dedicó a ayudarles a sus padres a recolectar semilla de marañón para vender; actualmente está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y también le ayuda a ella en las ventas y sus hijos se encuentran estudiando.

Yessenia, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas y otros productos de primera necesidad, los cuales vende frente a la escuela de su comunidad; ella decidió colocar su negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa.

Yessenia, necesita el préstamo para surtir su negocio con golosinas y bebidas y para comprar ropa para salir a vender, porque se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y la ropa se vende bastante.

Yessenia, sueña con tener un mejor local donde pueda trabajar y generar más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Yessenia is 36 years old and a very enterprising and hard-working woman. She is earning a living by helping her parents to harvest cashew nuts for selling. At the moment, she has a partner who is earning a living in agriculture and also helps her with the selling. His children are going to school.

Yessenia has a little business of selling candy and other goods of basic need. She sells them in front of the community's school. She decided to start her business to help her husband with the household expenses.

Yessenia needs this loan to stock up her business with candy and drinks and to buy clothes for selling because the festivities at the end of the year are coming nearer and clothes sell quite well.

Yessenia's goal is to have a better shop, where she can work and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to stock up her business with candy and drinks and to buy clothes for selling, because the festivities at the end of the year are coming nearer and clothes sell quite well.

loans.name: Zind Newende Group

texts.fr: Awa est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle est âgée de 26 ans. Elle est dans la vente de ses pagnes au marché cela fait  5 ans qu'elle exerce son activité. Elle a besoin d'un prêt pour acheter 05 pièces de hitarget à 25 500 f, 05 pièces de réal à 20 000, et 5 bazins à 55 000 f pour vendre. Dans le marché, Awa est la seule qui vend des pagnes à bon prix ce qui fait marcher son activité, en plus de cela elle propose de la bonne qualité à ses clients. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire des épargne, de s'occuper de sa famille et aussi de continuer ses activités. elle a déjà reçu le prêt une fois et à rembourser à la bonne date prévue à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Awa is married and the mother of two children. She is 26 years old. She sells lengths of African print cloth at the market. She has been in this business for five years.

Awa needs a loan to buy five lengths of Hi-target (a brand of African print cloth) for 25,500 francs, five lengths of Réal (another brand of African print cloth) for 20,000 francs, and five lengths of damask cloth for 55,000 francs. In the market, Awa is the only one who sells lengths of African print cloth at a good price, which makes her business run smoothly. Moreover, the cloth she sells is of good quality.

After her sales, she will have a profit that allows her to put aside savings, take care of her family, and continue her business. She has already received one loan and she reimbursed ACFIME on the due date.

loans.use: to buy five lengths of Hi-target (a brand of African print cloth) for 25,500 francs, five lengths of Réal (African print cloth) for 20,000 francs, and five lengths of damask cloth for 55,000 francs.

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.ru: 18 летняя молодая талантливая рукодельница из города Турсунзаде. Эту красавицу зовут Сайехат. Она молодая, активная и шустрая девушка в семье. У нее есть одна сестра, и сестра научила Сайехат этому ремеслу. Сайехат 3 года назад начала зарабатывать самостоятельно и поддерживает родителей обеспечить семью. Сайехат шьет на машинке сестре. У нее старая и ручная швейная машинка. Сайехат хочет приобрести себе современную электронную машинку, чтобы расширить свою деятельность. Желаемая швейная машинка стоит дорого, по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Поддержите молодую красивую девушку достичь своих целей. Она будет очень рада за Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
This young, beautiful, talented 18-year-old craftsperson from the city of Tursun-zoda is called Sayohat. She is a smart and active young woman. She has one sister, who taught her this trade. Three years ago, Sayohat started earning her own money and supporting her parents by helping care for the family. She sews on her sister's old, mechanical sewing machine.

Sayohat wants to buy herself a modern electric sewing machine in order to expand her business. The sewing machine she wants is expensive, and for this reason she is looking for a loan. Please support this beautiful young woman to achieve her goals. She will be very happy due to your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a modern electric sewing machine

loans.name: Huaraypata Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HUARAYPATA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Juana  se dedica a la venta de flores y como actividad secundaria a la venta de pan. La socia tiene 52 años y cuatro hijos con los que sale adelante, su deseo es ampliar su negocio de venta de flores, aprovechando la temporada de fiestas de fin de año.
La socia solicito el crédito para comprar abono y flores.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de cereales, ganadería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.

Los socios que están adjuntos en la fotografía grupal, se les tomo la imagen separados por que pidieron permiso para llegar  tarde a su reunión por motivos de trabajo y salud.
Los socios están contentos y agradecidos con los inversionistas de KIVA por darles el crédito y confiar en ellos.
texts.en:
The members form the communal bank "Huaraypata". This bank is located in the district of Cusco, part of the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member Juana is earning a living by selling flowers and selling bread as a side business. She is 52 years old and has four children who financially depend on her. Her wish is to broaden her business of selling flowers, making use of the festival season at the end of the year.

The member was requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and flowers.

The other members are earning a living through their businesses of selling food, selling grains, raising cattle, a grocery store, and selling animals.

The members that are pictured next to the group photo are in individual photos because they excused themselves for coming late to the meeting because of work or health related reasons.

The members are happy and thankful to the Kiva investors for giving them a loan and trusting them.

loans.use: to buy flowers.

loans.name: Oyimkhol

texts.ru: Ойимхол 58 лет. Она простая и скромная женщина. Она живет со своей семьей в Шахритузком районе. Она занимается животноводством. Особую поддержку Ойимхол получает от своего мужа, который всегда помогает ей. Но из-за финансовых проблем семьи, она вынуждена была продать весь свой скот. В данный момент ей очень нужно в ближайшие дни купить несколько голов телят, так как основным источником дохода является её деятельность. Она очень верит и ждет, что ей помогут в трудную минуту и её семья не останется без средств существования.
texts.en: Oyimkhol is 58. She is a simple and modest woman who lives with her family in the Shahrituz region. She works in animal husbandry with the support of her husband, who always helps her. But due to family financial difficulties, she had to sell all her livestock. She needs to buy a few calves in the next few days since this business is a primary source of income for her. She trusts and expects that she will receive help in this difficult time and that her family will not end up without a means of making a living.

loans.use: to purchase a few calves

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
For almost 18 years, Jocelyn has been operating this “sari-sari” or variety store business in her community in Calumpang, General Santos City. She started with a few items like sachets of shampoo, cookies, candies, and repacked condiments. Little by little, she has added more supplies, and now she has wide options for her inventory.

Her income supplies their daily needs and monthly utilities, but she can hardly save enough for her goal of renovating the interior of their house. As a self-employed worker, she has no access to housing loans, even if it’s just for renovation purposes. She found the most awaited hope in CCT Credit Cooperative. As a long-time member of the cooperative, she already availed herself of several loans in the past that helped sustain her business.

This time, she applied for PHP 20,000, which she would use in the renovation of their house. She hopes you could grant her request and thanks you very much in advance.

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week. She draws strength and inspiration from their sharing of testimonies and reflection on the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the interior of her house.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her ice cream business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream business.

loans.name: Feruze

texts.en:
Feruze needs this loan to pay for a visitation to a health specialist because lately she's been feeling sick. Feruze is a retiree and lives with her retired husband in rural southeastern Albania where they own some acres of agricultural land and use it to plant and sell wheat. The annual grossing income from the wheat is roughly $1450 while the annual expenses are about $650. In addition to this annual income, they have their retirement pensions of $108/monthly each.
"We are retiree and we are both on monthly medication; that makes our pensions going all towards such causes. Thus, whatever we make from the agricultural is barely nothing. Sometimes our children help us financially, yet they are poor too...and can't help much," said Feruze to the loan officer who visited her at home.

loans.use: to pay for medical visitation and related expenses.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 48-year-old, single woman from Southern Ghour city which is considered as Jordan vegetable basket because of the farmland and fertile soil that is has. it is also considered as one of the underprivileged areas in the country.

She lives with her family in a small, old house and she is the supporter for her family, who depends on her for everything. Fatima has a store for parties’ supplies. It is the only center of its kind in the neighborhood. It is a good business and provides her with a good income.

Now she is applying for loan to buy a new chairs and tables and she will purchase new modern supplies for the parties. She hopes that this new inventory will enable her to increase her efficiency and speed and eventually save enough income to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new chairs and tables and she will purchase new modern supplies for the parties.

loans.name: Mourine

texts.en:
Mourine is 17 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, MOURINE has been working hard to manage her boutique, which owns a boutique business which sales clothes.

To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy new clothes to attract her customers during the festive season, and will help to generate greater profits and . Mourine hopes that in the future she will be able to own more branches of the same business so as to create jobs in her community.

She is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to attract her customers during the festive season,

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is 65 years old and she lives in Sevan city within the Gegharkunik region. She lives there with her husband, grandson and his wife. Julieta used to work at the kindergarten, then at the school as a teacher, but now she works at the market as a saleswoman. Her family’s other members are busy with farming. The house where the whole family lives has not been repaired for many years now and Julieta wants to surprise the young just married couple. She asks for this loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to do repairs to the sleeping room of her grandson and his wife. She is sure that this will be nice and unexpected surprise for them.

loans.use: to do repairs to the sleeping room of her grandson and his wife. She is sure that this will be nice and unexpected surprise for them.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
From Batasan, Quezon City, Ester has been an active member of CCT for years now, and she was able to acquire several previous loans to make a good profit from her business. She is 35 years old and she helps her husband to provide for their daily needs with income from her small convenience store. She works hard each day and she is confident that she is closer to reaching her goals.

Ester believes that business is her stepping stone to making her dreams come true. She knows how important it is for her neighbors and daily customers to have a nearby store where they can buy a sachet of shampoo, a bar of soap, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, an egg, toothpaste, or even an ice tube. Because she buys her products from a wholesaler at a lower price than she sells them, Ester makes some profit.

She wants to manage a bigger store someday, so she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan that she will use to buy additional groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She is positive that she will become a successful businesswoman in the future and she looks forward to seeing her child finish his studies through all her hard work and perseverance.

Ester meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein, an ambitious hardworking teenager, decided to establish his own bakery. He already has experience in this domain because he had to quit school during the elementary classes in order to work and support his five other family members.
Husein is 19, single, and the sole breadwinner in his family. He is skilled in his domain, and well-known in his region. He is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy the machines, tools and raw materials needed to establish his own business.
He is looking forward for developing and expanding his own business in the future.

loans.use: to buy the machines, tools and raw materials needed to establish his own business.

loans.name: Vanessa Yasmin

texts.es:
La señora Vanessa  de 36  años  de edad,  vive con sus tres hijos  en su casa de habitación en una aldea de Nacamoe, al sur de Honduras se dedica desde hace dos años al negocio de venta de abarrotería en general.  Sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que a diario visitan su negocio.
Doña Vanessa es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, con su esfuerzo a podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y a construido su casa.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de más abarrotería como ser: arroz, frijoles, maíz, pastas de tomate, churros, jabón, frescos, verduras, lácteos, embutidos,  pollo, etc.  Porque necesita invertir más en su negocio para tener surtido para la temporada de navidad porque sus ventas aumentan para esta época. 
Su sueño es graduar a sus hijos y poder ampliar más su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2015.
texts.en:
Vanessa is 36 years old and lives with her three children in her house in a neighborhood of Nacamoe in the south of Honduras. For two years, she has been earning a living by selling groceries. Her customers are neighbors and friends who visit her daily.

Vanessa is a hard-working woman with the desire to improve her financial situation. With her effort she has been able to provide for her sons and to build a house.

She is requesting the loan to buy more groceries like rice, beans, corn, tomato paste, churros, soap, drinks, vegetables, dairy, sausages, chicken, and so on. She has to invest more in her store to be assorted for the Christmas season because her sales increase during this time.

Her dream is to get her children to graduate and be able to extend her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2015

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn, tomato paste, churros, soap, drinks, vegetables, dairy, sausages, chicken, and so on, for her business.

loans.name: Sari

texts.en: Sari is a 35-year-old married man living with his wife and two young children who are still attending school. He has chosen to blur his face in the photo for personal reasons.  He is the main source of income for the family. He has his business-he owns a clothes store in his town- to fulfill his family's financial needs. Due to the hard financial situation, Sari is requesting for a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l to pay his children’s school fees. His only purpose is to help them attain high educational levels so they can achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to pay his children’s school fees.

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie is deeply encouraged by CCT, the Kiva program, and Kiva lenders for their kind hearts in lending him 20,000 PHP previously. It really helped improve his ice-cream-making business. He was able to buy another ice-cream cart and employ an additional vendor. It has encouraged him to be more diligent in growing his business and he is forever grateful for the help.

Once again he hopes that you will lend him funds in the amount of 50,000 PHP, mainly to buy more ingredients for ice-cream production. He will also start renovating his house. This is another step forward in reaching his many goals in life. You are such a blessing to him and his family. Countless blessings will be returned to you.

He meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from religion.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for his ice-cream production business and to start renovating his house.

loans.name: Saida Abigail

texts.es:
Saida, esta acompaña y es madre de un hijo, la familia comparte un mismo techo, sus actividades económicas son cultivar granos básicos y cuenta con empleo en un comedor, su pareja le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas, desde su niñez aprendió a trabajar en el comedor, ya que su madre es la propietaria, pero desde hace tres años está devengando un sueldo por ayudarle.
Iniciará a preparar la siembra de granos básicos en esta temporada, es por tal razón que ha solicitado un crédito con el que planea comprar insumos agrícolas, estos materiales serán de utilidad para eliminar la maleza en el terreno que sembrara granos básicos, otra parte del crédito lo destinara para hacer reparaciones a la vivienda, su objetivo es fortalecer su negocio y darle un techo más seguro a su familia.
Sus aspiraciones son fundar otro negocio para dejar de ser empleada, construir una casa y seguir luchando por sacar adelante a su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Saida is in a relationship and is the mother of one child. The family lives together in the same home. She works growing basic grains and also works in a restaurant. Her partner helps her with the agricultural work. During her childhood she learned how to work in the restaurant as her mother is the owner. But, for the last three years, she has started to earn a wage for helping her.

In this season, she will begin to prepare to sow the basic grains. This is why she has asked for a loan with which she plans to buy agricultural supplies which will be useful to get rid of the weeds in the field where she will sow the basic grains. She will use the other part of the loan to make repairs to her home. Her goal is to strengthen her business and provide a safer home for her family.

Her aspirations are to start another business to be able to leave her job, to build a home, and to continue to fight to carry her family forward.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies which will be useful to get rid of the weeds in her fields.

loans.name: Genrry Dagoberto

texts.es:
Genrry es un joven de 24 años de edad, estudio educación media (bachillerato). Actualmente está soltero y vive aún con sus padres y sus hermanos, por lo tanto solo ellos dependen de él.


Él es empleado de la unidad de salud del municipio, desempeñando la labor como promotor de salud  en la comunidad, este trabajo lo desempeña desde ya hace un año cuando la comunidad lo eligió para que desempeñara dicho trabajo, pero Genrry también se dedica a la instalación de tendidos eléctricos, esto lo aprendió hace 4 años ya que al instituto llegaron a impartir ese curso y él decidió aprenderlo, dicha actividad le ha servido de mucho, esto lo hace cuando lo buscan que instale energía en una casa y lo hace horas después que sale del trabajo de promotor ya que este último lo realiza de 7:00 am a 3.30 pm.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, lo necesita para comprar herramientas como taladros, pulidora y otras para instalar tendidos eléctricos, además comprará pollos.


Los sueños de Genrry son que Dios le dé vida para seguir trabajando y contratar a mas personas que le ayuden a realizar el trabajo.
texts.en:
Genrry is a 24-year-old young man with a secondary level education. Presently, he is single and still lives with his parents and siblings. Therefore, only they depend on him.

He is employed by the health unit of the local government, and he works as a health promoter in the community. He has worked in this job from a year ago when the community chose him to perform such work, but Genrry also works in the installation of electrical wiring. He learned this occupation 4 years ago because the institute came to teach this course and he decided to learn it. This activity has served him well. He does it when people are looking to install energy in a house and in the hours after he leaves his work as a promoter, since the latter is done from 7:00am to 3:30pm.

He needs the requested loan to buy tools like drills, buffers, and others to install electrical wiring, and also he will buy chickens.

Genrry's dreams are for God to give him life to continue working and to hire more people who will help him accomplish this work.

loans.use: to buy tools like drills, buffers, and others to install electrical wiring, and also to buy chickens.

loans.name: Héctor Manuel

texts.es:
Héctor de 23 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador, estudió hasta noveno grado de educación básica, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar, en casa viven 3 personas pero de él dependen solo dos.


 Él es agricultor,  toda su  vida ha trabajado en la siembra de maíz, frijol, su padre le ha enseñado el trabajo.  Héctor es un joven emprendedor que por dificultades de dinero no pudo seguir estudiando y la única forma de ayudar a su esposa e hija es la agricultura y la crianza de ganado pero a lo que más que se dedica es la agricultura, el lugar donde siembra está a 3 kilómetros de su casa y se va a pie y labora de 6 a 7 horas diarias.


Este crédito lo necesita para comprar una vaca lechera para aprovechar los residuos de la cosecha agrícola que pronto sacará.

Él sueña con darle estudios a su hija para que se prepare, sueña con un día tener muchas reces para dedicarse a vender leche y queso y tener un ingreso que le ayude a mejorar su situación económica y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Hector, 23 years old, is a hardworking young man. He studied until ninth grade of his basic education. He is married and his partner tends to the household chores. Three people live in the house but only two depend on him. 
He is a farmer. He has worked all of his life growing corn and beans. His father taught him the work. Héctor is an entrepreneurial young man who could not continue studying due to money issues. The only way for him to help his wife and daughter is agriculture and by raising cattle, but he works more in agriculture. The place where he grows is 3 kilometers from his home. He goes on foot and works 6 to 7 hours each day. 

He needs this loan to buy a milking cow to take advantage of the scraps from the agricultural harvest that he will soon have. 

He dreams of educating his daughter to prepare her. He dreams of one day having many cows, to work selling milk and cheese and to have earnings that help him to improve his financial situation and get his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow to take advantage of the scraps from the agricultural harvest that he will soon have.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mr Lan is 46 years old and he is married. He has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 6 years.
Lan lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. His family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is the latrine is not hygienic. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build toilet.

This is Lan first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With his business profit, Lan hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and for his children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven aquien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee un salon de belleza ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza su trabajo y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su abuela, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas y asi continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
The young woman's face was blurred out because she is 25 years old and lives in a high risk area.

She has been owning a beauty salon, located in her house, for three years. She has many customers due to the quality of her work. With the profit she makes she is able to cover some of her household expenses. The young woman lives in her own house with her grandmother.

She is requesting a loan to buy cremes, shampoo, hair barrettes, scissors, among other things. This way she can continue with her work because it is her source of income.

loans.use: to buy cremes, shampoo, hair barrettes, scissors, among other things.

loans.name: Hernan  Benigno

texts.es:
Hernan con 23 años de edad,de estado civil soltero,vive en casa familiar, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a las actividad de la cría y venta de animales menores, con un año de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y alimento para estos, dicha inversión le servirá para poder atender con mayor numero de ventas.

Hernan es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, con dos créditos anteriores, los cuáles pago de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Hernan is 23 years old and is single. He lives in the family house in a rural part of the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo province, in the department of Lambayeque, Peru. He has very good references both personal and for work from the residents of the area. The inhabitants of this place work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

He works raising and selling small animals, with one year's experience in the business. His business is located at his house. He is requesting a loan to buy animals and feed for them. This investment will serve him to be able to look after a greater number of sales.

Hernan is a repeat member of Edpyme Alternativa, with two previous loan which he paid off punctually.

loans.use: to buy animals and food for them.

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
Menchie was able to buy additional grocery items for her variety store business. She’s able to now provide more products to customers that helped her attract additional patrons.

She wants to extend her sincerest appreciation to lenders and Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for the financial assistance they’ve provided.

The business does not earn good profits all the time since there are also competitors in the same area, which she considers a challenge in the business, and late payments of customers as well. Menchie also aims to add more grocery products, cases of bottled drinks and toiletries since complete products will also produce good revenue, so that’s why she applied for a loan amount of 40,000 PHP.

Menchie is consistent in attending the weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members, and this is where she gains spiritual strength from members' life changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, repays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has improved her profit from her business. She was able to buy an additional unit and pay for the maintenance of her computer shop. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could further improve her business if you will let her borrow again an amount of 30,000 PHP. This new loan will go to supplies she needs in her shop and also to buy three more additional computer units she needs to improve her service and profit. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Lorie hopes to grow and expand soon. She desires to have a better life and a stable source of income to support the needs of her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional computer set to be used in her internet café.

loans.name: Eve

texts.en: Eve is a 26-year-old single lady with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a boutique business which she started with a hope of employing herself in order to earn an income for her family. In addition to clothing, she also owns a fresh fruit business in a busy market near Fort Portal town. She has a future vision of buying land and constructing a residential house for her family. Eve has asked for a loan to buy clothes to sell in her boutique business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell in her business.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is a 32-year-old hardworking married man with 3 children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He carries out bull fattening as a main source of earning a living and with the profits, he has been able to develop himself and look after his family. Apart from that, he also earns money to support his family from teaching. He has been dealing in the bull fattening business since 2012 and has a vision of expanding it into a big farm but faces the challenge of inadequate capital to meet the high demand as well as poor methods of rearing.

With the requested loan, Ivan intends to buy more bulls for fattening and will sell them later for a profit.
